property.name: PPSAMLProtocol
property.summary: Scenario to generate the SAML assertion for.
property.description: Select the SAML protocol to wrap up the SAML assertion.

property.name: PPSAMLResponseDestination
property.summary: Value of the optional destination attribute for the SAML 2.0 Response element.
property.description: A URI reference that indicates the address where this request was sent. This attribute is useful to prevent malicious forwarding of requests to unintended recipients, which is a required protection by some protocol bindings. If present, the actual recipient must check that the URI reference identifies the location at which the message was received. If the location is not checked, the request must be discarded. Some protocol bindings require the use of this attribute

property.name: PPResultWrapup
property.summary: Define how to wrap up the result being generated.
property.description: Select the method to output the result being generated. When the DataPower appliance is configured for SOAP or WS-Security processing, different output methods are used.

property.name: PPSAMLAssertionType
property.summary: Which SAML statements to include.
property.description: Specify the SAML statement types to generate for the SAML assertion.

property.name: PPSAMLSubjectConfirm
property.summary: Subject confirmation method for the SAML assertion.
property.description: Specify the methods so that the destination system can confirm the subject of the SAML assertion.

property.name: PPSAMLNameID
property.summary: Whether the generated token contains a Name Identifier.

description.p: The SAML Subject element cannot contain a Name Identifier, especially if the Subject confirmation method is holder of key. If holder of key, the key represents the same entity as the subject. In this case, the Name Identifier can be omitted.
Set to 'off' if the SAML assertion expected by the SAML SP, for any reason, decided not to require a Name Identifier for the SAML Subject element.

property.name: PPSAMLNameIDFormat
property.summary: The value of the optional Format attribute of the Name Identifier in the generated SAML query.

description.p: Specify a URI reference that represents the classification of string-based identifier information. Any standard or arbitrary URI is allowed. If the value is an empty string, the appliance attempts to determine the value from the AAA context.
Some SAML protocols require a specified value, such as 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:entity' or 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified'.

property.name: PPSAMLRecipient
property.summary: The value of the Recipient for SAML1.x Response or SAML 2.0 SubjectConfirmationData.

description.p: A URI that specifies the entity or location where an attesting entity can present the assertion. Any standard or arbitrary URI is allowed.

ul.li: If the value is an empty string, the optional attribute is not generated.
If the generated SAML assertion is in version 2.0, specifies the value for the Recipient attribute of the SubjectConfirmationData element.
If the generated SAML assertion is in version 1.x, specifies the value for the Recipient attribute of the Response element.

property.name: PPSAMLAudience
property.summary: Optional SAML Audience for the assertion.

description.p: SAML Audience is a URI reference that identifies an intended audience. Specify any number of audience URIs to process the generated SAML assertion.

ul.li: If the value is an empty string, the SAML audience is not restricted.
If there are more than one audience URIs, use the '+' character as the delimiter between URIs. In this case, if a URI contains real '+' characters, convert each '+' to '\+'.

property.name: PPSAMLOmitNotBefore
property.summary: Whether the assertion is considered valid in the past.

description.p: If true, the NotBefore attribute in the SAML assertion is omitted. The assertion is considered as valid in all its past, even before the time it was issued.
This behavior is a behavior being required to respond an AuthnRequest .

property.name: PPOneTimeUse
property.summary: Whether the generated token is for only one time use.

description.p: If true, the destination system or relying party should not cache the generated token.
The token being generated might contain the property for this characteristic, which is especially practical for SAML assertions.

property.name: PPSAMLProxy
property.summary: Whether SAML ProxyRestriction is needed.
property.description: If true, the generated SAML assertion provides limitations that the asserting party imposes on relying parties that in turn wish to act as asserting parties and issue subsequent assertions of their own on the basis of the information in the original assertion. A relying party acting as an asserting party must not issue an assertion that itself violates the restrictions specified in this condition on the basis of an assertion containing such a condition.

property.name: PPSAMLProxyAudience
property.summary: Who can issue subsequent assertions of their own on the basis of this assertion.

description.p: Specifies the set of audiences (proxy) to whom the asserting party permits new assertions to be issued on the basis of this assertion.

ul.li: If the value is an empty string, the assertion does not contain the Audience element in the ProxyRestriction element.
If there are more than one audience URIs, use the '+' character as the delimiter between URIs. If a URI contains real '+' characters, convert each '+' to '\+'.

property.name: PPSAMLProxyCount
property.summary: How many times can new assertions be issued before the ultimate use.

description.p: Specifies the maximum number of indirections that the asserting party permits between this assertion and the assertion that is ultimately issued on this basis.

A value of zero indicates that a relying party must not issue an assertion to another relying party on the basis of this assertion. If greater than zero, any assertions issued must contain a ProxyRestriction element with a Count value of at most one less than this value.
The maximum value is 65535.

property.name: PPSAMLAuthzAction
property.summary: Specify what action the subject can take on the resource.
property.description: Specify what standard action the subject is authorized to take on the resource. The SAML specification has defined a list of the action identifiers with corresponding namespace URI. Select an action identifier to generate the SAML Authorization statement action.

property.name: PPSAMLAttributes
property.summary: A list of SAML Attribute elements for the SAML assertion postprocessing method.
property.description: Define the information to put in the SAML assertion to generate the Attribute statement. Each SAML attribute requires the Name, NameFormat/Namespace, and Value. The value can be from a DataPower variable carrying predefined format, from a static string, or from the input message.

property.name: PPLTPAInsertCookie
property.summary: Insert a Set-Cookie header in the response.
property.description: Insert a Set-Cookie header in the response that contains the LTPA token that is generated during the postprocessing phase.

property.name: PPTAMPACPropagate
property.display: Generate IBM Security Access Manager Privilege Attribute Certificate token
property.summary: Place the existing IBM Security Access Manager Privilege Attribute Certificate token in a HTTP header.
property.description: The IBM Security Access Manager Privilege Attribute Certificate returned from a prior Authentication or Authorization is added to a HTTP header

property.name: PPTAMHeader
property.summary: The name of the HTTP header to store the token in.
property.description: The Privilege Attribute Certificate is stored in the HTTP header with the entered name. The default name is that used by IBM Security Access Manager WebSeal when placing the header in back-end connections.

property.name: PPTAMHeaderSize
property.display: Privilege Attribute Certificate header value size
property.summary: The maximum size of Privilege Attribute Certificate token allowed in a single header entry.
property.description: Some servers limit the size of HTTP header values. If the size is not zero then the Privilege Attribute Certificate token will be broken down to multiple headers of this length

property.name: PPKerberosUseS4U2Proxy
property.display: Use constrained delegation when generating Kerberos AP-REQ or SPNEGO tokens in this step.
property.summary: Uses S4U2Proxy (constrained delegation) during the authentication step to generate Kerberos tokens in this step.
property.description: Define whether to use constrained delegation during the authentication step to generate this step's Kerberos tokens in order to preserve the identity from the original incoming Kerberos token.

property.name: PPCookieAttributes
property.summary: Use a cookie attribute policy to include additional attributes in the cookie
property.description: Defines a policy for including standard or custom attributes in the cookie. The response message that contains a Set-Cookie header is updated with the attributes defined in the selected policy.

property.name: PPKerberosUseS4U2SelfAndS4U2Proxy
property.display: Use protocol transition and constrained delegation when generating Kerberos AP-REQ or SPNEGO tokens in this step.
property.summary: Uses S4U2Self (protocol transition) to generate a token to the DataPower appliance and subsequently uses S4U2Proxy (constrained delegation) to generate Kerberos tokens in this step.
property.description: Controls whether to use protocol transition to generate this step's Kerberos tokens to the DataPower appliance to transition from non-Kerberos authentication to Kerberos authentication and subsequently preserve the client identity in the Kerberos token that is generated in this step.

property.name: PPKerberosClientSource
property.summary: Where to get the Kerberos client principal
property.description: Specifies the source of the principal name of the Kerberos client. By default, the output of credential mapping in this AAA policy is used as the client principal name. The client principal is based on the authenticated identity that is followed by the corresponding realm name. For example, if the authenticated user is alice, the client principal name can be HTTP/alice.datapower.com@DATAPOWER.COM. The client principal must be present in the KDC for S4U2Self (protocol transition) to work.

property.name: PPKerberosSelf
property.summary: The principal name of the DataPower Gateway
property.description: Specifies the principal name of the DataPower Gateway when the DataPower Gateway supports S4U2Self that is known as protocol transition. S4U2Self allows the DataPower Gateway to obtain a service ticket from the KDC to itself on behalf of the user that authenticates to the DataPower Gateway by using a non-Kerberos mechanism, for example, by using an LTPA token.

property.name: PPKerberosSelfKeytab
property.summary: The keytab for the DataPower appliance
property.description: Specifies the name of an existing Kerberos keytab configuration that defines the keytab for the DataPower appliance. This keytab is required to authenticate the appliance to the KDC.

property.name: PPKerberosClientCustomURL
property.summary: Specify the URL of the custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file to use the value of its output as the Kerberos client principal
property.description:
Specifies the URL of a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file. This stylesheet or GatewayScript file returns the client principal name within the kerberos-client-principal element. This stylesheet or GatewayScript file gets the following input:
The output of all the steps that are executed in this AAA action
The incoming request message

property.name: PPKerberosClientCtxVar
property.summary: Enter a context variable to use its value as the Kerberos client principal
property.description: Specifies the context variable. The value of this context variable is used as the Kerberos client principal. This context variable must be specified in the var://context/name format. For example, var://context/AAA/krb-client-princ. You can use the set variable action to set this variable before you define the AAA policy.

property.name: PPKerberosServerSource
property.summary: Where to get the Kerberos server principal
property.description: Specifies the source of the principal name of the Kerberos server. By default, the server principal name is the value that is specified by the Kerberos server principal property.

property.name: PPKerberosServerCustomURL
property.summary: Specify the URL of the custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file to use the value of its output as the Kerberos server principal

description.p: Specifies the location of a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file. This stylesheet or GatewayScript file returns the server principal name within the kerberos-server-principal element. This stylesheet or GatewayScript file gets the following input:

ul.li: If constrained delegation is used, the output of only the identity extraction step
If constrained delegation is not used, the output of all the steps that are executed in this AAA action
The incoming request message

property.name: PPKerberosServerCtxVar
property.summary: Enter a context variable to use its value as the Kerberos server principal
property.description: Specifies a context variable. The value of this context variable is used as the Kerberos server principal. This context variable must be specified in the var://context/name format. For example, var://context/AAA/krb-server-princ. You can use the set variable action to set this variable before you define the AAA policy.

property.name: PPSSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: PPSSLClientProfile
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: PPLTPAKeyFilePasswordAlias
property.summary: The password alias of the password that decrypts the LTPA key file.
property.description: The key file password decrypts certain entries in a WebSphere LTPA key file (v1 and v2). This password is not applicable to Domino key files.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the password alias of the password that decrypts the LTPA key file.
property.label: Key file password alias

property.name: PPJWT
property.summary: Specify whether to generate a JWT token.
property.description: Control whether to generate a JWT token.

property.name: PPJWTGenerator
property.summary: Configure the JWT Generator.
property.description: Configure settings for JWT Generator, such as the credentials and generating methods.

property.name: Credential
property.description: Mapped credential name

property.name: Priority
property.description: Control the transaction scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand. High priority services are favored over lower priority services.

property.name: Authorization
property.description: Require authorization

value.name: dp-pdp
value.description: Not supported.

value.name: custom
value.description: Use a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file to map the AAA result and the input message to an XACML context and to generate the XACML context request to an XACML Policy Decision Point (PDP).

property.name: DeviceIP
property.summary: Enter the local management address as an IP address or host alias. Leave blank for any.

property.name: Domain
property.summary: Set the application domain. Set to (none) for any.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Set the resource type. Set to (all resources) for any.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Enter the name match for the resource as a PCRE.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Enter the local address match for the service as a PCRE.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Enter the local port match for the service as a PCRE.

property.name: Directory
property.summary: Enter the directory match for files as a PCRE.

property.name: Filename
property.summary: Enter the file name match for files as a PCRE.

property.name: Access
property.summary: Set the access privileges for resources that match the statement.

property.name: Access
property.description: With allow selected, the range of IP addresses is granted access to the service. With deny selected, the range of IP address is denied access to the service.

property.name: Address
property.description: An IP address and network mask that defines a contiguous range of IP addresses, either granted or denied access to the current service.

value.name: default
value.summary: Examine the content-type and determine whether to parse the response.
value.description: Examines the content-type in the response. If it indicates XML or is not provided, parse the response as XML. For any other value, store the response without parsing.

value.name: binary
value.description: Stores the response without parsing.

value.name: xml
value.description: Parses the response as XML.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: AddHeader
property.summary: Header Name
property.description: Enter the Header field name here.

property.name: AddValue
property.summary: Header Value
property.description: Enter the Header value (a string) here.

value.name: active
value.description: The DataPower appliance forces session affinity for every HTTP request irrespective of the need for session affinity by the remote server application.

value.name: activeConditional
value.description: The DataPower appliance forces session affinity when the remote server application indicates that session affinity is required. The list of monitored cookies is used to verify that the remote server is requesting session affinity.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: AllowCompression
property.summary: Allow Compression
property.description: If set to on and the protocol allows it, transactions matching this policy will use compression

value.name: never
value.summary: Never allow or reprocess a duplicate message.

value.name: always
value.summary: Always allow and reprocess a duplicate message. The DataPower Gateway uses a new record for the reprocessed transaction instead of updating the record for the previous transaction.

value.name: on-error
value.summary: Allow and reprocess a duplicate message only when an error occurs during the previous transaction. The error excludes failures in sending asynchronous MDN, ACK, or Receipt.

value.name: confidential
value.description: Confidential clients are capable of maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials, or capable of secure client authentication using other means. A web application is a confidential client.

value.name: public
value.summary: Public client - native application or user-agent-based application
value.description:
Public clients are incapable of maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials, and incapable of secure client authentication via any other means. Native applications and user-agent-based applications are public clients.
A native application is installed and executed on the device used by the resource owner.
In a user-agent-based application, the client code is downloaded from a web server and executes within a user-agent (for example, a web browser) on the device used by the resource owner.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Name of the burst limit scheme
property.description: Indicates the name of the burst limit scheme.

property.name: Burst
property.summary: Maximum allowed burst rate
property.description: Indicates the maximum allowed burst rate. The value of 0 indicates no limit. A message is rejected when the burst limit is exceeded.

property.name: Interval
property.summary: Time interval for the burst limit
property.description: Indicates the time interval for the burst limit. Specify a value that is greater than or equal to 1. The default value is 1.

property.name: Unit
property.summary: Time unit for the burst limit
property.description: Indicates the time unit for the burst limit. The default value is second.

property.name: CacheOnly
property.summary: Use the local cache first to enforce the burst limit
property.description: Specifies whether to use the local cache first to enforce the burst limit. In peer group mode, using the local cache first can prevent transaction delays if communication problems arise across the peer group. However, the transaction count is less precise when this setting is enabled.

property.name: IsClient
property.summary: Whether to apply the burst limit to the client
property.description: Indicates whether to apply the burst limit to the client or to an internal component. Client burst limits return a 429 error when exceeded. Non-client burst limits return a 503 error when exceeded.

property.name: UseApiName
property.summary: Whether to use the API name as part of the burst limit key
property.description: Indicates whether to use the API name as part of the burst limit key.

property.name: UseAppId
property.summary: Whether to use the application ID as part of the burst limit key
property.description: Indicates whether to use the application ID as part of the burst limit key.

property.name: UseClientId
property.summary: Whether to use the client ID as part of the burst limit key
property.description: Indicates whether to use the client ID as part of the burst limit key.

property.name: DynamicValue
property.summary: The dynamic value for the burst limit
property.description:
Indicates the dynamic value string for the burst limit, which should contain one or more context variables. The dynamic value makes it possible to use a context variable to enforce the burst limit based on parameters other than those defined in the burst limit scheme, such as a user name, incoming IP address, or server name. The context variable can be set in a GatewayScript action and then included in the dynamic value.
The following example uses the context object in a GatewayScript action to add the my.server variable to the API context.
context.set("my.server", "server34")
The dynamic value can then include the variable my.server , which resolves to the server name server34 .
The default value is an empty string.

value.name: second
value.description: The time unit for the burst limit is second.

value.name: minute
value.description: The time unit for the burst limit is minute.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Name of the count limit
property.description: Indicates the name of the count limit scheme.

property.name: Count
property.summary: Maximum count allowed
property.description: Indicates the maximum count that this limit will allow.

property.name: HardLimit
property.summary: Whether to enable hard limit

description.p: Indicates whether to reject requests when the specified count limit is reached.

ul.li: When enabled, the API Gateway rejects requests when the limit is exceeded.
When disabled, the API Gateway still handles the requests but produces a warning message.

description.p: By default, the API Gateway rejects requests when the limit is exceeded.

property.name: CacheOnly
property.summary: Use the local cache first to enforce the count limit
property.description: Specifies whether to use the local cache first to enforce the count limit. In peer group mode, using the local cache first can prevent transaction delays if communication problems arise across the peer group. However, the transaction count is less precise when this setting is enabled.

property.name: IsClient
property.summary: Whether to apply the count limit to the client
property.description: Indicates whether to apply the count limit to the client or to an internal component. Client count limits return a 429 error when exceeded. Non-client count limits return a 503 error when exceeded.

property.name: UseApiName
property.summary: Whether to use the API name as part of the count limit key
property.description: Indicates whether to use the API name as part of the count limit key.

property.name: UseAppId
property.summary: Whether to use the application ID as part of the count limit key
property.description: Indicates whether to use the application ID as part of the count limit key.

property.name: UseClientId
property.summary: Whether to use the client ID as part of the count limit key
property.description: Indicates whether to use the client ID as part of the count limit key.

property.name: DynamicValue
property.summary: The dynamic value for the count limit
property.description: Indicates the dynamic value string for the count limit, which should contain one or more context variables. The default value is an empty string.

property.description: Specifies the name of the data type.

property.name: Schema

property.description: Specifies the API schema object.

type.summary: Definition of the API Data Type

value.name: running
value.description: The API is running.

value.name: suspended
value.description: The API is suspended. When an API is suspended, you cannot access the API through any plan.

value.name: yes
value.summary: Share Rate Limit Count among all APIs under an application.
value.description: When set to yes, share Rate Limit Count among all APIs under an application.

value.name: no
value.summary: Don't share Rate Limit Count among all APIs under an application.
value.description: When set to no, don't share Rate Limit Count among all APIs under an application.

type.summary: Share Rate Limit Count among all APIs under an application.
type.description: Share Rate Limit Count among all APIs under an application.

value.name: header
value.description: Use value from HTTP header.

value.name: tls_cert
value.summary: Use value from TLS handshake client certificate.
value.description: Use value from TLS handshake client certificate.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the parameter
property.description: Specifies a name for your parameter. Parameter names are case sensitive.

property.name: Required
property.summary: Whether this parameter is mandatory
property.description: Controls whether the parameter is required for a call to be valid. By default, a parameter is optional.

property.name: Type
property.summary: The type of the parameter
property.description: Specifies the type of the parameter.

property.name: Where
property.summary: The location of the parameter
property.description: Specifies the location of the parameter.

property.name: SchemaOrFormat
property.summary: The schema or format depending on the location of the parameter
property.description:
Depending on the location of the parameter, specifies the schema or the format.
If the parameter is located in body , specify the schema that defines the input and output data types that are used for the body parameter. The definition follows JSON Schema Specification Draft 4.
If the parameter is not located in body , specify the format for the parameter type.

value.name: date
value.description: As defined by full-date - RFC3339

value.name: dateTime
value.description: As defined by date-time - RFC3339

value.name: path
value.description: A path parameter is part of the operation's URL but does not include the host or base path of the API. A path parameter should take the whole section or segment of the path URI. For example, in /items/{itemId} , the path parameter is itemId .

value.name: query
value.description: A query parameter is appended to the request URL. For example, in /items?id=### , the query parameter is id .

value.name: body
value.description: A body parameter is the payload that is appended to the HTTP request. You can define only one body parameter. The name of the body parameter has no effect on the parameter itself and is used for documentation purposes only. Because form parameters are also in the payload, body and form parameters cannot exist together for the same operation.

value.name: formdata
value.description:
A form parameter is used to describe the payload of an HTTP request when the consumable MIME type of the request content contains application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data or both. This is the only parameter type that can be used to send files. Because body parameters are also in the payload, body and form parameters cannot exist together for the same operation.
When the content type is application/x-www-form-urlencoded , the parameter format is similar to the format of query parameters but as a payload. For example, foo=1&bar=swagger indicates that both foo and bar are form parameters. This is normally used for simple parameters that are being transferred.
When the content type is multipart/form-data , each parameter takes a section in the payload with an internal header. For example, for the header Content-Disposition: form-data; name="submit-name" the name of the parameter is submit-name . This type of form parameters is more commonly used for file transfers.

value.name: header
value.description: Custom headers that are expected as part of the request.

property.name: PropertyName
property.summary: Name of the property
property.description: Specifies the name of the property. After a custom property is added, the assembly actions can reference the property through the property name.

property.name: Catalog
property.summary: Name of the API catalog that you want to set property value for
property.description: Specifies the name of an API catalog. The name must match the catalog name of an existing API collection. The default of asterisk (*) indicates that the value applies to all catalogs.

property.name: Value
property.summary: Property value for the specified API catalog
property.description: Specifies the property value for the API catalog.

property.name: Name

property.name: Rate

property.description: Indicates the maximum number of requests that the API Gateway can handle within a time interval. The value of 0 indicates no limit.

property.name: Interval

property.name: Unit

property.description: Indicates the time unit for the rate limit. The default value is second.

property.name: HardLimit

description.p: Indicates whether to reject requests when the specified rate limit is reached.

ul.li: When enabled, the API Gateway rejects requests when the limit is exceeded.
When disabled, the API Gateway still handles the requests but produces a warning message.

description.p: By default, the API Gateway does not reject requests when the limit is exceeded.

property.name: CacheOnly
property.summary: Use the local cache first to enforce the rate limit
property.description: Specifies whether to use the local cache first to enforce the rate limit. In peer group mode, using the local cache first can prevent transaction delays if communication problems arise across the peer group. However, the transaction count is less precise when this setting is enabled.

property.name: IsClient
property.summary: Whether to apply the rate limit to the client
property.description: Indicates whether to apply the rate limit to the client or to an internal component. Client rate limits return a 429 error when exceeded. Non-client rate limits return a 503 error when exceeded.

property.name: UseApiName

property.description: Indicates whether to use the API name as part of the rate limit key.

property.name: UseAppId

property.description: Indicates whether to use the client ID as part of the rate limit key.

property.name: DynamicValue

property.description:
Indicates the dynamic value string for the rate limit, which should contain one or more context variables. The dynamic value makes it possible to use a context variable to enforce the rate limit based on parameters other than those defined in the rate limit scheme, such as a user name, incoming IP address, or server name. The context variable can be set in a GatewayScript action and then included in the dynamic value.
The following example uses the context object in a GatewayScript action to add the my.server variable to the API context.
context.set("my.server", "server34")
The dynamic value can then include the variable my.server , which resolves to the server name server34 .
The default value is an empty string.

value.name: second

value.name: minute

property.name: StatusCode
property.summary: Status code
property.description: Enter the HTTP status code of the response message that this schema describes. The value can be the string "default", or any valid HTTP status code, like 200.

property.name: ResponseSchema
property.summary: Response schema
property.description: Specifies the API schema to describe the response message.

value.name: id
value.description: The credential type is client ID.

value.name: secret
value.description: The credential type is client secret.

value.name: header
value.description: Client credentials are sent in the request header.

value.name: query

type.name: dmAPISecurityOAuthFlow

value.name: implicit
value.summary: The Implicit flow corresponds to the implicit OAuth grant type.
value.description: In the implicit flow, the client receives the access token directly from the resource owner.

value.name: password
value.summary: The Password flow corresponds to the OAuth grant type of Resource Owner Password Credentials.
value.description: In the resource owner password credentials flow, the client uses password credentials of the resource owner to obtain authorization.

value.name: application
value.summary: The Application flow corresponds to the Client Credentials OAuth grant type.
value.description: In the client credentials flow, the client uses its own credentials to obtain authorization.

value.name: accessCode
value.summary: The Access code flow corresponds to the Authorization Code OAuth grant type.
value.description: In the authorization code flow, the client directs the resource owner to an intermediary authorization server. The server issues access token to the client after authenticating the client.

type.summary: Defines different types of OAuth flows. You create an OAuth security definition of a specific type according to the required OAuth grant type. Each of the flows corresponds to an OAuth grant type.

property.name: Name

property.description: Specifies the default parameter value as a string. The default value is used when no value is passed in the request. If you specify a JSON value as the default, enter the value as a JSON string. The default parameter value is required in the assembly function call action if no default value is specified in the assembly function.

property.summary: The path that identifies the content to redact or remove

description.p: Indicates the JSONata path expression that identifies the content to redact or remove.
You use a subset of JSONata notation to define the path. For more information about the supported subset of JSONata notation, see the "JSONata and assembly actions" topic in IBM Knowledge Center.

property.name: Action
property.summary: The actions for managing a variable
property.description: Indicates that you can set, add, or clear a variable.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The variable name
property.description: Specifies the name of the variable that you want to set, add, or clear. You can also reference a custom API property that resolves as the value. To reference an API property, use the $(api.properties.property_name) format, where property_name is the name of the property to reference. You can also use the short form $(property_name) when the assembly action does not have a property with the same name.

property.name: Type
property.summary: The data type of the variable
property.description: Specifies the data type of the variable that you want to set or add.

property.name: Value
property.summary: The value of the variable

description.p: Specifies the value of the variable that you want to set or add. You can also reference a custom API property that resolves as the value. To reference an API property, use the $(api.properties.property_name) format, where property_name is the name of the property to reference. You can also use the short form $(property_name) when the assembly action does not have a property with the same name.

When you assign value to the variable, follow these rules. Otherwise, error occurs and the current set variable action is terminated.
The value must match the specified data type: number, string, or Boolean.
When you assign value to the message.status.code variable, the value must be a valid HTTP status code.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Name of the parameter.
property.description: Specifies the name of the parameter.

property.summary: Label of the parameter.
property.description: Specifies the label to use for the parameter to explain it to API developers.

property.name: Description
property.summary: Description of the parameter.
property.description: Specifies a description of the parameter that can be used to advertise the parameter to API developers.

property.name: Schema
property.summary: API schema that is used to verify the parameter type.
property.description: Specifies the API schema that is used to verify the parameter type.

property.name: Value
property.summary: Default value of the parameter.

description.p: Specifies the default parameter value that is passed to the assembly function as a string. The default value is used when no value is passed in the request. If the default value is a JSON payload, enter the value as a JSON string. The default parameter value is required if the assembly function is called in an assembly function call action and no parameter value is defined in the action.

ul.li: When the assembly function is used as a user-defined policy in the API Connect Gateway Service.
When the assembly function is called in an assembly function call action and no default parameter value is defined in the action.

property.name: ValueType
property.summary: The type of the parameter value.
property.description: Specifies the type of the parameter value.

type.summary: Parameter to pass to the assembly function.
type.description: A parameter to pass to the assembly function.

type.name: dmAssemblyFunctionParameterValueType

value.name: string
value.description: Indicates that the value type is a string. The value is set on the parameter as a JSON string. For example, if the parameter name is foo , the value is set on local.parameter.foo in the API context. This setting is the default value.

value.name: payload
value.description: Indicates that the value type is a payload. The payload is set on the body key of the parameter as a binary blob. For example, if the parameter name is foo , the payload is set on local.parameter.foo.body in the API context. If the root of the payload value is a JSON object, it must include a space after the first opening curly bracket { . For an XML tree or JSON document, the payload must be explicitly parsed before being used.

value.name: message
value.description: Indicates that the value type is a message. The message contents are copied and set on the parameter. For example, if the message is foo and the parameter name is bar , then the keys and values of foo are copied and set on local.parameter.bar in the API context. The message must be a JSON object. The message must have a payload set to the body key. The payload cannot be a stream.

type.summary: The type of the parameter value

property.name: Condition
property.summary: The JSONata expression to match against the input
property.description: Specifies the JSONata expression to match against the input.

property.name: Execute
property.summary: The name of the API rule to run when the JSONata expression evaluates to true
property.description: Specifies the name of the API rule to run when the JSONata expression evaluates to true. The specified API rule can define further switch actions.

value.name: gather-only
value.summary: Write data to the API context
value.description: Write transaction data to the log variable in the API context.

value.name: send-only
value.summary: Send data to the analytics server
value.description: Send transaction data from the log variable in the API context to the analytics endpoint defined in the API collection.

value.name: gather-and-send
value.summary: Write data to the API context and send the data to the analytics server
value.description: Write transaction data to the log variable in the API context and send the data to the analytics endpoint defined in the API collection.

value.name: dynamic
value.summary: Deduce attachment format (MIME or DIME) from content

value.name: streaming
value.description: Allows messages attachments in streaming mode, but provides limited processing. Client requests in the form of a SOAP message package (that is, a SOAP message transmitted together with accompanying attachments) are supported. Processing can be applied to each attachment individually. The system will not build a manifest of all attachments and attachments must be accessed and processed in the order in which they appear in the document.

value.name: unprocessed
value.description: Allows messages with attachements but but does not process the attachments. This option permits forwarding of large attachments. root part of the message (typically containing a SOAP message) is subject to filter or transform actions. Accompanying documents can be passed intact to the server. No processing on parts other than the root part is possible.

property.name: ProfileGroup
property.summary: Name of the profile group.
property.description: Specifies the name of the profile group to attach.

property.name: GroupEnabled
property.summary: Whether to enable the profile group
property.description: Controls whether the profile group is enabled. This setting does not modify the administrative state in the B2B Partner Profile Group object.

property.name: PartnerProfile
property.summary: Name of the partner profile
property.description: Specifies the name of the partner profile to attach.

property.name: ProfileEnabled
property.summary: Whether to enable the profile
property.description: Controls whether the profile is enabled. This setting does not modify the administrative state in the B2B Partner Profile object.

property.name: ProfileDest
property.summary: Profile Destination

description.p: Specific the destination for this partner. The default is default , which uses the setting in the B2B Profile object.
This setting overrides the setting in the B2B Profile object. This setting does not modify the destination in the B2B Partner Profile object.

value.summary: AS Input message seen from viewer

value.name: OutMessage

value.summary: ebMS2 ACK seen from viewer (including positive ACK and negative ACK)

value.name: EBMS3InMessage

value.name: EBMS3OutMessage

value.name: EBMS3OutRCPT
value.summary: ebMS3 Receipt seen from viewer (including positive receipt and negative receipt)

value.name: auto-detect
value.summary: The B2B Gateway detects automatically whether the message payload is processed in binary mode or ASCII mode, and then complete the transfer accordingly.

value.name: enforce
value.summary: The B2B Gateway transfers the message payload in binary mode regardless of protocol flags, which ensures that the message payload is transferred unaltered.

property.name: FamilyName
property.summary: Family name
property.description: Specifies the family name of the person to contact. A family name is the surname borne by family members.

property.name: GivenName
property.summary: Given name
property.description: Specifies the given name of the person to contact. A given name is the name used to identify an individual within a family.

property.name: Title
property.summary: Title
property.description: Specifies the title of the person to contact.

property.name: Phone
property.summary: Phone number
property.description: Specifies the telephone number to use for the person to contact.

property.name: Email
