property.description: Specifies the e-mail address to use for the person to contact.

property.name: CPA
property.summary: CPA
property.description: Indicates the CPA to attach.

property.name: Collaboration
property.summary: Value of Service element in outbound ebMS request
property.description: Indicates the service to attach. A service is either a business collaboration service for exchanging business messages, or an MSH signal service for exchanging MSH signals, including Acknowledgment, Error, StatusRequest, StatusResponse, Ping, and Pong. The value of an MSH signal service is "urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-msg:service"; A value other than this one represents a business collaboration service.

property.name: InternalPartner
property.summary: Name of the internal partner profile
property.description: Indicates the name of the internal partner profile to attach.

property.name: ExternalPartner
property.summary: Name of the external partner profile
property.description: Indicates the name of the external partner profile to attach.

property.name: DestName
property.summary: Name to identify the destination
property.description: Specify the name to identify this destination in the profile.

property.name: DestURL
property.summary: URL for the destination

description.p:
Specify the URL for the destination. The URL is parsed to determine the protocol to use. To use a load balancer, specify the name of an existing Load Balancer Group instead of the address-port pair in the URL.
If the URL starts with as1:// or dpsmtp://, the service uses the ESMTP protocol. These protocols require an SMTP server connection and e-mail address. Specify the URL in either of the following formats:
as1://mailExchange[:port][/queryParameters]
dpsmtp://mailExchange[:port][/queryParameters]
If the URL starts with as2://, ebms2://, ebms3://, or http://, the service uses the HTTP protocol. The syntax for the URL is in the format of hostname:port/uri .
If the URL starts with as2s://, ebms2s://, ebms3s://, or https://, the service uses the HTTPS protocol. The syntax for the URL is in the format of hostname:port/uri .
If the URL starts with as3:// or ftp://, the service uses the FTP protocol.
For an absolute path to the root directory, specify the URL in the format of ftp://user:password@host/%2Fpath . %2F is the URL encoding of a forward slash.
For a relative path to the login directory of the user, specify the URL in the format of ftp://user:password@host:port/path .
If the URL starts with sftp://, the service uses the SSH FTP protocol.
For an absolute path to the root directory, specify the URL in the format of sftp://host:port/path .
For a relative path to the login directory of the user, specify the URL in the format of sftp://host:port/~/path .
If the URL starts with dpnfs://, the service uses the NFS protocol.
For static mounts, specify the URL in the format of dpnfs://MountObjectName , where MountObjectName is the name of an existing NFS mount.
For dynamic mounts, specify the URL in the format of dpnfs://host or dpnfs://host/path .
If the URL starts with dpims:// or dpimsssl://, the service uses the IMS protocol. Specify the URL in either of the following formats:
dpims://Connect-object/?parameters
dpimsssl://Connect-object/?parameters
If the URL starts with dpmq://, the service uses the IBM MQ protocol. The queue manager that is referenced in the URL must exist in the current application domain.
To send a message, specify the URL in the format of dpmq://mqQueueManagerObject/URI?RequestQueue=requestQueueName;queryParameters .
To retrieve a message, specify the URL in the format of dpmq://mqQueueManagerObject/URI?ReplyQueue=replyQueueName;queryParameters .
If the URL starts with mq://, the protocol is for dynamic routing.
If the URL starts with dpmqfte://, the service uses the IBM MQ-FTE protocol. The queue manager that is referenced in the URL must exist in the current application domain.
To send a message, specify the URL in the format of dpmqfte://queue_manager_name/?RequestQueue=request_queue_name;queryParameters .
To retrieve a message, specify the URL in the format of dpmqfte://queue_manager_name/?ReplyQueue=reply_queue_name;queryParameters .
If the URL starts with mqfte://, the protocol is for dynamic routing.
If the URL starts with dptibems://, the service uses the TIBCO EMS protocol. The server that is referenced in the URL must exist.
To send a message, specify the URL in the format of dptibems://server-object/?RequestQueue=queue;RequestReply=queue;query-parameters .
To retrieve a message, specify the URL in the format of dptibems://server-object/?ReplyQueue=queue;query-parameters .
If the URL starts with tibems://, the protocol is for dynamic routing.
This protocol is available on licensed DataPower Gateways only.
If the URL starts with dpwasjms://, the service uses the WebSphere JMS protocol. The server that is referenced in the URL must exist.
To send a message to a request queue, specify the URL in the format of dpwasjms://server-object/?RequestQueue=queue;RequestReply=queue;query-parameters .
To send a message to a request topic space, specify the URL in the format of dpwasjms://server-object/?RequestTopicSpace=topic-space;RequestReply=queue;query-parameters .
To retrieve a message from a reply queue, specify the URL in the format of dpwasjms://server-object/?ReplyQueue=queue;query-parameters .
To retrieve a message from a reply topic space, specify the URL in the format of dpwasjms://server-object/?ReplyTopicSpace=topic-space;query-parameters .

property.name: EnabledDocType
property.summary: Enabled document type
property.description: Indicates which document types to support.

property.name: SMTPServerConnection
property.summary: SMTP server configuration
property.description: The SMTP server connection to which to send e-mail messages. By default, the gateway uses the default SMTP server connection.

property.name: EmailAddress
property.summary: Destination e-mail address for messages
property.description: The destination e-mail address for messages sent to this partner.

property.name: SSHClientConnection
property.summary: SSH client connection profile
property.description: Specifies the SSH profile used for SSH client connection and authentication.

property.name: UseUniqueFilenames
property.summary: Use unique file names

description.p: Specifies whether to enable the generation of a unique file name for puts to a remote directory.

If you enable the use of a unique file name:
Specifying a directory in the destination URL generates a unique file name for puts to a remote directory.
Specifying a file name in the destination URL generates a unique file name that is appended to the specified file name for puts to a remote directory.
Note: On the SFTP protocol, if the specified file name is unique to the remote directory, the DataPower Gateway generates the same file name as what you specify in the destination URL. For example, specify host/01/temp in the SFTP destination URL:
If there is no file named temp in the directory, the generated file is host/01/temp .
If a file named temp already exists in the directory, the generated file is host/01/temp.unique .

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: Sets the SSL proxy profile to establish an SSL-enabled, secured connection.

property.name: OverrideTimeout
property.summary: Override timeout
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds to maintain an idle connection. Use any value of 3 - 7200. The default value is 300.

property.name: EnableFTPSettings
property.summary: Control for AS3/FTP settings

description.p: Indicates whether to override the FTP client policy for the user agent that is associated with the B2B Gateway. This user agent is defined in the XML manager assigned to the B2B Gateway.

ul.li: When When enabled, define overrides to the original FTP client policy with the advanced AS3 or FTP settings.
When disabled, uses the original FTP client policy.

description.p: The default behavior is off.

property.name: UserName
property.summary: User name
property.description: Overrides the user name in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses.

property.name: Password
property.summary: Password
property.description: Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password alias
property.description: Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses.

property.name: EBMSMPCAuthMethod
property.summary: How MPC authenticates pull request
property.description: Specifies how the MPC authenticates the incoming pull requests. By default, the MPC authenticates requests through username token.

property.name: UserNameToken
property.summary: Username token to secure messages
property.description:
For ebMS3, the DataPower Gateway applies the Web Services Security UsernameToken to authorize the received messages. Enter the user name for the wsse:UsernameToken element to be packaged into the SOAP header of the message to send.
For one-way push exchange pattern, specify the username token to be packaged into messages to send.
For one-way pull exchange pattern outbound messages, when the MPC authentication method is username token, specify the user name that is used for storing messages in the MPC.
For one-way pull exchange pattern inbound messages, specify the username token to be packaged into the pull request.

property.name: UserNameTokenPassword
property.summary: Username token password
property.description: Enter the password of the user name for the wsse:UsernameToken element.

property.name: UserNameTokenPasswordAlias
property.summary: Username token password alias
property.description: Select the password alias of the user name for the wsse:UsernameToken element.

property.name: EBMSMPCVerifyValCred
property.summary: Validation credential to secure messages
property.description: When the MPC authentication method is validation credential, specifies the certificate to be associated to messages that are submitted to the MPC.

property.name: Passive
property.summary: Controls the use of FTP Passive mode

description.p: Overrides the Passive Mode setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use the passive mode with the FTP PASV command.

property.name: AuthTLS
property.summary: Controls the use of TLS to secure connections

description.p: Overrides the Encrypt Command Connection setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use authentication and encryption of the command channel with the FTP AUTH TLS command.

property.name: UseCCC
property.summary: Controls the use of command encryption after authentication

description.p: Overrides the Stop Command Encryption After Authentication setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use command channel encryption after user authentication with the FTP CCC command.

property.name: EncryptData
property.summary: Controls encryption of file transfers

description.p: Overrides the Encrypt File Transfers setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use data connection encryption with the FTP PROT P command.

property.name: DataType
property.summary: Data type of file transfers
property.description: Overrides the Data Type setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to transfer data.

property.name: SlashSTOU
property.display: Write unique filename if trailing slash
property.summary: Controls unique files if name contains a trailing slash

description.p: Overrides the unique filename if trailing slash setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use sever-generated unique file names when the URL being written to ends in a slash.

Some FTP servers provide the STOU command. Use the command only if the FTP server supports this command. The STOU command allows the FTP server to choose the unique file name in the current directory. Using the STOU command does not require the client to choose a unique file name.
When enabled and a URL being written to ends in a /, the FTP server uses the STOU command instead of the STOR command.

property.name: QuotedCommands
property.summary: FTP quoted commands list

description.p: Overrides the Quoted Commands setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, specify the FTP Quoted Commands List to send to the FTP server before each STOU, STOR, or RETR command.

A typical use would be to use SITE commands, such as SITE RECFM=FB for the MVS domain on a z/OS system. The commands in the list cannot be data-transfer related, such as STOU, RETR, PORT, PASV, and so forth.

property.name: SizeCheck
property.summary: Constrols the use of a size check after file transfer

description.p: Overrides the Size Check setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use a size check after a data transfer with the FTP SIZE command.

If optional and the FTP server does not support the SIZE command, no error results. Some FTP servers, particularly vsftpd in the default configuration, provide inaccurate responses for files transferred in ASCII mode. If you get such errors, disable this feature. Alternatively, you can reconfigure vsftpd.

property.name: BinaryTransferMode
property.summary: Whether to transfer the message payload in binary mode.
property.description: Controls whether to transfer the message payload in binary mode.

property.name: ASCompress
property.summary: Whether to compress messages
property.description: Controls whether to compress the body of outbound AS messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: ASCompressBeforeSign
property.summary: Whether to compress before signing

description.p: Controls whether to compress the body of outbound AS messages before signing. The default behavior is off.

ul.li: If enabled, compresses the message body before signing.
If disabled, signs the message before compressing the message body.

property.name: ASSendUnsigned
property.summary: Whether to override the signing of messages to this destination

description.p: Controls whether to override the signing of messages to this destination. Whether to sign outbound message is part of the configuration of the internal partner. This property cannot be used to cause a message to be signed. The default behavior is off.

ul.li: If enabled, never signs messages.
If disabled, signs messages if the sender has signing credentials.

property.name: ASEncrypt
property.summary: Whether to encrypt messages
property.description: Controls whether to encrypt the body of outgoing AS messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: ASEncryptCert
property.summary: Certificate to encrypt outbound AS messages
property.description: Sets the certificate that encrypts outbound messages. Use the name of a certificate.

property.name: ASMDNRequest
property.summary: Whether to request an MDN
property.description: Controls whether to request an MDN for outbound AS messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: ASMDNRequestAsync
property.summary: Whether the MDN request is synchronous or asynchronous

description.p: Controls whether the MDN request for outbound AS messages is asynchronous. The default behavior is off.

ul.li: If enabled, the MDN request is asynchronous
If disabled, the MDN request is synchronous

property.name: AS1MDNRedirectEmail
property.summary: Specifies the redirection e-mail address for an AS1 MDN
property.description: The explicit, redirection e-mail for the MDN to outbound AS1 messages. The partner that receives the outbound AS1 message will send the MDN to this e-mail address. If not specified, the redirection e-mail will be the From address of the outgoing message (the default e-mail address of the sending internal partner).

property.name: AS2MDNRedirectURL
property.summary: Redirection URL for an AS2 MDN
property.description: Specifies the explicit, redirection URL for the MDN to outbound AS2 messages.

property.name: AS3MDNRedirectURL
property.summary: Redirection URL for an AS3 MDN
property.description: Specifies the explicit, redirection URL for the MDN to outbound AS3 messages.

property.name: ASMDNRequestSigned
property.summary: Whether to request a signed MDN
property.description: Controls whether to request a signed MDN, as opposed to an unsigned one. The default behavior is off.

property.name: Retransmit
property.summary: Whether to retransmit messages
property.description: Controls whether to enable the logic for the retransmission of messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: ACKTime
property.summary: Time to wait before the retransmission of a message.
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds to wait for the acknowledgment before the retransmission of a message. Use an integer between 1 through 3600. The default value is 1800.

property.name: MaxResends
property.summary: Maximum number of retransmissions
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of times to attempt the retransmission of a message. Use an integer between 1 through 30. The default value is 3.

property.name: ASEncryptAlg
property.summary: AS Symmetric encryption algorithm
property.description: Sets the symmetric encryption algorithm that encrypts outbound AS messages.

property.name: ASMDNRequestSignedAlgs
property.summary: Which digest algorithms to request for a signed MDN

description.p: Controls which digest algorithms to ask for when requesting a signed MDN. The value can be a single algorithm or any combination of two or more different algorithms that are separated by a comma. For example, md5,sha256 . The default value is sha1,md5 . The following algorithms are supported.

ul.li: sha1 or sha-1
sha256 or sha-256
sha384 or sha-384
sha512 or sha-512

property.name: EBMSCpaId
property.summary: CPA ID
property.description: Specifies the CPA ID in the message that is sent to the destination partner. You can use the value to identify the sender and the recipient. This value is used when the B2B Gateway is not CPA-enforced.

property.name: EBMSService
property.summary: Value of service element in outbound ebMS2 request
property.description: Specifies the service that acts on the message. For example, urn:services:SupplierOrderProcessing . This value is used when the B2B Gateway is not CPA-enforced. The value can be a string or a URI. If a non-URI string is specified, you need to specify the value of Service Type.

property.name: EBMSServiceType
property.summary: Value of type attribute associated with Service
property.description: Specifies the value of the type attribute in the ebMS SOAP message. If you do not specify the service type, make sure that the service value is a URI.

property.name: EBMSAction
property.summary: Value of action element in outbound ebMS2 request
property.description: Specifies the action in a service. For example, NewPurchaseOrder . This value is used when the B2B Gateway is not CPA-enforced.

property.name: EBMSSendUnsigned
property.summary: Whether to override the signing of messages to this destination

description.p: Controls whether to override the signing of messages to this destination. Whether to sign outbound message is part of the configuration of the internal partner. This property cannot be used to cause a message to be signed. The default behavior is off.

ul.li: If enabled, never signs messages.
If disabled, signs messages if the sender has signing credentials.

property.name: EBMSEncrypt
property.summary: Whether to encrypt messages
property.description: Controls whether to encrypt the body of outgoing ebMS messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSEncryptCert
property.summary: Certificate to encrypt outbound messages
property.description: Sets the certificate that encrypts outbound messages. Use the name of a certificate.

property.name: EBMSEncryptAlg
property.summary: ebMS2 encryption algorithm
property.description: Sets the encryption algorithm that encrypts outbound ebMS2 messages.

property.name: EBMSDuplicateEliminationRequest
property.summary: Whether to request elimination of duplicate messages for outbound messages
property.description: Controls whether to request the receiving partner to check for duplicate messages for the outbound message. If enabled, the receiving business partner should ignore duplicate message received. The default behavior is on.

property.name: EBMSAckRequest
property.summary: Whether to request an Acknowledgment
property.description: Controls whether to request an Acknowledgment for outbound ebMS2 messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSAckRequestSigned
property.summary: Whether to request a signed Acknowledgment
property.description: Controls whether to request the Acknowledgment message signed. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSSyncReplyMode
property.summary: Whether the response/acknowledgment is synchronous or asynchronous
property.description: Select syncReplyMode parameter, which can be obtained from CPA, to indicate to the receiving partner whether to return the besiness response or Acknowledgment in the same connection. None means asynchronous by default.

property.name: EBMSRetry
property.summary: Whether to retransmit an unacknowledged message
property.description: Controls whether to enable the logic for the retransmission of unacknowledged outbound messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSMaxRetries
property.summary: Maximum number of retries
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of times, which can be obtained from a CPA, to attempt the retransmission of a message. Use an integer between 1 through 30. The default value is 3, which means a message sent can potentially be sent four times (the initiative one and successive 3 retries).

property.name: EBMSRetryInterval
property.summary: Time interval of each retry attempt
property.description: Specifies the interval in seconds between retry attempts. Use any value of 1 - 3600. This default is 1800.

property.name: EBMSIncludeTimeToLive
property.summary: Lifetime of the message
property.description:
Controls whether the sending partner includes the <TimeToLive> element in the outbound ebMS2 message header. The <TimeToLive> element indicates when the message expires.
If the receiving partner receives the message before it expires, the receiving partner accepts the message.
If the receiving partner receives the message after it expires, the receiving partner rejects the message.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: EBMSMessageExchangePattern
property.summary: Message exchange pattern
property.description: Select the message exchange pattern (MEP) to use. The MEP defines how a business partner exchanges messages with another business partner. The default value is one-way push.

property.name: EBMSMessagePartitionChannel
property.summary: Message partition channel
property.description: When the MEP is one-way pull, specify the message partition channel (MPC) to pull message from. In the one-way pull mode, a message remains in the MPC storage until the DataPower Gateway receives an authenticated and authorized pull request.

property.name: EBMSOutboundRequestReceipt
property.summary: Whether to request a receipt for a sent message
property.description: Controls whether to request a receipt signal for a sent ebMS3 message. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSOutboundRequestSignedReceipt
property.summary: Whether to request the receipt to be signed
property.description: Controls whether to request the receipt message to be signed. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSOutboundReceiptReplyPattern
property.summary: Specify the pattern to send the receipt signal.
property.description: Specifies the pattern to send the receipt signal. The default behavior is response.

property.name: EBMSOutboundReceptionAwarenessNotification
property.summary: Whether to notify the message producer when the receipt for a sent message is not received
property.description: Controls whether to send a reception awareness error notification to the ebMS3 message producer. The default behavior is off. The DataPower Gateway reports a reception awareness error to the message producer if the receipt signal message is not received for a sent message.

property.name: EBMSOutboundReceptionAwarenessTimeout
property.summary: Maximum number of seconds to wait for the receipt
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds to wait for the receipt signal. Enter a value in the range 3 - 7200. The default value is 300. If the DataPower Gateway does not receive the receipt signal message for a sent message after this time, the DataPower Gateway sends a reception awareness error notification to the message producer.

property.name: EBMSCompress
property.summary: Whether to compress messages
property.description: Controls whether to compress the body of outbound ebMS messages. The default behavior is off.

value.name: as1
value.description: AS1 protocol identifier

value.name: as2
value.description: AS2 protocol identifier

value.name: as2s
value.description: AS2 over SSL protocol identifier

value.name: as3
value.description: AS3 protocol identifier

value.name: ebms2
value.description: ebMS2 protocol identifier

value.name: ebms2s
value.description: ebMS2 over SSL protocol identifier

value.name: ebms3
value.description: ebMS3 protocol identifier

value.name: ebms3s
value.description: ebMS3 over SSL protocol identifier

value.name: http
value.description: HTTP protocol identifier

value.name: https
value.description: HTTPS protocol identifier

value.name: ftp
value.description: FTP protocol identifier

value.name: sftp
value.description: SSH FTP protocol identifier

value.name: dpnfs
value.description: NFS protocol identifier

value.name: dpmq
value.description: IBM MQ protocol identifier for static routing

value.name: dpmqfte
value.description: IBM MQ-FTE protocol identifier for static routing

value.name: mq
value.description: IBM MQ protocol identifier for dynamic routing

value.name: mqfte
value.description: IBM MQ-FTE protocol identifier for dynamic routing

value.name: dpwasjms
value.description: WebSphere JMS protocol identifier

value.name: dptibems
value.description: TIBCO EMS protocol identifier for static routing

value.name: dpsmtp
value.description: E-mail over SMTP protocol identifier

value.name: tibems
value.description: TIBCO EMS protocol identifier for dynamic routing

value.name: dpims
value.description: IMS Connect protocol identifier

value.name: dpimsssl
value.description: IMS Connect over SSL protocol identifier

value.name: stylesheet
value.summary: Document Routing Preprocessor run as XSL stylesheet

value.name: gatewayscript
value.summary: Document Routing Preprocessor run as GatewayScript

value.name: EnableXML
value.description: Enables support for XML message bodies.

value.name: EnableX12
value.description: Enables support for EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) ANSI X12 message bodies.

value.name: EnableEDIFACT
value.description: Enables support for EDIFACT (Electronic Data Interchange for Administration, Commerce, and Transport) message bodies.

value.name: EnableBinary
value.description: Enables support for Binary message bodies.

property.name: PartnerProfile
property.summary: B2B Partner Profile
property.description: Specifies the name of the partner profile.

property.name: ProfileDest
property.summary: Profile Destination
property.description: Specific the name of a destination for this partner profile. Without this property, the configuration uses the first destination.

property.name: Hostname
property.summary: Replication Remote Hostname
property.description: The host name of the other appliance in the high availability cluster.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Replication Remote Port
property.description: The TCP port of replication listener running on the other appliance in the high availability cluster.

value.name: internal
value.description: Sets the partner as an internal partner. An internal partner receives inbound documents from the B2B Gateway and sends outbound documents to the B2B Gateway. An internal partner is a trading partner, probably in the same company, that implements some B2B processing logic and exchanges messages with the B2B Gateway with HTTP, IBM MQ, or some other non-AS protocol.

value.name: external
value.description: Sets the partner as an external partner. An external partner is a trading partner, usually in a separate company, that sends inbound documents to the B2B Gateway and receives outbound documents from the B2B Gateway using one of the supported B2B protocols.

value.name: secure
value.summary: Secure backup with keys and certificates.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set assigned to a specific HTTP proxy. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: UserName
property.summary: A user name
property.description: The user name used for BasicAuth.

property.name: Password
property.summary: A password
property.description: The password associated with the user name used for BasicAuth.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: A password alias
property.description: The password alias for the password associated with the user name used for BasicAuth.

value.name: default
value.description: Caches all failures.

value.name: disable-all
value.description: Caches no failures.

value.name: disable-ldap-failures
value.display: Disable for only LDAP connection failures
value.description: Caches failures except LDAP connection errors.

value.name: undefined
value.summary: The change type is unknown or undefined.

value.name: commit
value.summary: The change is as a result of a call to the Commit method on the object.

value.name: opstate
value.summary: The change is as a result of an op-state change on the object.

value.name: cpu-1
value.description: This fan is mounted to CPU 1. It is not field replaceable.

value.name: cpu-2
value.description: This fan is mounted to CPU 2. It is not field replaceable.

value.name: fan-tray-1
value.description: This fan is mounted in Fan Tray 1. If that Fan Tray is field replaceable, this fan is field replaceable.

value.name: fan-tray-2
value.description: This fan is mounted in Fan Tray 2. If that Fan Tray is field replaceable, this fan is field replaceable.

value.name: hard-disk-drive-tray
value.summary: Fan mounted in Hard Disk Drive Tray
value.description: This fan is mounted in the Hard Disk Drive Tray. This fan is field replaceable.

value.name: ok
value.description: This fan is present, and the measured speed is within the acceptable range.

value.name: failed-speed
value.summary: Fan has failed due to speed
value.description: This fan is present, and there is a speed reading available, and that speed reading is outside the acceptable range. This fan is not field replaceable, the entire unit must be replaced.

value.name: failed-speed-replaceable
value.summary: Fan has failed due to speed, field replaceable
value.description: This fan is present, and there is a speed reading available, and that speed reading is outside the acceptable range. This fan is in a Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), which needs to be replaced. The Location indicates which FRU.

value.name: failed-missing
value.summary: Fan has failed due to speed
value.description: There is no sensor reading available for this fan, probably because the Fan Tray is not in or connected to the system.

value.name: Request
value.description: Signifies the input of a server-originated document.

value.name: Response
value.description: Signifies the input of a client-originated document.

value.name: Fault
value.description: Signifies a fault condition.

value.name: AuthComplete
value.description: Signifies the completion of an authentication process.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Specify the JWT claim name.
property.description: Specify the name of the JWT claim. A claim name is always a string.

property.name: Value
property.summary: Specify the JWT claim value.
property.description: Specify the value of the JWT claim.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Specify the data type of the JWT claim value.
property.description: Specify the data type of the JWT claim value. The type can be string, boolean, or number.

value.name: string
value.summary: Indicate that the data type of the JWT claim value is string.
value.description: The data type of the JWT claim value is set as string.

value.name: bool
value.summary: Indicate that the data type of the JWT claim value is boolean.
value.description: The data type of the JWT claim value is set as boolean.

value.name: number
value.summary: Indicate that the data type of the JWT claim value is number.
value.description: The data type of the JWT claim value is set as number.

type.name: dmClientAuthOption

value.name: native
value.description: Uses API Connect for authentication.

value.name: third-party
value.description: Uses the specified user registry for authentication.

type.summary: Options for authenticating client using extracted credentials

value.name: code
value.summary: Use the authorization code grant type to obtain authorization.
value.description: Uses the authorization code grant type to obtain authorization. When selected, the authorization request uses the response_type=code parameter.

value.name: implicit
value.summary: Use the implicit grant type to obtain authorization.
value.description: Uses the implicit grant type to obtain authorization.

value.name: password
value.summary: Use the resource owner password credentials grant type to obtain authorization.
value.description: Uses the resource owner password credential grant type to obtain authorization.

value.name: client
value.summary: Use the client credentials grant type to obtain authorization.
value.description: Uses the client credentials grant type to obtain authorization.

value.name: code-id_token
value.display: Authorization Code with ID Token Response
value.summary: Use the authorization code grant type to obtain an access token and an ID token.
value.description: Uses the authorization code grant type to obtain an access token and an ID token. When selected, the authorization request uses the response_type=code id_token parameter.

property.name: ServiceName
property.summary: Service name
property.description: Service name associated with the enterprise application.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Host name or IP address of the application server.
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the application server.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Listening port on the application server
property.description: Specify the listening port number of the application server.

property.name: BackTimeout
property.summary: Maximum idle time for a server connection in a transaction
property.description: Specify the maximum idle time for server connections in a transaction. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. If the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The value of 0 indicates that the timer is disabled. The default value is 0.

property.name: ConnLimit
property.summary: Maximum number of concurrent client connections
property.description: Specify the maximum number of concurrent client connections to the service. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The value of 0 indicates an unlimited number of connections. The default value is 100.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: SSL proxy profile to secure the connection to the application server
property.description: Select an SSL proxy profile defined with the forward direction for SSL communications with the application server. The SSL proxy profile identifies the keys and certificates for the handshake.

value.name: tam
value.display: IBM Security Access Manager and Tivoli Federated Identity Manager

type.name: dmCommitMode

value.description: IMS Commit Mode 1.
IMS Commit Mode 0.

type.description: Commit Mode

type.name: dmCondition

property.name: Expression
property.summary: The expression to check for this conditional

property.name: ConditionAction
property.summary: The action to run if the expression was matched

type.display: Map XPath condition to Action to run
type.summary: XPath condition to check and action to run if it is found.
type.description: Used for the conditional action, this is a single condition which maps an XPath condition to search for in the input context to an action to run if it is found. If it is not found, then other conditions can be checked.

property.name: DeviceIP
property.summary: Local Management IP Address
property.description: Identifies the local management IP address of the device to which the statement is applied. Leave blank for all.

property.name: Domain
property.summary: Application Domain
property.description: Identifies the application domain to which the statement is applied. Select (none) for all.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Resource Type
property.description: Limits the statement to configuration with matching type. To match all types, select '(all resources)'.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Name Match PCRE
property.description: Limits the statement to resources with the specified names. Use a PCRE to select groups of resource instances.

property.name: Property
property.summary: Configuration Property Name
property.description: Limits the statement to the configuration property with the specified name.

property.name: Value
property.summary: Configuration Value Match PCR
property.description: Limits the statement to configuration with matching property values. Use a PCRE Match Expression to select groups of configuration property values.

property.name: Match
property.summary: Configuration Match
property.description:
Matching configuration is modified. To create a match statement, type a correctly formatted resource match in the horizontal text box select Build. Selecting Build displays the Configuration Match Builder in a popup window.
A match statement takes the following general form:
Addr / Domain / Resource [? Name=resource-name & Property=property-name & Value=property-value ]
AddrDevice Address. Specifies IP address or host alias. The value (*) matches all IP addresses.
DomainApplication Domain. The name of the application domain. The value (*) matches all domains.
ResourceResource Type. The name of the resource type. The value (*) matches all resource types.
Name=resource-nameAn additional specification field, such as "Name". Limits the match statement to resources of the specified name. Use a PCRE to select groups of resource instances. For example, "Name=foo.*" would match all resources with names that start with "foo".
Property=property-nameProperty Name. The name of the configuration property. Limits the match statement to resources of the specified property. If change specified, set property-name to null string.
Value=property-valueProperty Value. Specifies the value for the configuration property. This property limits the match statement to resources with the specified property value.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Modification Type
property.description: Selects the type of configuration modification.

property.name: Property
property.summary: Configuration Property
property.description: Specifies the name of the property to add.

property.name: Value
property.summary: Configuration Value
property.description: Specifies the value of the added or changed property. To change a property value, you can use an explicit value or a value that contains a variable in the ${ variable } format. If you use variables, you need a deployment policy variable configuration to map the variable to its replacement value. For example, when the value is ${newName} or ${newName}_Service , a referenced deployment policy variable configuration must map the newName variable to an explicit replacement value.

property.name: DeviceIP
property.summary: Local Management IP Address
property.description: Identifies the local management IP address of the device to which the statement is applied. Leave blank for all.

property.name: Domain
property.summary: Application Domain
property.description: Identifies the application domain to which the statement is applied. Select (none) for all.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Resource Type
property.description: Limits the statement to configuration with matching type. To match all types, select '(all resources)'.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Name Match PCRE
property.description: Limits the statement to resources with the specified names. Use a PCRE to select groups of resource instances.

property.name: Property
property.summary: Configuration Property Name
property.description: Limits the statement to the configuration property with the specified name.

property.name: Value
property.summary: Configuration Value Match PCR
property.description: Limits the statement to configuration with matching property values. Use a PCRE Match Expression to select groups of configuration property values.

property.name: ObjectClass
property.summary: The class type of the object.
property.description: Specify the class type of the object.

property.name: ObjectName
property.summary: The name of the object.
property.description: Specify the name of the object for the corresponding class type.

property.name: Directory
property.summary: Directory in the file system to watch for configuration file changes
property.description: Specifies the directory where configuration files are stored. DataPower scans the directory for configuration files that match a given PCRE pattern and runs only the matching files. By default, this directory is also where DataPower stores the output files generated by running the configuration files.

property.name: AccessProfileName
property.summary: Access profile that defines permissions to resources in the location
property.description: Specifies a list of access policies to enforce when running the files in the location, each policy defines permissions to a specific group of resources.

value.name: invalid
value.description: Invalid configuration

value.name: saved
value.description: Persisted configuration

value.name: new
value.description: New configuration

value.name: modified
value.description: Modified configuration

value.name: deleted
value.description: Deleted configuration

value.name: external
value.description: External configuration

type.name: dmConformanceRejectLevel

value.name: warning
value.summary: Reject messages with conformance warnings or failures

type.summary: Degree of nonconformance to cause the message to be rejected

type.name: dmConformanceReportLevel

value.name: failure
value.summary: Record conformance reports that indicate conformance failures

value.name: warning
value.summary: Record conformance reports that indicate conformance warnings or failures

type.summary: Degree of nonconformance to cause a conformance report to be recorded

value.name: blacklist
value.description: Indicates values to reject.

value.name: whitelist
value.description: Indicates values to accept.

type.name: dmCookieAttribute

value.name: domain
value.summary: Include the Domain attribute in the cookie.

value.name: path
value.summary: Include the Path attribute in the cookie.

value.name: secure
value.summary: Include the Secure attribute in the cookie.
value.description: Indicates that the cookie is transmitted only over an encrypted connection.

value.name: httponly
value.summary: Include the HttpOnly attribute in the cookie.
value.description: Indicates that the cookie is exposed only through HTTP and HTTPS channels. When this attribute is included, the cookie is not accessible through non-HTTP methods.

value.name: max-age
value.summary: Include the Max-Age attribute in the cookie.

value.name: expires
value.summary: Include the Expires attribute in the cookie.

value.name: custom
value.summary: Include custom attributes in the cookie.

type.summary: Select the attributes to include in the cookie.

value.name: none
value.description: The device does not perform any cryptographic action on outbound cookies.

value.name: sign
value.description: The device signs outbound cookies with the specified Key. When the client sends back the cookies, the device verifies and removes the signature.

value.name: encrypt
value.description: The device encrypts the contents of outbound cookies with the specified Key. When the client sends back the cookies, the device unencrypts the contents.

property.name: CookiePolicy
property.description: Select how the client side of the inspected transaction handles cookies. The default value is Allow.

property.name: Type
property.description: Specify whether the device signs/verifies, encrypts/decrypts, or neither on the cookies for the application. The default value is None.

property.name: Key
property.description: Signing or encrypting cookies requires a secret passphrase for the cryptographic operation. If this key is the same on multiple devices, then each device can statelessly verify or decrypt a cookie generated by another device.

property.name: IPinWatermark
property.description: Normally the signed or encrypted cookie contains the client IP address and this prevents the client from using this cookie from any other host. Some proxy server environments may make this undesirable. Turning this property off will make the generated cookies address independent.

property.name: CookieGNVC
property.summary: Name-value validation profile for cookie contents
property.description: The name-value profile for cookie contents. If not present, no profile is enforced. The profile allows you to validate data members of the cookie, filter out unknown ones, or map certain names to known values.

property.name: UseSharedSecretObject
property.summary: Signing or encrypting cookies using the shared secret
property.description: A shared secret signs or encrypts the cookie when enabled. The default value is disabled.

type.name: dmCountLimitAction

value.name: inc
value.description: Increase the current count by one. When the count limit is exceeded, an error is generated.

value.name: dec
value.description: Decrease the current count by one. If the current count is zero, the count is not changed.

type.summary: Action to apply to the count limit.

type.name: dmCountLimitInfo

property.name: Name
property.summary: Count limit name
property.description: The name of the count limit.

property.name: Action
property.summary: Count limit action
property.description: The action to apply to the count limit count.

type.description: Describes a count limit and action.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The threshold name
property.description: Enter the name of the threshold. This name appears in the log files when the threshold is reached.

property.name: Interval
property.summary: The measurementinterval
property.description: Enter the measurement interval in milliseconds. One second is expressed as 1000 here.

property.name: RateLimit
property.summary: The threshold value
property.description: Specify the threshold value as a number of messages. A monitored message type that exceeds this value over the measurement interval specified by the Interval property is subject to the policy identified by the Action values list.

property.name: BurstLimit
property.summary: Maximum allowed burst
property.description: Specify the maximum allowed message burst. Use a value approximately twice the value of Rate Limit.

property.name: Action
property.summary: Monitor policy
property.description: Select the monitor policy implemented by the monitor when the target message type exceeds the threshold value. This is a list of Message Filter Actions. Click the + button to create a new action.

value.name: all
value.description: Source address monitoring and information gathering is aggregated for the address range.

value.name: each-ip
value.description: Source address monitoring and information gathering is individualized for all IP addresses in the address range.

value.name: ip-from-header
value.description: Source address monitoring and information gathering is individualized for all IP addresses in the address range. IP addresses are determined by the value of the specified HTTP header.

value.name: requests
value.description: Increases the counter on the receipt of a client request of the target message type.

value.name: responses
value.description: Increases the counter on the receipt of a server response of the target message type.

value.name: xpath
value.description: Increases the counter on a call to the dp:increment-integer extension function from a custom stylesheet.

value.name: errors
value.description: Increases the counter on specific error responses. Responses that increment the counter are: connection errors, errors returned from the server and error rules from a multistep process.

property.name: Name
property.summary: ID of action binding
property.description: Specifies an ID for naming the action

property.name: Value
property.summary: Value of action
property.description: Specifies the value of Action. For outbound message, the value will be used in the Action element of the ebXML Message Header; for inbound transaction, the Action value will be used to identify the action binding for processing the incoming message within the Service.

property.name: Capability
property.summary: Type of action binding
property.description: Specifies the type of this action binding.

property.name: SenderSetting
property.summary: Setting for this sender action
property.description: Specifies the name of sender setting to bind. A sender setting defines the Message-sending characteristics in Delivery Channels. It consists of document-exchange configurations and transport configurations.

property.name: ReceiverSetting
property.summary: Setting for this receiver action
property.description: Specifies the name of receiver setting to bind. A receiver setting defines the Message-receiving characteristics in Delivery Channels. It consists of document-exchange configurations and transport configurations.

value.name: never
value.summary: Indicates that the incoming message should not have the request element present else it will fail.

value.name: always
value.summary: Indicates that the incoming message should have the request element present else it will fail.

value.name: perMessage
value.summary: Indicates that whether the request element present is a "perMessage" basis. And the request will be used for processing the inbound message in question.

value.name: never
value.summary: Do not make the particular request

value.name: cp1250
value.summary: Windows Central European and Eastern European

value.name: iso8859_1
value.summary: ISO-8859-1 Latin 1 including Albanian, Catalan, Danish, Dutch, English, Finnish, French, German, Italian, Norwegian, Portuguese, Spanish, and Swedish

value.name: iso8859_2
value.summary: ISO-8859-2 including Bosnian, Croatian, Czech, Hungarian, Polish, Romanian, Slovakian, and Slovenian

value.name: iso8859_4
value.summary: ISO-8859-4 including Estonian, Greenlandic, Latvian, Lithuanian, and Sami

value.name: iso8859_5
value.summary: ISO-8859-5 including Belarusian, Bulgarian, Kazakh, Macedonian, Russian, Serbian, Turkish, and Ukrainian

value.name: ignore
value.description: Ignores the certificate extension, if present.

value.name: require
value.description: Requires checks against, but does not fetch, the CRLs in the X.509 CRL Distribution Point extensions. If any CRL in a CRL Distribution Point extension no longer exists in the CRL cache, the certificate validation fails.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the CRL retrieval policy
property.description: Enter the name of the CRL retrieval policy.

property.name: FetchType
property.summary: The protocol used to obtain the CRL
property.description: Select the protocol used to obtain the CRL from the authority.

property.name: IssuerValcred
property.summary: Certificates of CRL issuer
property.description: A set of validation credentials used to verify the authenticity of the CRL issuer and thus the CRL. The certificate used by the CRL Issuer must be included in this Validation Credential in order for the CRL to be valid.

property.name: RefreshInterval
property.summary: Interval between CRL updates
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 1440, with a default of 240) specifying the interval, in minutes, between CRL updates.

property.name: DefaultStatus
property.summary: Certificate status if there is no current CRL available
property.description: The default status of a certificate -- ok or revoked -- if no current CRL is available in the cache.

property.name: CryptographicProfile
property.summary: The cryptographic profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: A profile describing the SSL credentials and configuration parameters to use when establishing a connection over SSL to fetch the CRL. May be used with both CRL fetch over HTTPS, and CRL fetch over LDAP over SSL.

property.name: URL
property.summary: URL of the Certificate Revocation List
property.description: A URL that specifies the location of the Certificate Revocation List -- required when the protocol used to obtain the CRL is HTTP.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the LDAP server from which to obtain the Certificate Revocation List. Required when the protocol is LDAP.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify an integer in the range of 1 through 65535 with a default of 389 that identifies the remote LDAP port. Required when the protocol is LDAP. For LDAP over SSL the standard port is 636.

property.name: DN
property.summary: DN of issuing CA
property.description: A string containing the DN (distinguished name) of the Certificate Authority that issued the target CRL. Required when the protocol is LDAP.

property.name: BindDN
property.summary: LDAP login
property.description: A string containing the DN (distinguished name) used to login to the LDAP server.

property.name: BindPass
property.summary: LDAP login password
property.description: A string containing the password used to login to the LDAP server.

property.name: BindPassAlias
property.summary: LDAP login password alias
property.description: A string containing the password alias of the password used to login to the LDAP server.

property.name: LDAPVersion
property.summary: LDAP version
property.description: Specify the LDAP version to be used.

property.name: LDAPReadTimeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the appliance closes the connection
property.description: Specify the number of seconds to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the appliance closes the LDAP connection. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 60. A value of 0 indicates that the connection never times out.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

value.description: This mode bans the algorithms that are not allowed in FIPS 140-2 Level 1. The banned algorithms include Blowfish, CAST, DES, MD2, MD4, MD5, RC2, RC4, and RIPEMD. This mode also bans RSA keys less than 1024 bits and disables the cryptographic hardware that is not FIPS validated.

type.name: dmCryptoSwATransform

value.name: MIMEContentOnly
value.description: Process MIME part content only.

value.name: MIMEContentAndHeader
value.description: Process both MIME part content and MIME part header.

type.description: Determines whether only the MIME part content is processed or whether both the MIME part content and header are processed

type.name: dmCryptoSwAVersion
type.description: The version of WS-Security SOAP Messages with Attachment (SwA) Profile

value.name: legacy
value.display: Match exact certificate or immediate issuer
value.description: The validation credentials contain either the exact peer certificate to match or the immediate issuer's certificate, which could be an intermediate CA or a root CA. This mode is maintained for backwards compatibility but Exact Match or PKIX are better choices in most cases.

value.name: pkix
value.description: The complete certificate chain is checked from subject to root when using the validation credentials for certificate validation. Validation succeeds only if the chain ends with a root certificate in the validation credentials. Non-root certificates in the validation credentials are used as untrusted intermediate certificates. Additional untrusted intermediate certificates are obtained dynamically from the context at hand (SSL handshake messages, PKCS#7 tokens, PKIPath tokens, and so forth).

value.name: exact-match
value.description: The validation credentials contain the exact peer certificate to match. This mode is useful when you want to match the peer certificate exactly, but that certificate is not necessarily a self-signed (root) certificate.

type.name: dmCryptoWSSSignatureTokenReferenceMechanism

value.name: Direct
value.description: A BinarySecurityToken is placed in the message and a Reference element with a URI fragment pointing to the BinarySecurityToken is used to refer to it.

value.name: KeyIdentifier
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a SubjectKeyIdentifier ValueType and content.

value.name: ThumbPrintSHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a ThumbPrintSHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the "WS-Security Version" is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: ThumbprintSHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a ThumbprintSHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the "WS-Security Version" is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: X509IssuerSerial
value.description: A reference is made using an X509IssuerSerial element that identifies a certificate by its X.509 Issuer and Serial Number.

type.description: The method used to reference the security token in a WS-Security message.

type.name: dmCryptoWSSTokenReferenceMechanism

value.name: Direct
value.description: A BinarySecurityToken is placed in the message and a Reference element with a URI fragment pointing to the BinarySecurityToken is used to refer to it.

value.name: KeyIdentifier
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a SubjectKeyIdentifier ValueType and content.

value.name: ThumbPrintSHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a ThumbPrintSHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the WS-Security Version is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: ThumbprintSHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a ThumbprintSHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the WS-Security Version is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: EncryptedKeySHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with an EncryptedKeySHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the WS-Security Version is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: X509IssuerSerial
value.description: A reference is made using an X509IssuerSerial element that identifies a certificate by its X.509 Issuer and Serial Number.

type.description: The method used to reference the security token in a WS-Security message.

value.name: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509
value.description: Generates http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509

value.name: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3
value.description: Generates http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3

description.p: Controls the value of BinarySecurityToken/@ValueType and of SecurityTokenReference/Reference/@ValueType when referring to a BinarySecurityToken that is an X.509 token.

Because of the differences between the final WS-Security 1.0 standards and the multiple draft versions of its errata document, different values of the ValueType attribute are used by different WS-Security implementations.
Compatibility with certain versions of .NET Web Services Enhancements (WSE) might require setting this option to #X509v3.
Compatibility with certain versions of WebSphere might require setting this option to #X509.
This setting is relevant only if the X.509 token type parameter is X.509.

value.name: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3SubjectKeyIdentifier
value.description: Generates http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3SubjectKeyIdentifier

value.name: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509SubjectKeyIdentifier
value.description: Generates http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509SubjectKeyIdentifier

description.p: Controls the value of KeyIdentifier/@ValueType.

Because of the differences between the final WS-Security 1.0 standards and the multiple draft versions of its errata document, different values of the ValueType attribute are used by different WS-Security implementations.
Compatibility with certain versions of .NET Web Services Enhancements (WSE) might require setting this option to #X509SubjectKeyIdentifier.
Compatibility with certain versions of WebSphere might require setting this option to #X509v3SubjectKeyIdentifier.
This option is relevant only when the WS-Security Version is 1.0 and the Token Reference Mechanism is KeyIdentifier.

value.name: X509
value.description: An X.509 signature-verfication certificate. (URI #X509v3)

value.name: PKCS7
value.description: A list of X.509 certificates and (optionally) CRLs packaged in a PKCS#7 wrapper. (URI #PKCS7)

value.name: round-robin
value.summary: Rotate among the DNS servers in listed order.
value.description: The round robin algorithm contacts DNS servers in the listed order. Each new connection is forwarded to the next server in the list.

value.name: first-alive
value.summary: Use the first healthy DNS server.
value.description: The first alive algorithm uses a primary and one or more backup servers. When the primary server is up, all connections are forwarded to this server. When the primary server is not up, connections are forwarded to backup servers. The primary server is the first server in the list.

property.name: Match
property.summary: URL match regular expression
property.description:
Provide a literal or wildcard expression to define a URL set included in the cache policy. The following wildcard characters are available.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character.
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character.
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Document cache policy type
property.description: Select the cache type. The cache type determines whether to cache documents and the mechanism to use to remove cached entries. The default is Protocol-Based.

property.name: TTL
property.summary: Document lifetime
property.description: Sets the validity period in seconds for documents in the cache. TTL applies to only the Fixed policy type. Enter a value in the range 5 - 31708800. The default value is 900.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Document priority

description.p: Specifies the priority of a document to add to or remove from the cache. The greater the value, the higher its priority. Enter a value in the range 1 - 255. The default value is 128.

ul.li: When adding documents, the cache uses the policy with the highest priority. If the document matches multiple policies with the same priority, the cache uses the first matching policy in the alphabetized list.

When removing documents, the cache removes documents that were added by policies with the lowest priority. If multiple documents have the same priority, the cache removes the document that was least recently accessed.

description.p: When you define multiple policies, the appliance retains the policies in an alphabetized list. The appliance evaluates candidate documents against each policy. Consequently, the priority of policies is important to ensure that the appliances caches candidates documents for the appropriate validity period.

ul.li: Use a high priority for policies that you want to cache.
Use a low priority for generic policies. For example, set the priority to 1 when * or *.xml is the match pattern.

property.name: XC10Grid
property.summary: The name of the Cache Grid
property.description: The DataPower XC10 or WebSphere eXtreme Scale grid configuration to use for caching documents.

property.name: CacheBackendResponses
property.summary: Specifies whether to cache back-end responses
property.description: Caches responses to requests from back-end servers.

property.name: HTTPCacheValidation
property.summary: Allow HTTP cache validation with the origin server.
property.description: When a requested HTTP document results in a cache hit, HTTP cache validation with the origin server will be performed.

property.name: ReturnExpired
property.summary: Whether to return expired documents

description.p:
In the following situations, whether to return expired content when a client requests it.
The appliance cannot establish a connection with the origin server.
The document cache is getting the newest version from the origin server.

A document might persist in the cache after the document is expired. When enabled, the cached document is returned even though it is potentially stale. A warning header indicates that the document is stale.

property.name: RESTInvalidation
property.summary: RESTful invalidation
property.description: Will invalidate document cache on unsafe requests. For example: HTTP GETs are safe requests that do not change the internal state of the server. When an HTTP POST to the same URL occurs, the cache needs to be invalidated because the internal state of the server may have changed. The next GET request must contact the origin service to update the cache with any changes.

property.name: CacheUnsafeResponse
property.display: Cache Response to POST and PUT Requests
property.summary: Cache Response to POST and PUT Requests
property.description: Caches responses to POST and PUT requests when the cache policy type is set to fixed. The response to these requests is the result of an action on the server that might change its resource state. You might want to cache responses to these requests when you know that the action (for example: HTTP POST) will not change the server state.

description.p:
Caches documents that match the URL expression. HTTP caching rules, as defined in Section 13 of RFC 2616 "Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP 1.1", specify the cache-lifetime. Policy is set using the following criteria:
If the document does not contain a Date or Last-Modified header, do not cache.
If the document contains a Vary header, do not cache.
If the document contains an HTTP 1.1 Cache-Control header, cache and use the contents of that field to determine its cache-lifetime.
If the document contains an HTTP 1.0 Expires header, cache and use the contents of that field to determine its cache-lifetime.
If the document contains a Last-Modified header, cache and use the contents of that field in conjunction with the Date header to determine its cache-lifetime. The cache-lifetime cannot exceed 8 hours.

value.name: no-cache
value.description: Does not cache documents that match the URL expression.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Caches documents that match the URL expression. The TTL specifies the validity period for the document in seconds.

value.name: messages
value.description: The time interval between the receipt of a client request to the transmission of the associated server response. This interval is the full transaction cycle.

value.name: requests
value.description: The time interval between the receipt of a client request to its transmission to the target server. This interval is the time spent by the DataPower device in processing a client request.

value.name: server
value.description: The interval between the transmission of a client request to the server and the receipt of its associated server response. This interval is the server processing time.

value.name: responses
value.description: The interval between the receipt of a server response and its transmission to the target client. This interval is the time spent by the DataPower device in processing a server response.

value.name: none
value.description: Do not use dynamic configuration. Users must define the configuration of the AAA policy at commit time.

value.name: current-aaa
value.description: Use dynamic configuration and use the configuration of the current AAA policy as the template. When selected, the properties that the dynamic configuration custom URL returns overwrite those in the current AAA policy.

value.name: external-aaa
value.description: Use dynamic configuration and use the configuration of an external AAA policy as the template. When selected, the external AAA policy overwrites the current AAA policy. Then the properties that the dynamic configuration URL returns overwrite those in the specified external AAA policy.

value.name: one-way-push
value.description: In the one-way push pattern, the initiator is the business partner that sends the message. The responder is the business partner that receives the message.

value.name: one-way-pull
value.description: The initiator is the receiver. The receiver determines which message it wants to receive first and when it is ready to receive messages. The sender becomes the responder. When an initiator is ready to receive messages, the initiator notifies its message service handler (MSH), in our case, the DataPower Gateway, to send a pull request signal to the MSH of the responder.

value.name: username-token
value.summary: Username token to authenticate pull request
value.description: When a username token is selected for authentication, the MPC expects a username to be carried with the pull request and use the username to match the payload.

value.name: cert
value.summary: Validation credential to authenticate pull request
value.description: When a validation credential is selected for authentication, the MPC expects a certificate to be carried in the pull request, matches the certificate against the MPC validation credential, and use the validation credential name to match the payload.

property.name: LocalFunction
property.summary: Local Function

value.name: var://local/buffered-attachments
value.description: This variable returns data in the same format as the Attachment Manifest. However it only returns data for attachments that have been buffered in. It will not read more attachment data from the network as is the case for the Manifst.

value.name: var://local/attachment-content-ids
value.description: List of attachment identifiers (both content-location and content-id) including those that were processed through the system unbuffered (if multistep is told to save these attachment cids)

value.name: var://local/clone-attachments
value.summary: Copy the Attachments Into the Named Context
value.description: Copy the attachments in the context to the context with the name of the variable value. If the context does not exist it will be created. If the context does exist, any attachments in that context will be overwritten

value.name: var://local/set-root-content-id
value.summary: Set the content id for the root part
value.description: Set the content id for the root part

value.name: var://local/set-start-parameter
value.display: Set the start parameter of MIME content-type header
value.summary: Set the start parameter for the transport level multipart type
value.description: Set the start parameter for the transport level multipart related content type

value.name: var://local/_internal/ap_conformance/ap_cid
value.description: Internal variable used when creating multistep session for schema validating attachments for Attachment Profile. Indicates to current multistep session that input is an attachment (with content id the value of the variable) that should be validated against the wsdl

value.name: var://local/_internal/ap_conformance/results_err_msg
value.summary: Attachment Schema Validation Results Error Message
value.description: Internal variable used to store the error message when schema validating an attachment for Attachment Profile. Because the service://error_message will be cleared since we may be onError continue we need an additional variable to store attachment validation session errors

value.name: var://local/mime/conformance/results
value.description: Log of Attachment Profile 1.0 conformance failures for the attachments in this context

value.name: var://local/content-type
value.description: This variable returns the content-type value associated with a multistep context. It will return a multipart/related value if the context contains attachments.

value.name: var://local/_extension/responsecode
value.description: This variable is set on an Output context to indicate the protocol level response code of dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions. For instance, if an action of the form "results tmpvar2 http://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3" was successful, the value "200" would be automatically written into the variable var://context/tmpvar3/_extension/responsecode.

value.name: var://local/_extension/header/
value.description: The variables of the form "_extension/header/*" can be set to append headers to the dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions connection when a context containing them is used as the Input context to an action. For example "setvar tmpvar2 var://local/_extension/header/X-foo bar" "results tmpvar2 http://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3" would add the http header "X-foo: bar" to the HTTP request.

value.name: var://local/_extension/sslprofile
value.description: This variable can be set in the input context of a dp:url-open() extension function or in a results or fetch action to override the SSL profile used for that particular action. For instance, "results tmpvar2 https://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3" normally uses the SSL profile for any user-agent that matches against the url "https://foo.bar.com/foome.asp". But if the profile needed to be determined pragmatically, for example, based on AAA, you use the following code to dynamically resolve the value of *sslprofiletouse: "setvar tmpvar2 var://local/_extension/sslprofile var://context/notepad/sslprofiletouse" "results tmpvar2 https://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3".

value.name: var://local/_extension/timeout
value.description: This variable can be set to override the default connection timeout parameters for this action when an action uses a context with these variables as its input. It is expressed in seconds.

value.name: var://local/_extension/response-header/
value.description: This variable in the output context of a dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions that contain the response headers.

value.name: var://local/_extension/response-headers
value.description: This variable in the output context of a dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions that contain the response header manifest.

value.name: var://local/_extension/allow-compression
value.description: This variable can be set to allow the compression of the outgoing results content and negotiate the returned document to be compressed if the underlying protocol supports it. If HTTP is being used that means the content-encoding and accept-encoding headers.

value.name: var://local/_extension/prevent-persistent-connection
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent persistent connections of the outgoing results and fetch calls that are associated with this context. Wherever appropriate, persistent connections are supported by default.

value.name: var://local/_extension/donot-follow-redirect
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent the following of protocol level redirect sequences on the outgoing results and fetch calls that are associated with this context. Redirects are followed by default.

value.name: var://local/_extension/http-10-only
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent the use of HTTP 1.1 when doing results and fetch actions on the related context.

value.name: var://local/_extension/error
value.description: This variable contains the error message, if any, from the last dp:transform(), dp:parse(), or dp:document() invocation. If the variable is empty, no error occurred. If an error occurs in any subsequent call to one of these functions, the existing error message, if any, will be overwritten.

value.name: var://local/_extension/donot-rewrite-host
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent the rewriting of the HTTP Host header on the outgoing results and fetch calls that are associated with this context. The HTTP Host header is rewritten by default.

type.name: dmExternalAttachedPolicy

property.name: ExternalAttachWSDLComponentType
property.summary: Type of Component
property.description: Select a type of Component

property.description: Matches Fragment Identifier
