type.summary: Attach a policy document to a service

value.name: forbid
value.description: The parser forbids external references. An external reference causes the XML parser to stop when the document contains external references. This setting is the default value.

value.name: ignore
value.description: The parser accesses and resolves external references, but replaces each for further processing with an empty string. This setting can be a security risk.

value.name: allow
value.description: The parser allows and resolves external references. This setting is a security risk.

value.name: header
value.description: Extracts client credentials from the identified header.

value.name: query
value.description: Extracts client credentials from query parameters.

value.name: form
value.description: Extracts client credentials from the x-www-form-urlencoded body.

value.name: cookie
value.description: Extracts client credentials from the cookie.

value.name: http
value.description: Extracts client credentials from the HTTP Authorization header.

value.name: context-var
value.description: Extracts client credentials from the runtime context variable.

type.name: dmExtractIdentityOption

value.name: disabled
value.description: Skips the identity-extraction step

value.name: basic
value.description: Extracts identity from basic authorization header

value.name: context-var
value.description: Extracts identity from context variables

value.name: html-form
value.description: Extracts identity by using an HTML form

value.name: redirect
value.description: Extracts identity by using a redirect

type.summary: Options for extracting resource owner's identity

value.name: none
value.summary: The appliance is in normal mode
value.description: The appliance is not in a failsafe mode and is operating normally.

value.name: management
value.summary: The appliance is in failsafe management mode
value.description: Only the default domain and configured Telnet, SSH and web management interfaces (WebGUI and Blueprint Console) are available.

value.name: console
value.summary: The appliance is in failsafe management mode
value.description: Only the default domain and a serial console interface are available.

type.summary: Gives the purpose of the RAID partition.
type.description: Gives the purpose of the RAID partition.

value.name: notify
value.description: Adds a log entry at the specified log priority.

value.name: reject
value.description: Rejects the transaction and adds a log entry at the specified log priority.

value.name: shape
value.description: Adds a log entry at the specified log priority. Messages are buffered and processed at a rate that is less than the threshold. When the buffer is full, messages are rejected.

value.name: static-backend
value.description: The firewall communicates with the server that is identified by a remote IP address and remote port. The firewall can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: loopback-proxy
value.description: The firewall processes the incoming request using the selected policy and returns the result to the client. No server is involved. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: dynamic-backend
value.description: The firewall identifies the backend server by examining the request. The firewall can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

type.name: dmFirmwareType

value.name: primary
value.description: Primary firmware install

value.name: secondary
value.description: Secondary firmware install

type.description: Firmware install type

value.name: backend
value.summary: Retrieve forms from their mapped locations on the application server.

value.name: appliance
value.summary: Stores forms locally on the file system.

value.name: static
value.description: Use static HTML login, logout, and error pages from an explicit location. These HTML pages can be on the appliance or on a remote server.

value.name: custom
value.description: Use a custom stylesheet or a GatewayScript file that generates the HTML login, logout, error pages, and the form.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local IP address
property.description: The address on which the service listens. The default of 0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. Click Select Alias to use an alias for this value. Local host aliases help to ease migration tasks between machines. See Local Host Alias under Networking for more.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The local TCP port number that supports server operations
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 65535, with a default of 3000) that specifies the port monitored by the stateful raw XML over TCP service.

property.name: UseSSL
property.summary: SSL for backside connections.
property.description: Use SSL for this front side server port. Make sure the SSL server profile or SSL SNI server profile is configured on this object.

property.name: CredentialCharset
property.summary: Character encoding of the original basic authentication values
property.description: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The appliance transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. Defaults to Protocol which is ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.

value.name: auth-off
value.description: Do not use the FTP AUTH command to encrypt the command connection. The username and password will be passed in the clear.

value.name: auth-tls-opt
value.description: Use the FTP AUTH TLS command to encrypt the command connection using TLS, if available.

value.name: auth-tls-req
value.description: Use the FTP AUTH TLS command to encrypt the command connection using TLS, fail if not available.

type.name: dmFTPCCCPolicy

value.name: ccc-off
value.description: Leave the FTP command connection encrypted after (optional) authentication with the USER and PASS commands. The command connection will remain secure, but will be incompatible with NAT and many firewalls.

value.name: ccc-opt
value.description: Use the FTP CCC command to request the end of encryption on the command connection using TLS, if supported by the server.

value.name: ccc-req
value.description: Use the FTP CCC command to request the end of encryption on the command connection using TLS, fail if the server does not support CCC. (Very few server support CCC.) Required for compatibility with NAT and many firewalls.

type.display: FTP Stop Encryption After Authentication Policy

value.name: disallow
value.description: Does not allow the FTP client to encrypt data connections.

value.name: allow
value.description: Allows, but does not require, the FTP client to encrypt data connections. TLS must be allowed on data connections.

value.name: require
value.description: Requires the FTP client to encrypt data connections. TLS should be required on data connections.

value.name: enc-data-off
value.description: Even when the command channel is encrypted, do not encrypt FTP data connections. Use the FTP PROT C command when the command channel is or has been encrypted.

value.name: enc-data-opt
value.description: Request encryption of FTP data connections using the FTP PROT P command. Required when the command channel is or has been encrypted. Do not fail if server does not support data encryption.

value.name: enc-data-req
value.description: Request encryption of FTP data connections using the FTP PROT P command. Required when the command channel is or has been encrypted. Fail if server does not support data encryption.

value.name: ascii
value.description: Transfer files as ASCII data. This mode allow standardization of end-of-line conventions between different operating systems. This mode increases the overhead at both ends. Uses the FTP TYPE A command.

value.name: binary
value.description: Transfer files as image data. This mode transfers data as binary 8-bit bytes. This mode is more efficient (less overhead at both ends). Some XML files, such as signed files, must be transferred in this mode. Uses the FTP TYPE I command.

value.name: virtual-ephemeral
value.description: The FTP server will have an ephemeral virtual file system with subdirectories created by configuration. The contents of this file system are private to an individual FTP control connection to the FTP server. The contents of this file system will not persist after this FTP control connection ends.

value.name: virtual-persistent
value.description: The FTP server will have a persistent virtual file system with subdirectories created by configuration. The contents of this file system are shared by all FTP control connections to this FTP server with the same authenticated user identity. The user identity is determined by the FTP user name and, if used, by the TLS/SSL certificate. The contents of this file system will persist after all FTP control connections end for a duration defined by Persistent Filesystem Timeout. This mode is required to support checkpoint/restart using the REST command.

value.name: transparent
value.description: The FTP server has a transparent file system. The files and directories shown are those on the back end of the associated Multi-Protocol Gateway.

value.name: allow
value.description: Allows, but does not require, the FTP client to use the PASV command to open data connections to the FTP server.

value.name: disallow
value.description: Does not allow the FTP client to use the PASV command to open data connections to the FTP server. The FTP server will open all data connections to the FTP client (as directed by the FTP PORT command). This mode is not always compatible with firewalls.

value.name: require
value.description: Requires the FTP client to use the PASV command to open all data connections with the FTP server. This mode is useful when the FTP server is behind a firewall device that requires clients to use passive mode.

value.name: pasv-off
value.description: Do not use the FTP PASV command to allow the client to open the FTP data connections. The FTP server will open all data connections to the FTP client. Often incompatible with firewalls

value.name: pasv-opt
value.description: Use the FTP PASV command to request that the FTP client be allowed to open all data connections to the FTP server, but do not fail if the server does not support PASV.

value.name: pasv-req
value.description: Use the FTP PASV command to request that the FTP client be allowed to open all data connections to the FTP server, and fail if the server does not support PASV.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Passive
property.summary: Controls use of FTP Passive mode
property.description: Select how to use the FTP Passive mode to control in which direction FTP data connections are made.

property.name: AuthTLS
property.summary: Controls use of TLS to secure connections
property.description: Select how to use TLS to secure FTP command connections.

property.name: UseCCC
property.summary: Stops command encryption after authentication
property.description: Select how to control the cessation of FTP command channel encryption after user authentication. Encryption must be stopped for compatibility with NAT (Network Address Translation) and other firewall applications. Although this might be a security risk, there is no other option when NAT is in use.

property.name: EncryptData
property.summary: Controls encryption file transfers
property.description: Select how to control encryption of file transfers. Compatible with NAT in all settings.

property.name: DataType
property.summary: Data type of file transfer
property.description: Select the default file transfer data type. In most cases, the value of binary is appropriate.

property.name: SlashSTOU
property.display: Write Unique Filename if Trailing Slash
property.summary: Creates a unique file if the name contains a trailing slash

description.p: Select how to create unique files if the name contains a trailing slash.

Some FTP servers provide the STOU command. Use the command only if the FTP server supports this command. The STOU command allows the server to choose the unique file name in the current directory. Using the STOU command does not require the client to choose a unique file name.
When enabled and a URL is given to write that ends in a /, the server uses the STOU command instead of the STOR command.

property.name: QuotedCommands
property.summary: Quoted Commands
property.description: This specifies a list of FTP commands to be sent to the server before each FTP STOR, STOU, or RETR command. A typical use would be to use "SITE" commands, such as "SITE RECFM=FB" for the MVS domain on a z/OS system. These commands cannot be data-transfer related, such as STOU, RETR, PORT, PASV, etc.

property.name: SizeCheck
property.summary: Perform Size check after file transfer
property.description: If set to Optional, do a size check after the file transfer is complete. This uses the SIZE command, and compares the returned number to the number of bytes transferred "over the wire" for the file transfer. If the number is not equal, the file transfer is marked as failing. If the FTP server does not support the SIZE command, no error results. Some FTP servers, particulary vsftpd in the default configuration, provide inaccurate SIZE responses for files transferred in ASCII mode. If you get such errors, you can disable this feature. (Alternately you can reconfigure vsftpd.)

property.name: QuotedCommand
property.summary: Quoted Command
property.description: The command to send to the remote FTP server. The command must not be one that would create an FTP data connection. Normally this will be a SITE command. This command must return a result code in the 200 series.

value.name: temporary
value.description: Stores response files in temporary storage on the system. This storage has limited size. Using temporary storage reduces the available system storage for processing. Temporary storage should not be used when using a virtual persistent file system. In virtual persistent file systems, it is highly unlikely that there would be enough space. After a system restart or power cycle, response files are not available.

value.name: nfs
value.description: Stores response files on the top level directory of the specified NFS server. Only the NFS server limits the storage space.

value.name: none
value.description: Indicates that no response is made available to the client. Any response from the backend server is dropped.

value.name: virtual-filesystem
value.description: Indicates that the response is made available as a file in the virtual file system that can be read by the FTP client. The directory for responses is configured on a per-virtual directory basis. The suffix specified by Response Suffix is added to the input file name and stored in the directory specified by Response Storage.

property.name: VirtualPath
property.summary: Directory in virtual file system of the FTP server
property.description: Enter the directory in the virtual file system of the FTP server where the FTP client can find this directory.

property.name: ResponseDirectory
property.summary: Virtual directory in which to put responses
property.description: Enter the directory in the virtual file system of the FTP server where the responses to files that are stored in this directory will go.

value.name: size-check-optional
value.description: If the FTP SIZE command is available, uses this command to check the file transfer size after file transfer.

value.name: size-check-disabled
value.description: Do not check file size after transfer.

description.p: Always use the supplied file name in the URL to generate the target file name requested on the server. If the URL ends in a slash, the request generally fails.
Uses the FTP STOR command to initiate the transfer. The STOR command is only a directory specification, without a file name specification.

value.name: slash-stou-on
value.display: Request Unique File Name When Trailing Slash

description.p: If the supplied file name ends in a slash, use the STOU command to write a unique file name. The slash must be before the ? that initiates the query parameters or before the ; that begins the suffix.

Uses the FTP STOU command to intiate the transfer and requests that the server generate a unique file name within the target directory. This approach is the only safe way to have multiple systems write files to the same directory without overwriting any files.
The transfer fails if the FTP server does not support the STOU command.

value.name: Request
value.summary: Runs actions in request rule in order
value.description: Enforces serial processing of the actions defined for request processing, excluding serial transmission of messages to the backend request queue. An action always sends messages to queue-based destinations in the order that they were pulled from the front-side request queue. If a later message arrives for processing by the action before an earlier message, the service buffers this message until after the action completes processing for the earlier message.

value.name: Backend
value.description: Enforces serial transmission of messages to the backend request queue. The output of request processing always sends messages to the backend request queue in the order that they were pulled from the front-side request queue. If a later message arrives for transmission before an earlier message, the service buffers this message until after transmitting the earlier message.

value.name: Response
value.summary: Runs actions in response rule in order

description.p: Enforces serial processing of the actions defined for response processing, including serial transmission of messages to the front-side reply queue.

ul.li: An action always sends messages to queue-based destinations in the order that were pulled from the backend reply queue.
The output of response processing always sends messages to the front-side reply queue in the order that were pulled from the backend reply queue.

description.p: If a later message arrives for processing by the action before an earlier message or a later message arrives for transmission to the front-side reply queue before an earlier message, the service buffers the message at this point until after processing the earlier message.

type.description: Internal state of currently active transactions on Multi-Protocol Gateway and WS-Proxy objects in this application domain.

value.name: static-backend
value.description: The gateway sends all requests to the URL defined by the backend URL. The format of the URL determines the protocol that is used for the backend (server) communication.

value.name: dynamic-backend
value.description: The gateway determines the URL of the backend server dynamically during request processing. The URL determines the protocol used for the backend communication. Use this mode if any of the Front Side Handlers is Stateful Raw XML.

value.name: REPLAY
value.summary: GSS_C_REPLAY_FLAG from RFC 4121: whether replay of protected messages will be detected

value.name: SEQUENCE
value.summary: GSS_C_SEQUENCE_FLAG from RFC 4121: whether out of sequence protected messages will be detected

value.name: CONF
value.summary: GSS_C_CONF_FLAG from RFC 4121: whether confidentiality service may be provided

value.name: INTEG
value.summary: GSS_C_INTEG_FLAG from RFC 4121: whether integrity service may be provided

property.name: Direction
property.summary: Direction of the message
property.description: Select the direction of the message.

property.name: HeaderTag
property.summary: Name of the injected header
property.description: Enter the name of the header to inject. Even though the headers are not defined in the original request, the device provides the specified headers to the backend server.

property.name: HeaderTagValue
property.summary: Value for the injected header
property.description: Enter the value for the header tag.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: HeaderRetention
property.summary: Header Retention
property.description: Transactions matching this policy retain this header in the outgoing traffic at the backend.

property.name: Direction
property.summary: Direction of the message
property.description: Select the direction of the message.

property.name: HeaderTag
property.summary: Name of the suppressed header
property.description: Enter the name of the header to suppress. When these headers are defined in the original request, the device removes the specified headers before forwarding the request to the backend server.

type.name: dmHostToSSLServerProfile

property.name: HostNameWildmat
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern for matching host names.
property.description: Specify a match pattern for use against the host name in the incoming ClientHello SNI extension.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: SSL server profile
property.description: Specify the SSL Server Profile to use in response to a host name that matches the pattern.

type.display: Map Host Name to SSL Server Profile
type.summary: Host Name to SSL Server Profile mapping
type.description: This map allows virtual SSL server configuration where different SSL Server Profiles can be used in response to the host name value in the SSL client's SNI extension. In this way, a single IP address and TCP port can be used to host multiple SSL Servers with separate cryptographic keys and certificates.

property.name: Front
property.summary: Client-side HTTP version
property.description: Select the HTTP version to use on the client-side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: Back
property.summary: Server-side HTTP version
property.description: Select the HTTP version to use on the server-side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of an HTTP header field
property.description: Enter the name of the HTTP header field to be examined.

property.name: Value
property.summary: The value of HTTP Header field

description.p: Provide a literal or wildcard expression to define a set of values to include in or exclude from the traffic definition. If the contents of the specified header field fulfill the defined match criterion, the match succeeds.
The following wildcard characters are available:

tr.td: Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
Matches one occurrence of any single character

Defines a character or numeric range.
For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

value.name: front
value.description: The message travels from the DataPower device to the client.

value.name: back
value.description: The message travels from the DataPower device to the backend server.

type.name: dmHTTPInputEncoding

value.name: plain
value.description: The expected encoding is plain text and the requested processing is to XML escape the input. All <, >, and & characters are replaced by <, >, and & respectively. This option is synonymous with URL-encoded, because URL-encoding in an HTTP GET or POST is always decoded.

value.name: urlencoded
value.description: The expected encoding is URL-encoded, as in HTML forms, and the requested processing is to URL unescape, then XML escape the input. All <, >, and & characters are replaced by <, >, and & respectively.

value.name: xml
value.description: The expected encoding is an XML fragment and the requested processing, because the input is a literal, is no processing. If the fragment includes a leading XML declaration (of the form <?xml ?>), the declaration is removed. All other characters are passed unchanged. The input must be a balanced block of XML. If not balanced, the generated XML will not parse correctly. This option is synonymous with URL-encoded XML, because URL-encoding in an HTTP GET or POST is always decoded.

value.name: urlencoded-xml
value.description: The expected encoding is a URL-encoded XML fragment and the requested processing, because the input is a literal, is no processing. If the fragment includes a leading XML declaration (of the form <?xml ?>), the declaration is removed. All other characters are passed unchanged. The input must be a balanced block of XML. If not balanced, the generated XML will not parse correctly.

value.name: base64
value.description: The expected encoding is Base 64 and the requested processing is to pass the input through but add the XML attribute encoding="base64" to the generated <arg> element for each argument which has this input encoding. If the base 64 data should include any illegal <, >, or & character, it is replaced by <, >, and & respectively.

value.name: base64-xml
value.summary: The value is a Base64 encoded XML fragment (decoded).

value.name: json
value.description: The expected encoding is a JSON structure and the requested processing is convert to XML according to the JSONx XML specification. JSON content cannot be specified as part of a multipart form and is only supported as the default encoding. When specifying JSON as the default encoding type, a name-value encoding map is not used.

type.description: Controls how the value in an HTTP form is traslated to generate XML. All of the options start with URL-decoding, except in an HTTP MIME POST. URL-decoding is not required for an HTTP MIME POST.

value.description: Extracts client credentials from the Authorization header, which expects the basic form in the Basic base64_id:secret format

type.name: dmHTTPResponseCodes

value.name: HTTP-100
value.summary: The client continues with its request

value.name: HTTP-101
value.summary: The server uses the Upgrade message header field to change HTTP version or protocol

value.name: HTTP-201
value.summary: The request succeeded and created a new resource

value.name: HTTP-202
value.summary: The request accepted for processing, but processing not complete

value.name: HTTP-203
value.summary: The request accepted, but the returned information is from a local or third-party copy

value.name: HTTP-204
value.summary: The request accepted and might return meta-information that does not change view

value.name: HTTP-205
value.summary: The request accepted and the view reset

value.name: HTTP-206
value.summary: The server fulfilled the partial GET request for the resource

value.name: HTTP-300
value.summary: The request matches one of a set of representations, and a choice must be made

value.name: HTTP-301
value.summary: The server returned the new permanent URI for a link

value.name: HTTP-302
value.summary: The resource temporarily resides at a different URI

value.name: HTTP-303
value.summary: The resource resides at a different URI

value.name: HTTP-304
value.summary: The client is using a local, cached copy

value.name: HTTP-305
value.summary: The request resource accessed through a proxy

value.name: HTTP-307
value.summary: The resource temporarily resides at a different URI

value.name: HTTP-400
value.summary: The server does not understand the request because of syntax

value.name: HTTP-402
value.summary: The request requires a charge-to header

value.name: HTTP-403
value.summary: The server understood the request and denied access

value.name: HTTP-404
value.summary: The server could not find the resource

value.name: HTTP-405
value.summary: The resource does not allow the specified method

value.name: HTTP-406
value.summary: The resource cannot generate a response because the contents are not acceptable

value.name: HTTP-407
value.summary: The request requires user authentication through a proxy

value.name: HTTP-408
value.summary: The client did not response to the server in the allocated time

value.name: HTTP-409
value.summary: The request could not complete because of a conflict is resource state

value.name: HTTP-410
value.summary: The resource is no longer on the server and no redirection known

value.name: HTTP-411
value.summary: The server refused the request because the Content-Length header is absent

value.name: HTTP-412
value.summary: A precondition in a request-header field evaluated to false

value.name: HTTP-413
value.summary: The server refused the request because it is too large

value.name: HTTP-500
value.summary: The server encountered an unexpected error and cannot process request

value.name: HTTP-503
value.summary: The server cannot process the request because the service is not available

type.summary: HTTP response codes that are allowed

value.name: normal
value.description: The server returns the requested documents.

value.name: echo
value.description: The server returns the GET and POST requests that it receives.

value.name: Echo-Reply
value.summary: Indicates whether to reply to ICMP echo requests.
value.description: Whether to reply to ICMP echo requests.

value.name: Timestamp-Reply
value.summary: Indicates whether to reply to ICMP timestamp requests.
value.description: Whether to reply to ICMP timestamp requests.

value.name: Info-Reply
value.summary: Indicates whether to reply to ICMP information requests.
value.description: Whether to reply to ICMP information requests.

value.name: Addressmask-Reply
value.summary: Indicates whether to reply to ICMP address mask requests.
value.description: Whether to reply to ICMP address map requests.

value.name: ZIP
value.description: Imports the configuration from a compressed ZIP bundle.

value.name: XML
value.description: Imports configuration from the exported XML configuration files.

property.name: InputMatch
property.summary: The PCRE to match an HTTP form name against.
property.description: The PCRE pattern that will be matched against the name of an HTTP form field. If the name matches this PCRE, the associated value will be processed by the rules of the Encoding. If a form field has no name, an empty string is used for the pattern matching.

property.name: Encoding
property.summary: The Encoding used for values whose name matches the Input Match
property.description: Select how to translate the value of a form field to the contents of the <arg> element in the generated XML.

value.name: up
value.description: The administrative state of the interface is enabled. The goal operational state is down.

value.name: down
value.description: The administrative state of the interface is disabled. The goal operational state is down.

value.name: testing
value.description: Some testing mode (not used yet)

value.name: up
value.description: The interface is operationally up.

value.name: down
value.description: The interface is operationally down.

value.name: testing
value.description: Some testing mode. After the test completes, the status changes as appropriate.

value.name: unknown
value.description: Cannot determine the operational state of the interface.

value.name: dormant
value.description: The interface is waiting for a connection.

value.name: notPresent
value.description: The interface is not present.

value.name: lowerLayerDown
value.description: The required lower layer is down.

value.name: ok
value.description: Indicates that all networking is up on the appliance.

value.name: linkErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more ethernet links are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: vlanErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more VLANs are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: aggErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more Aggregations are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: linkVlanErrors

value.name: linkAggErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more ethernet links and Aggregations are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: vlanAggErrors
value.description: Indicates that one or more VLANs and Aggregations are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: allErrors
value.summary: Errors exist in all networking types
value.description: Indicates that one or more ethernet links, VLANs, and Aggregations are misconfigured on the appliance.

value.name: Ethernet
value.description: Indicates that it is on the base Ethernet MAC interface.

value.name: Tunnel
value.description: Indicates that it is on a encapsulation interface.

value.name: VLAN
value.description: Indicates that it is on an IEEE 802.1Q VLAN on top of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

value.name: Aggregate
value.description: Indicates that it is on an IEEE 802.3ad Link Aggregation composed of one of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

description.p: Refers to network interfaces that you cannot configure. Examples of other interface types include gre0 , ip6tnl0 , lo , sit0 , and usb0 . Not all appliances have all of these other interface types.

value.name: Protocol
value.summary: Uses the cache behavior that is defined by the Cache-Control headers on the request and response.
value.description: Uses the cache behavior that is defined by the Cache-Control headers on the request and response.

value.name: NoCache
value.description: Does not cache documents.

value.name: TimeToLive
value.description: Keeps documents in the cache for a specified time.

type.name: dmInvokeErrorType

value.name: ConnectionError
value.description: Indicates that the invoke action cannot establish a connection to the target URL. For example, the host is not reachable or the service is not available.

value.name: SOAPError
value.description: Indicates that the invoke action receives a 500 SOAP fault as response.

value.name: OperationError
value.description: Indicates that the invoke action establishes the connection and receives a non-2xx response as response.

type.summary: The errors that can occur to the invoke action

property.name: UserID
property.summary: The User Name of the user to enable
property.description: The name of an IPMI user to enable on this LAN channel.

property.name: PrivilegeLevel
property.summary: Maximum privilege level of user on channel
property.description: The maximum privilege level to allow the user on this LAN channel. If this value is greater than the maximum privilege level for the channel itself, the maximum privilege level of the channel is the effective limit.

property.name: SOLEnabled
property.summary: User can use serial over LAN on channel
property.description: Whether to allow the user to use the serial over LAN protocol (payload) over Remote Control and Management Protocol Plus (RCMP+) on this LAN channel. When enabled, The user can use serial over LAN provided that the user has a privilege level equivalent to or greater than the minimum required privilege level for serial over LAN.

property.name: MaxSimultaneousSessions
property.summary: Maximum simultaneous sessions for user on channel
property.description: The maximum number of simultaneous sessions to allow the user on this LAN channel. The minimum value is 0, and the maximum value is 7. If 0, there is no limit.

value.description: Use IPv6 to identify the remote host.
Use IPv4 to identify the remote host.

value.name: default
value.summary: Use the default IP version for DNS settings.
value.description: Use the IP version that is defined in the DNS settings configuration.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Enter the name of the new directory.
property.description: Specifies the name that identifies the new directory.

property.name: Hostname
property.summary: Enter the host name of the directory server.
property.description: Specifies the host name of the directory server.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Enter the port to communicate with the directory.
property.description: Specifies the port that is used to communicate with the directory.

property.name: Suffix
property.summary: Enter the suffixes to add for the new directory.
property.description: Specifies the suffixes that are added for the new directory. To add multiple suffixes, separate each suffix with a comma (,).

property.name: BindDN
property.summary: Enter the DN to authenticate with the directory.
property.description: Specifies the distinguished name (DN) that is used to authenticate with the directory.

property.name: BindPassword
property.summary: Enter the password to authenticate with the directory.
property.description: Specifies the password that is used to authenticate with the directory.

property.name: SSL
property.summary: Indicate whether to enable SSL to secure the communication with the directory.
property.description: Specifies whether to enable SSL to secure the communication with the directory.

property.name: ClientCert
property.summary: Specify the client personal certificate for SSL communication with the federated directory.
property.description: Specifies the client personal certificate for SSL communication with the federated directory. The key file must be specified in order to specify the client certificate. If the key file is specified, but the client certificate is not, the default client certificate within the key file is used. The client certificate cannot be specified when the client cryptographic profile is specified.

property.name: CryptoProfile
property.summary: Specify the cryptographic profile for SSL communication with the federated directory.
property.description: Specifies the cryptographic profile for SSL communication with the federated directory. The cryptographic profile cannot be specified when the client cryptographic profile or the key file are specified.

property.name: Hostname
property.summary: Enter the DNS host name or IP address of the target server.
property.description: The DNS host name or IP address of the target server. For example, www.example.com

property.name: Port
property.summary: Enter the TCP or SSL port of the back-end third-party server.
property.description: The TCP or SSL port of the back-end third-party server. The default value is 80.

property.name: VirtualHost
property.summary: Enter the value of the Host header of the request that is sent to the back-end server.
property.description: The value of the Host header of the request that is sent to the back-end server.

property.name: VirtualHostPort
property.summary: Enter the virtual host port number.
property.description: The port number is required if the virtual host uses a non-standard port for the protocol. Standard port for TCP is 80. Standard port for SSL is 443.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Enter the IP address that is used to communicate with the target server.
property.description: The local IP address that the Access Manager Reverse Proxy uses when it communicates with the target server.

property.name: QueryContents
property.summary: Enter the path for the query_contents program file.
property.description: Provides the Access Manager Reverse Proxy with the correct name of the query_contents program file and where to find the file.

property.name: ServerUUID
property.summary: Enter the UUID of the target server.
property.description: The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) of the target server that is connected to the Access Manager Reverse Proxy by using a stateful junction.

property.name: DN
property.summary: Enter the distinguished name of the server certificate.
property.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the server certificate.

property.name: WindowsFSSupport
property.summary: Indicate whether to enable Microsoft Windows file system support.
property.description: Enable or disable Microsoft Windows file system support. When enabled, the server does not allow the 8.3 file name format and trailing dots in directory and file names. In addition, the Access Manager Reverse Proxy automatically treats URLs as case insensitive when it performs authorization checks on a request to a junctioned server.

property.name: URLCaseInsensitive
property.summary: Indicate whether to treat URLs as case insensitive.
property.description: Enable or disable URL case insensitivity. When enabled, the Access Manager Reverse Proxy server treats URLs as not case-sensitive when it performs authorization checks on a request to a target server.

property.description: The TCP or SSL port of the back-end third-party server. The default value is 80.

property.name: ProxyHostname
property.summary: Enter the DNS host name or IP address of the proxy server.
property.description: The DNS host name or IP address of the proxy server. For example, www.example.com

property.name: ProxyPort
property.summary: Enter the TCP or SSL port of the proxy server.
property.description: The TCP or SSL port of the proxy server.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Enter the IP address that is used to communicate with the target server.
property.description: The local IP address that the Access Manager Reverse Proxy uses when it communicates with the target server.

property.name: QueryContents
property.summary: Enter the path for the query_contents program file.
property.description: Provides the Access Manager Reverse Proxy with the correct name of the query_contents program file and where to find the file.

property.name: ServerUUID
property.summary: Enter the UUID of the target server.
property.description: The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) of the target server that is connected to the Access Manager Reverse Proxy by using a stateful junction.

property.name: DN
property.summary: Enter the distinguished name of the server certificate.
property.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the server certificate.

property.name: WindowsFSSupport
property.summary: Indicate whether to enable Microsoft Windows file system support.
property.description: Enable or disable Microsoft Windows file system support. When enabled, the server does not allow the 8.3 file name format and trailing dots in directory and file names. In addition, the Access Manager Reverse Proxy automatically treats URLs as case insensitive when it performs authorization checks on a request to a junctioned server.

property.name: URLCaseInsensitive
property.summary: Indicate whether to treat URLs as case insensitive.
property.description: Enable or disable URL case insensitivity. When enabled, the Access Manager Reverse Proxy server treats URLs as not case-sensitive when it performs authorization checks on a request to a target server.

value.name: none
value.description: None

value.name: filter
value.description: Removes all basic authentication header information from any client requests before forwarding the requests to the back-end server.

value.name: ignore
value.description: Passes the original client basic authentication header information to the back-end server without modification.

value.name: supply
value.description: Supplies the authenticated Security Access Manager user name (client's original identity) with a static, generic password.

value.name: gso
value.description: Supplies the back-end server with authentication information (user name and password) obtained from a server that is set up to handle global sign-on (GSO).

property.name: EnableSA
property.summary: Enable Session Affinity
property.description: Enables or disables session affinity operations.

property.name: InsertionCookieName
property.summary: Insertion Cookie Name
property.description: Name of the cookie inserted into the response when active or active-conditional session affinity is required.

property.name: InsertionPath
property.summary: Insertion Path
property.description: The path added to the insertion cookie in the response when active or active-conditional session affinity is required.

property.name: InsertionDomain
property.summary: Insertion Domain
property.description: The domain added to the insertion cookie in the response when active or active-conditional session affinity is required. The domain name cannot begin with a dot.

property.name: AffinityWLMOverride
property.summary: Override WebSphere Cell Session Affinity
property.description: Overrides the WebSphere Cell Session Affinity cluster configuration with the DataPower appliance configuration information below.

property.name: AffinityMode
property.summary: Set the session affinity mode
property.description: The mode of session affinity applied to this load balancer group.

property.name: InsertionAttributes
property.summary: Which attributes to insert in the cookie
property.description: Specifies the attributes to insert in the cookie in the response when active or active-conditional session affinity is required.

property.name: Active
property.summary: Enable this health check?
property.description: Enables or disables a health check. The check will not run unless enabled

property.name: URI
property.summary: XXX in http://www.foobar.com/XXX
property.description: The relative URI to test for each member of the group. XXX in http://www.foobar.com/XXX.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Port to test
property.description:
Enter the TCP Port number to test. The remote port and the member server health port interact differently depending on the type of the health check.
Standard: The member server health port is used if specified. If not specified, the remote port in the load balancer group health check is used.
LDAP: The remote port in the load balancer group health check only is used. A specification of a health port for the member server is ignored.
IMS: The health port of the member only is used. The remote port in the load balancer group health check is ignored.

property.name: SSL
property.summary: Type of health check operation
property.description: Type of health check to perform. In TCP mode (TCP Connection health check type), a health check is performed with a TCP connection request. In HTTP mode (Standard health check type), a health check is performed with an HTTP GET or HTTP POST.

property.name: Post
property.summary: Send SOAP Request?
property.description: When set to on, the SOAP Request Document will be submitted to the web service via an HTTP POST operation. When set to off (without a request document), an HTTP Get operation is sent. The expected response is always valid XML and it is then analyzed using the Xpath Expression to verify the state of health of the server.

property.name: Input
property.summary: The SOAP Request Document is only used if the send SOAP request is true.
property.description: Enter the URL of the SOAP Request Document. This may be a file on the local flash filesystem (for example, local:///healthcheck.xml). This document is POSTed to the server if Send SOAP Request is on.

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to allocate for check
property.description: Enter an integer between 2 and 86400 to indicate the number of seconds to wait for a response to a health check post. The default is 10.

property.name: Frequency
property.summary: Number of seconds between checks
property.description: Enter an integer between 5 and 86400 to indicate the number of seconds to wait between health check posts. The default is 180.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: An XPath Expression for a healthy SOAP response
property.description: Enter an XPath Expression that verifies the health of the server. The expression is applied to the server's response to the health check POST. If the expression is true, the server is healthy. Otherwise, the server health state is softdown until it passes a health check.

property.name: Filter
property.summary: Filter that analyzes response
property.description: Enter the URL of the stylesheet that evaluates the server response using the XPath Expression entered above. The default is supplied on this DataPower device.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The SSL proxy profile is deprecated. Use an SSL client profile.
property.description: Select an existing SSL proxy profile for use with this health check. This is required if the back end server is using SSL communications with the DataPower device.

property.name: EnforceTimeout
property.summary: Enforce Health Check Timeouts
property.description: Indicates whether the health check timeout value is used to interrupt and end a health transaction. By default, the health check timeout only compares the actual time that the request took. With the default behavior, the health check timeout is not used to interrupt the transaction.

property.name: IndependentChecks
property.summary: Independent Health Checks
property.description: Indicates whether the health checks within a Load Balancer Group run independently of one another. By default, health checks within a Load Balancer Group run sequentially. With the default behavior, if a server hangs, all the other health checks for the other members are delayed.

property.name: GatewayScriptChecks
property.summary: Enable GatewayScript Health Check Processing
property.description: Enables or disables GatewayScript health check processing. If enabled, content of health check requests and responses can be of any type and the response evaluator will be a GatewayScript file.

property.name: GatewayScriptReqMethod
property.summary: Set the HTTP method for health check requests
property.description: The HTTP method to use for Standard health checks with GatewayScript. If Custom is selected, a custom method name must also be specified.

property.name: GatewayScriptCustomReqMethod
property.summary: Enter the custom method
property.description: The name of the custom method to use for Standard health check requests when GatewayScript processing is enabled.

property.name: GatewayScriptReqDoc
property.summary: The Request Document is only used if the HTTP method is POST, PUT, or Custom
property.description: Enter the URL of the Request Document. This might be a file on the local flash filesystem (for example, local:///healthcheck.xml). This document is included in the request to the server if the POST, PUT, or Custom method is selected for Standard health checks with GatewayScript. If the HTTP method is Custom, the request document is optional.

property.name: GatewayScriptReqContentType
property.summary: The content type of the Request Document
property.description: Enter the content type of the Request Document for Standard health checks with GatewayScript.

property.name: GatewayScriptRspHandlerMetadata
property.summary: Metadata used by the GatewayScript response evaluator
property.description: Enter a string to be used by the GatewayScript Response Evaluator to help determine the state of the server's health.

Enter a string (UTF-8). The value entered can be accessed via the evaluator session parameter. The GatewayScript Response Evaluator must issue the following: "session.parameters.evaluator" to retrieve this data.

property.name: GatewayScriptRspHandler
property.summary: The GatewayScript file used to evaluate the health check response
property.description: Enter the URL of the GatewayScript file that evaluates the server response using the Response Evaluator Metadata. The default GatewayScript file is supplied on the DataPower appliance.

property.name: TCPConnectionType
property.summary: Type of TCP connection to attempt for health check operation
property.description: When set to full, a TCP Connection health check will perform a complete three-way handshake to establish a connection, followed by a four-way handshake to close the connection. When set to partial, a TCP Connection health check will perform a half-open connection to check a member's health. The three-way handshake to establish a connection will not be completed for partial connection types.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL profile type to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets
property.description: The SSL client profile to secure connections between the appliance and its targets.

property.name: Server
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specifies the host name or IP address of the real server.

property.name: Weight
property.summary: Weight

description.p: When balancing with Weighted Round Robin, the weight property indicates the relative priority of this server versus the other members of the group. The greater the weight indicates the higher the preference. Use an integer between 1 and 65000.

For example, assume three server pool members, A, B, and C, with assigned weights of 5, 3, and 2 respectively. As a result of this weighting, server A can expect to receive approximately 50% of client requests, server B can expect to receive approximately 30% of client requests, with server C receiving the remaining 20%.

property.name: MappedPort
property.summary: Port number

description.p: Specifies the port on the real server. If non-zero, the associated real server is contacted on this port. Normally the real server is contacted on the same port number as that of the virtual server and this should not be set to a value other than zero. However, if you have services that run on different ports for different members of the group, you might need to define this value.
The appliance checks this port when the health check type is IMS Connect.

property.name: Activity
property.description: This is a deprecated field.

property.name: HealthPort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specifies the TCP Port number to test.

property.name: LBMemberState
property.summary: Admin State of the Load Balancer Member
property.description: Enable or Disable the Load Balancer Member. If the Admin State is disabled, the member will not be used in health or forwarding checks.

value.name: GET
value.summary: Use the HTTP GET method for the health check request.

value.name: HEAD
value.summary: Use the HTTP HEAD method for the health check request.

value.name: POST
value.summary: Use the HTTP POST method for the health check request.

value.name: PUT
value.summary: Use the HTTP PUT method for the health check request.

value.name: Custom
value.summary: Use a custom method for the health check request.

value.name: Full
value.description: Perform a three-way handshake to establish a connection and a four-way handshake to close the connection.

value.name: Partial
value.description: Perform an incomplete three-way handshake, or half-open connection, by responding to a member's SYN-ACK with a RST.

value.name: Standard
value.description: The server is checked with an HTTP GET or a SOAP request to the server's health port, or if one is not specified, to the remote port.

value.name: LDAP
value.description: Deprecated - The load balancer group contains LDAP servers. The health check is performed with a TCP connection request on the remote port.

value.name: IMSConnect
value.description: Deprecated - The load balancer group contains IMS Connect servers. The health check is performed with a TCP connection request on the mapped server port.

value.name: TCPConnection
value.description: The server is checked by sending a TCP connection request to the server's health port, or if one is not specified, to the remote port.

value.name: enabled
value.summary: This load balancer member is administratively enabled. The server participates in load balancing and health check decisions.

value.name: disabled
value.summary: This load balancer member is administratively disabled. The server is not included in any load balancing decisions.

value.name: subtree
value.description: Searches the entry-level of the tree and any of its descendants.

value.name: one-level
value.description: Searches the entry-level of the tree and any object that is one level below.

value.name: base
value.summary: Searches the entry-level of the tree only.

value.name: no
value.summary: Do not enable legacy key exchange algorithms.
value.description: Do not enable support for weaker key exchange algorithms supported by legacy clients.

value.name: yes
value.description: Enable support for weaker key exchange algorithms. Note that these algorithms may be considered vulnerable.

value.name: off
value.summary: Do not accept the terms of the license agreements.
value.description: Do not accept the terms of the license agreements.

value.name: on
value.summary: Accept the terms of the license agreements.
value.description: Accept the terms of the license agreements.

value.name: accept-license
value.summary: Accept the terms of the license agreements.
value.description: Accept the terms of the license agreements.

value.name: JAXP-API
value.display: Java API for XML processing support

value.name: IPMI-LAN
value.display: Intelligent Platform Management Interface LAN channel

value.name: RealRaid
value.display: Hard Disk Array backed by a real hardware

value.name: DCO-Oracle
value.display: Extended Oracle support for the Database Connectivity Option

type.name: dmLimitSourceOption

value.name: plan-default
value.description: Use the rate limiting and burst limiting that are defined in the API plan.

value.name: collection-named
value.description: Use assembly-specific rate limiting, burst limiting, and count limiting from the API collection.

type.summary: The source of rate limiting, burst limiting, and count limiting to apply.

type.name: dmLinkAggMode

value.name: ab
value.description: Indicates that the mode is active-backup. One link is active, and the other link is standby.

value.name: lacp
value.description: Indicates that the mode uses the Link Aggregation Control Protocol (LACP). The IEEE 802.1AX-2008 standard defines LACP.

value.name: tlb
value.description: Indicates that the mode uses transmit-based load balancing.

value.name: none
value.description: Indicates that the mode is not supported. Contact IBM Support.

type.description: Operating mode of the link aggregation

value.name: active-backup
value.description: Link aggregation is active-backup. One link is active, and the other link is backup. If the active link is lost, switches to the backup link.

value.name: transmit
value.description: Link aggregation uses transmit-based load balancing. This mode uses a single link for incoming traffic but distributes outgoing traffic among all links.

value.name: LACP
value.description: Link aggregation uses the Link Aggregation Control Protocol (LACP). The IEEE 802.1AX-2008 standard defines LACP. This mode requires support on the network switch.

type.name: dmLinkFlags

value.name: member
value.description: Indicates that the link is controlled by another link.

value.name: aggregate
value.description: Indicates that the link controls itself.

value.name: virtual
value.description: Indicates that the link is a virtual interface on top of another interface.

value.name: none
value.description: Indicates that there are no relevant flags.

type.description: Flags that can be set on the interface

value.name: ok
value.description: The interface is responding to the network.

value.name: no-link
value.description: The interface is not responding to the network.

value.name: round-robin
value.description: Maintains a simple list of servers and forwards a new connection to the next server in the list.

value.name: weighted-round-robin
value.summary: Balance the servers proportionally according to weight
value.description: Maintains a weighted list of servers and forwards new connections in proportion to the weight that is assigned to each server.

value.name: hash
value.summary: Base on IP address or HTTP header of the client

description.p: Uses the IP address of the client or the value of an HTTP header as the basis for server selection.

With the hash algorithm, the same client is served by the same server. Use this algorithm only when clients access applications that require the storage of server-side state information, such as cookies. Hashing algorithms cannot ensure even distribution.
The HTTP header approach is applicable with only Multi-Protocol Gateway and Web Service Proxy services.

value.name: least-connections
value.description: Maintains a record of current active server connections and creates a new connection to the server with the least number of active connections.

value.name: first-alive
value.description: Based on the concept of a primary and some number of backup servers. Assuming that the primary server is up, all connections are forwarded to this server. Connections are forwarded to backup servers only if the health state of the primary server is down or softdown.

value.name: weighted-least-connections
value.summary: Server with fewest weighted outstanding connections
value.description: Maintains a record of the number of active server connections and creates a new connection to the server with the least number of current connections. The weighting provides a distribution of connections whereby the percentage of connections sent to any given server will match the relative weight assigned to that server. Note that if 'persistent connections' are disabled, then the number of connections in use is roughly equal to the number of requests that are outstanding. Thus, the distribution of the requests will closely follow the weight distribution. When 'persistent connections' are enabled, the long lived connection may be reused many times before a new connection is established. In the case of persistent connections, the number of individual requests to any given server may not match the weight distribution.

value.name: rpcsec-gss
value.summary: RPC Security - Generic Security Service for NFS

value.name: memory-report
value.description: Memory report

type.name: dmLogContent

value.name: none
value.description: Indicates that no logging occurs.

value.name: activity
value.description: Logs invocation only (only the resource URI is recorded).

value.name: header
value.description: Logs activity and header.

value.name: payload
value.description: Logs activity, header, and payload (body of the message).

type.summary: The type of content to be logged

property.name: Class
property.summary: Log event category
property.description: Sets an event category.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Sets the minimum priority for log event
property.description: Sets the minimum event priority. The priorities are hierarchical. From lowest to highest, the hierarchy is debug, information, notice, warning, error, critical, alert, emergency.

value.name: rotate
value.description: Rotate the log file when the maximum size is reached. The DataPower Gateway creates a copy of the file and starts a new file. The DataPower Gateway retains the archived copies up to the specified number of rotations. After reaching the maximum number of rotations and the log file reaches its maximum size, the DataPower Gateway deletes the oldest file and copies the current file.

value.name: upload
value.description: Upload the log file when the maximum size is reached. The DataPower Gateway uploads the file using the specified upload method.

value.name: ftp
value.description: Use the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) to upload the file.

value.name: scp
value.description: Use the SSH Secure Copy (SCP) protocol to upload the file.

value.name: sftp
value.description: Use the SSH File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) to upload the file.

value.name: smtp
value.description: Use the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) to upload the file.

value.name: json-icp
value.summary: Events in JSON for IBM Cloud Private format

value.name: cbe
value.summary: Events in IBM Common Base Event (CBE) format

value.name: csv
value.summary: Events in Comma Separated Value (CSV) format

property.name: IPAddress
property.summary: IP Address
property.description: The explicit IP address on which to filter.

value.name: emerg
value.description: An emergency-level message. The system is unusable.

value.name: alert
value.description: An alert-level message. Immediate action must be taken.

value.name: critic
value.description: A critical message. Immediate action should be taken.

value.name: error
value.description: An error message. Processing might continue, but action should be taken.

value.name: warn
value.description: A warning message. Processing should continue, but action should be taken.

value.name: notice
value.description: A notice message. Processing continues, but action might need to be taken.

value.name: info
value.description: An information message. No action required.

value.name: debug
value.description: A debug message for processing information to help during troubleshooting.

value.name: alert
value.summary: Alert: action must be taken immediately

property.name: Class
property.summary: Object type
property.description: Specify the object type, which is the object class. With this filter, the log target collects log messages for only the specified object classes or for only particular instances of the specified object class.

property.name: Object
property.summary: Object name

description.p: Optionally enter the name of an existing object of the selected type.

ul.li: To collect log messages for all instances of an object class, do not specify an object name.
To collect log messages for a specific instance of an object class, specify its object name.

property.name: FollowReferences
property.summary: Whether to include log messages for objects that the specified object instance references.

description.p: Indicate whether to include log messages for objects that the specified object instance references.

ul.li: When enabled, includes referenced objects.
When disabled, excludes referenced objects.

description.p: Included objects are a static snapshot when you apply the object filter. If referenced objects are added after you apply the object filter, messages for these referenced objects are not logged. For example, if you specify a particular service that has handlers and a handler is added after you apply the object filter, messages are not logged for the added handler.

type.name: dmLogPrecision

value.name: second
value.description: Write log entries with one second precision. Fractional seconds are not shown in the timestamp.

value.name: microsecond
value.description: Write log entries with microsecond precision. Six digits of subsecond precision are shown in the timestamp.

type.summary: Timestamp precision of the log entry

value.name: active
value.description: Normal operation state, no failures.

value.name: warning
value.description: Target is approaching failure conditions. Messages might be dropped.

value.name: failure
value.description: Target failed. No messages collected.

value.name: suspended
value.description: The target is busy because it is sending messages.

value.name: syslog
value.description: Uses the syslog-style timestamp.

value.name: numeric
value.description: Uses a numeric timestamp.

value.name: zulu
value.description: Milliseconds used as the timestamp format in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) in log messages yyyymmddThhmmss+oo:oo.

property.name: ID
property.summary: msgid
property.description: Specify the message ID or event code to trigger the CLI command.

property.name: Expression
property.summary: regexp
property.description: Optional: specify a regular expression as an additional trigger criteria. When a regular expression is provided, the expression must match the log message to trigger the CLI command.

property.name: OnlyOnce
property.summary: Only once
property.description: If enabled, the specified CLI command will only execute the first time the trigger conditions are met.

property.name: StopProcessing
property.summary: Stop processing further rules on match
property.description: If enabled, when this command is triggered, other commands that have the same trigger criteria will not be processed. If disabled, subsequent commands that share the same trigger criteria will process.

property.name: Command
property.summary: CLI command
property.description: Specify the command to execute if the trigger criteria are met.

value.name: console
value.description: Writes log entries to the screen when using Telnet, SSH, or command line access through the serial port.

value.name: cache
value.description: Writes log entries to system memory.

value.name: syslog
value.summary: Forwards to a remote syslog daemon (UDP)
value.description: Forwards log entries using UDP to a remote syslog daemon. The local address, remote address, remote port, syslog facility can be set. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: syslog-tcp
value.summary: Forwards to a remote syslog daemon (TCP)
value.description: Forwards log entries using TCP to a remote syslog daemon. The local address, remote address, remote port, syslog facility can be set. An SSL connection to the syslog host can be created. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: syslog-ng
value.description: Deprecated. Use syslog-tcp.

value.name: smtp
value.description: Forwards log entries as email to the configured remote SMTP servers and email addresses. Before sending, the contents of the log can be encrypted or signed. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: file
value.summary: Writes to a file in the DataPower file system
value.description: Writes log entries to a file in the DataPower file system. The file can be archived using the rotate or upload method. The file can be sent as email. The entire file can be encrypted and signed.

value.name: soap
value.description: Forwards log entries as SOAP messages. The log format must be XML or IBM Common Base Event (CBE). The URL can be set. The processing rate can be limited. Select a remote SOAP target. Routing logging messages to a local SOAP service can cause a large amount of logging feedback and increased resource consumption.

value.name: snmp
value.description: Forwards log entries as SNMP traps to configured recipients. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: nfs
value.summary: Writes to a file on an NFS server
value.description: Writes log entries to a file on a remote NFS server. The file can be archived using the rotate method. The processing rate can be limited. Note that network-file type messages are not logged to NFS log targets.

value.name: LTPA
value.description: LTPA token version used by WebSphere Application Server release earlier than version 5.1.0.2 (for z/OS) and prior to version 5.1.1 for other platforms. The default format for releases prior to version 6.1.

value.name: LTPA2
value.description: LTPA token version introduced in WebSphere Application Server version 5.1.0.2 (for z/OS) and version 5.1.1 for other platforms. The default format for version 6.1 and later.

value.name: LTPADomino
value.description: The LTPA-like Domino Session ID cookie. Domino can consume WebSphere version 1 tokens.

value.name: LTPA
value.description: LTPA token version used by WebSphere Application Server releases earlier than version 5.1.0.2 (for z/OS) and earlier than version 5.1.1 for other platforms. The default format for releases earlier than version 6.1.

value.name: LTPA1FIPS
value.description: LTPA token version that is FIPS compliant and used by WebSphere Application Server releases. This version is supported in WebSphere Application Server version 6.0 and later.

value.name: LTPA2
value.description: LTPA token version introduced in WebSphere Application Server version 5.1.0.2 (for z/OS) and version 5.1.1 for other platforms. The default format for version 6.1 and later.

value.name: LTPA2WAS7
value.description: LTPA token version 2 introduced in WebSphere Application Server version 7.0. This version is the same as previous LTPA token version 2. The difference is in the ValueType attribute of the BinarySecurityToken.

value.name: LTPADomino
value.description: The LTPA-like Domino Session ID cookie. Domino can consume WebSphere version 1 tokens.

property.name: LTPAUserAttributeName
property.summary: Name of the user attribute included in the LTPA token.
property.description: Specify the name of the user attribute included in the generated token. LTPA attributes are relevant for only WebSphere LTPA tokens.

property.name: LTPAUserAttributeType
property.summary: Type of the LTPA user attribute.
property.description: Select the type of user attribute.

property.name: LTPAUserAttributeStaticValue
property.summary: Static value of the user attribute included in the LTPA token.
property.description: Specify the fixed value of the LTPA user attribute. If the value contains the characters '$', ':', or '%', these characters are escaped.

property.name: LTPAUserAttributeXPathValue
property.summary: XPath expression that evaluates to the value of the user attribute included in the LTPA token.
property.description: Specify the XPath expression or use the XPath Tool to create the XPath expression to be evaluated against the input message at runtime. The result of which will be set as the value of the attribute.

value.name: static
value.summary: Attribute value known at configuration time.
value.description: The attribute value is known at configuration time. When selected, specify a fixed value for the named attribute.

value.name: xpath
value.summary: Attribute value resolved at runtime with an XPath expression.
value.description: The attribute value is resolved at runtime. When selected, specify the XPath expression in the input message to evaluate.

description.p: Use the following namespace for all LTPA token versions:

ul.li: http://www.ibm.com/websphere/appserver/tokentype/5.0.2/#LTPA

description.p: Use one of the following namespaces based on the LTPA token version:

ul.li: http://www.ibm.com/websphere/appserver/tokentype/5.0.2/#LTPA
http://www.ibm.com/websphere/appserver/tokentype/#LTPAv2

value.name: activeBasic
value.description: Checks the status of HA members. If required, runs synchronization.

value.name: activeEnhanced
value.description: Checks the status of HA members. If required, runs synchronization. During synchronization, restores all sessions and their login states.

value.name: co
value.description: Access with the Crypto Officer role.

value.name: cu
value.description: Access with the Crypto User role.

value.name: none
value.description: Does not use security option other than the network trust link (NTL).

value.name: htl
value.description: Use Host Trust Link (HTL). An HTL provides an additional verification layer that uses a one-time-token to secure the connection between the DataPower Gateway and the Luna HSM. For more information about host trust link, see the SafeNet Luna HSM documentation.

value.name: wlc
value.description: The weighted least connection algorithm uses an internal CPU-based weight with the number of current connections to each member to distribute incoming connections among available member. A member receives a new connection that is based on a combination of its weight (or preference) and its number of active connections. The algorithm attempts to balance the connection completion rate across members so that each member has the same number of active connections.

value.name: rr
value.description: The round robin algorithm maintains a list of members and evenly distributes incoming connections among available members. The algorithm attempts to balance the incoming connection rate across members.
