value.name: mq
value.description: The Metadata category to support IBM MQ services.

value.name: tibco
value.description: The Metadata category to support TIBCO EMS services.

value.name: wasjms
value.description: The Metadata category to support WebSphere JMS services.

value.name: http
value.summary: Metadata supported by HTTP and HTTPS protocol services
value.description: The Metadata category to support HTTP and HTTPS protocols.

value.name: header
value.summary: User-defined metadata based on names of protocol headers
value.description: The Metadata category to support user-defined metadata items from any physical or virtual protocol header.

value.name: variable
value.summary: User-defined metadata based on variable names
value.description: The Metadata category to support user-defined metadata items from any service, context, or system variable.

value.name: none
value.description: TBD

value.name: authentication_url
value.summary: From the response headers received from the authentication URL
value.description: An HTTP GET request is sent to the authentication URL and the metadata is returned in specified response headers.

value.name: external_url
value.summary: From the response headers received from an external metadata URL
value.description: An HTTP GET request is sent to an external metadata URL and the metadata is returned in specified response headers. Metadata obtained from the metadata URL overwrites any existing metadata obtained from the authentication URL.

property.name: MetaCategory
property.summary: Category for the Metadata Item
property.description: Select the category for the Metadata Item. The Metadata Item selections change according to the selected category. To create a custom Metadata Item, select either Custom Header or Custom Variable. For a custom Metadata Item, specify the name of the metadata item and its data source.

property.name: MetaName
property.summary: Alias for the Metadata Item

description.p: For all except custom items, select a Metadata Item. The list provides an alias for the actual name of a protocol header or system variable. The elements contained in the XML nodeset that is returned by the Processing Metadata object have names that correspond to the actual data source
For custom items, enter an alphanumeric string for this custom alias. The string cannot contain white space.

property.name: DataSource
property.summary: Data source for a custom item
property.description: For custom items only, enter the name of the protocol header or the name of the variable (service, context, or system) that contains the data to be returned in the metadata XML nodeset. The provided value is the name of the element in the returned nodeset that contains the data.

value.name: terminate-at-first-throttle
value.description: Monitors execute in the order in which they are listed. After any monitor either shapes (buffers to delay) or rejects a message, no further monitors will execute. If there are six monitors and the second monitor executes and rejects the message, the remaining monitors (three to six) do not execute.

value.name: terminate-at-first-match
value.description: Monitors execute in the order in which they are listed. After any monitor matches a message and takes any action at all, no further monitors will execute. If there are six monitors and the second monitor executes and logs the message, the remaining monitors (three to six) do not execute.

value.name: None
value.description: No header to extract Content-Type

value.name: MQRFH
value.description: MQRFH header to extract Content-Type

value.name: MQRFH2
value.description: MQRFH2 header to extract Content-Type

property.summary: Processing Type
property.description: Select the rule direction or type that will trigger the probe.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: XPath expression to match element in message
property.description: Specify an XPath expression of use the XPath Tool to define an XPath expression to match against messages. Messages that contain the expression will trigger the probe.

type.summary: Types of triggers that capture transactions

type.name: dmMQServiceType

value.name: MQgateway
value.description: IBM MQ Gateway.

value.name: MQhost
value.description: IBM MQ Host.

value.name: MQproxy
value.description: IBM MQ Proxy.

type.description: Type of IBM MQ service.

type.name: dmMQSSLCiphers
type.description: The available cipher specifications for use with IBM MQ SSL

property.name: ClientIP
property.summary: PCRE to match client IP addresses
property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against client IP addresses. Requests from clients with matching IP addresses will trigger the probe. To create a match for all IP addresses, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.

property.name: InURLMatch
property.summary: PCRE to match inbound URL requests
property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against the inbound URLs. Requests from clients with matching URLs will trigger the probe. To create a match for all URLs, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.

property.name: OutURLMatch
property.summary: PCRE to match outbound URL responses
property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against the outbound URLs. Responses from servers with matching URLs will trigger the probe. To create a match for all URLs, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.

property.name: RuleType
property.summary: Processing rules direction or type to match
property.description: Select the rule direction or type that will trigger the probe.

property.name: RuleMatch
property.summary: PCRE to match names of processing rules
property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against names of processing rules. Rules with matching names will trigger the probe. To create a match for all names, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: XPath expression to match element in message
property.description: Specify an XPath expression of use the XPath Tool to define an XPath expression to match against messages. Messages that contain the expression will trigger the probe.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: XPath Expression
property.description: An XPath expression that defines which schema element or schema elements are subject to this rule. Click XPath Tool to launch the XPath expression builder. To use this tool, upload an example document. After the example document is loaded, the tool allows you to select the elements to construct the corresponding XPath expression. After selecting the elements, click Done to return to the MTOM Rules Properties window.

property.name: ContentType
property.summary: Content Type
property.description: The Content Type for the extracted element data. This option overrides the value that is attained from the xmlmime:contentType attribute. If the provided XPath matches more than one element, each corresponding MIME attachment part will contain a content-type header with this value. If different content-type values are required, selective XPath expressions are required.

property.name: ContentID
property.summary: Content ID
property.description: If not explicitly configured, content IDs are automatically generated. Using this property allows for the explicit configuration of content-id headers and their associated href values. Rules that match multiple data elements result in one attachment part for all matched elements. The resulting attachment part contains data from the last match only.

property.name: MaxParts
property.description: Maximum number of parts allowed. Defaults to 4.

property.name: MaxSizePerPart
property.description: Maximum size allowed for any one part. Defaults to 5000000.

property.name: MaxSize
property.display: Maximum Aggregate Size of All Parts
property.description: Maximum size allowed for all parts combined. Defaults to 5000000.

property.name: ContentTypeRestricted
property.description: If set, this forces the individual form-data content types to be matched against the general list of request acceptable content-type expressions.

description.p: Enter the name of an input or output expected by the map. This must be the same as a cardname identified in the map file. For example, "cardnum1".

property.name: Context
property.description: Enter the name of the DataPower processing context that contains the input data or will contain the output data corresponding to the input or output expected by the map. Use INPUT to designate the context containing the original request. Use OUTPUT to designate the standard DataPower output context.

type.name: dmNamedInOutLocationType

value.name: default
value.summary: Uses input and output contexts defined at action level
value.description: The action uses the input and output contexts that are defined for the action. This value works when the map defines only one input and only one output.

value.name: explicit
value.summary: Uses explicitly defined named inputs and named outputs
value.description: The action uses the contexts that are explicitly defined for the action. The input and output contexts that are defined at the action level are ignored.

value.name: dynamic
value.summary: For Design Studio testing purposes only (Deprecated).
value.description: Used by IBM Transformation Extender Design Studio to test its generated maps against a DataPower Gateway. This value is not valid for use on the DataPower Gateway during service or action development. In other words, do not use this value in a development, test, or production environment on a DataPower Gateway.

type.summary: Named inputs and outputs can be specified explicitly or dynamically, or can default to the unnamed regular input and output.

property.name: IPAddress
property.summary: Enter the IP address of DNS server.
property.description: The IP address of a DNS server.

property.name: UDPPort
property.summary: Enter the UDP port on the DNS server.

description.p: The UDP port that the DNS server monitors. The default value is 53.
This setting is ignored with the first alive load balancing algorithm.

property.name: TCPPort
property.summary: Enter the TCP port on the DNS server.

description.p: The TCP port that the DNS server monitors. The default value is 53.
This setting is ignored with the first alive load balancing algorithm.

property.name: MaxRetries
property.summary: Set the maximum number of resolution attempts.

description.p: The maximum number of times to send a query to the DNS server. By default, an unacknowledged resolution request is attempted 3 times.
This setting is ignored with the first alive load balancing algorithm. For the first alive algorithm, define this behavior at the DNS settings level rather than the individual server level.

property.name: Prefix
property.summary: Prefix for namespace
property.description: The prefix (Prefix:) used to map namespaces that might be encountered in client requests.

property.name: URI
property.summary: URI for namespace
property.description: The URI (URI:) used to map namespaces that might be encountered in client requests.

type.name: dmNDCacheEntryState

value.name: incomplete
value.description: The cache entry is in the incomplete state. It is inaccessible.

value.name: reachable
value.description: The cache entry is in the reachable state. It is accessible.

value.name: stale
value.description: The cache entry is in the stale state. It is potentially accessible.

value.name: delay
value.description: The cache entry is in the delay state. It is inaccessible.

value.name: probe
value.description: The cache entry is in the probe state. It is inaccessible.

value.name: failed
value.description: The cache entry is in the failed state. It is inaccessible.

value.name: noarp
value.description: The cache entry is in the noarp state. It is inaccessible.

value.name: permanent
value.description: The cache entry is in the permanent state. It is always accessible.

type.summary: Gives the state of a ND cache entry.

type.name: dmNegotiateStatus

value.name: no
value.description: No negotiation

value.name: auto
value.description: Automatic negotiation

value.name: failed
value.description: Failure to negotiate

value.name: restarted
value.description: Negotiation restarted, and the negotiated mode might change

type.description: Ethernet negotiation status.

property.name: AutomaticRetry
property.summary: Advanced recovery after network error.
property.description: The device can automatically retry connecting to the remote host when a TCP connection failure occurs.

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Seconds to wait between retrying failing connections.
property.description: This sets the number of seconds to wait between attempting to retry failed connections to a remote host.

property.name: ReportingInterval
property.summary: Only log a failure as an error at this interval.
property.description: The number of failed retries between creation of error log messages.

property.name: TotalRetries
property.summary: Total number of times to retry.
property.description: Total number of times to retry before giving up.

value.name: hard
value.description: Makes this NFS mount a hard mount, which is the default behavior. Hard mounts ensure the reliable transfer of data. If the NFS server is unavailable for more than two minutes, the appliance might reboot due to a watchdog error.

value.name: soft
value.description: Makes this NFS mount a soft mount. Soft mounts can expose the risk of undetected data corruption and the loss of files read or written via NFS. If the NFS server is unavailable and the retransmit timeout and count does not complete in less than two minutes, soft mounts might prevent a reboot due to a watchdog error. Select this behavior only if preventing watchdog errors is more important than data integrity.

type.name: dmNFSMountState

value.name: new
value.summary: The mount is newly created. Mounting has not yet started.

value.name: up
value.summary: The mount process is complete and healthy. Files can be opened.

value.name: down
value.summary: The mount process is complete, but the server is down or unreachable.

value.name: unmounting
value.summary: The unmount process is in progress.

value.name: unmountingForRemount
value.summary: The unmount process is in progress to change mount parameters. When the unmount process is complete, will remount.

value.name: defective
value.summary: The mount process cannot complete because of a corrupt state or because of the configuration.

type.description: State of an NFS mount.

type.name: dmNFSMountType
type.description: Type of NFS mount service.

value.name: tcp
value.description: Uses TCP. TCP is more reliable and allows larger read and write operations than UDP. If selected and not available, falls back to UDP.

value.name: udp
value.description: Uses UDP. Some early NFS Version 2 servers support only UDP.

type.name: dmNISTComplianceMode

value.name: fips
value.description: Enable FIPS 140-2 compliance. This is a legacy compliance mode that is deprecated. Use other modes instead.

value.name: sp800_131_transition
value.summary: NIST SP 800-131a support at the transition level
value.description: Enable NIST SP 800-131a support at the transition level. The transition level has fewer restrictions than the strict level. This is a legacy compliance mode that is deprecated. Use other modes instead.

value.name: sp800_131_strict
value.summary: NIST SP 800-131a support at the strict level
value.description: Enable NIST SP 800-131a support at the strict level. This enforcement is required by some federal agencies and enterprises that work with the federal government starting in 2014.

value.name: suite_b_128
value.summary: NSA Suite B at the 128-bit support level
value.description: Enable NSA Suite B at the 128-bit support level.

value.name: suite_b_192
value.summary: NSA Suite B at the 192-bit support level
value.description: Enable NSA Suite B at the 192-bit support level.

type.description: The list of allowable NIST compliance levels for FIPS compliance.

value.name: code
value.description: Use the authorization code grant type to obtain authorization.

value.name: implicit
value.description: Uses the implicit grant type to obtain authorization.

value.name: password

value.description: Uses the resource owner password credential grant type to obtain authorization.

value.name: client
value.description: Uses the client credentials grant type to obtain authorization.

value.name: jwt
value.description: Uses the JWT grant type to obtain authorization.

value.name: novalidate

value.name: oidc

value.name: saml20bearer
value.description: Uses an SAML 2.0 bearer token to obtain authorization

value.name: replay
value.description: Uses replay cache to prevent replay attacks.

value.name: system
value.description: Uses system memory to support revocation.

value.name: custom
value.description: Uses a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file that defines how to handle revocation.

value.name: diststore
value.description: Uses storage associated with the Quota Enforcement server.

value.name: dpstate
value.description: For tracking authorization forms.

value.name: azcode

value.name: access
value.description: For tracking access tokens.

value.name: refresh

value.name: secret

value.name: ssl
value.summary: Client certificate from a mutual SSL communication
value.description: Uses the client certificate from a mutual SSL communication for authentication.

value.name: jwt
value.description: Validates the JWT that the client sends for authentication.

value.name: confidential
value.description: Clients can maintain the confidentiality of their credentials or can secure client authentication through other means.

value.name: public
value.description: Clients cannot maintain the confidentiality of their credentials or cannot secure client authentication through other means.

value.name: OAuthValidateRequest
value.description: Validates the incoming request from the client.

value.name: OAuthGenerateAZCode
value.description: Generates the authorization code for the client, which represents the resource owner's authorization that grants access to the requested resource.

value.name: OAuthVerifyAZCode
value.description: Verifies the authorization code from the client.

value.name: OAuthVerifyRefreshToken
value.description: Verifies the refresh token from the client.

value.name: OAuthCollectMetadata
value.description: Collect metadata from authentication url and metadata url.

value.name: OAuthGenerateAccessToken
value.description: Generates the access token to the client when the authorization code or refresh token is verified.

value.name: OAuthIntrospectToken
value.description: Introspects the token to determine its state. When the state is active, introspects its metadata.

value.name: OAuthRevokeToken
value.description: Revokes the token's access.

value.name: custom
value.summary: Use a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file to define all the details of the OAuth client configuration.
value.description: Uses a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file to define all the details of the OAuth client configuration.

value.name: template
value.summary: Use a combination of a stylesheet or GatewayScript file and a client template to define the OAuth client configuration.
value.description: Uses a combination of a stylesheet or GatewayScript file and a template to define the OAuth client configuration.

value.name: verboseerror
value.description: Returns verbose details and the error description if an error occurs. This feature can be enabled by setting the var://context/oauth/features variable to "verboseerror".

value.name: onetimeuse
value.summary: Access token is a one-time use token
value.description: Indicates that the access token is a one-time use token, which requires the support of token cache, distributed cache, or external caching support.

value.name: pkce
value.summary: Proof Key for Code Exchange must be used for Authorization Code Grant Type
value.description: Indicates application must use Proof Key for Code Exchange for Authorization Code Grant Type.

value.name: multipleusesrefreshtoken
value.summary: Refresh token can be reused until it expires or is revoked
value.description: Indicates whether the refresh token can be reused until it expires or is revoked.

value.name: none
value.description: TBD

value.name: implicit
value.summary: Uses the implicit grant type to obtain authorization
value.description: In the implicit flow, the client receives the access token directly from the resource owner.

value.name: password
value.summary: Uses the password credential of the resource owner to obtain authorization
value.description: In the resource owner password credentials flow, the client uses password credentials of the resource owner to obtain authorization.

value.name: jwt
value.summary: Uses JSON Web Token (JWT) Bearer Token to obtain authorization
value.description: In the JWT flow, the client uses a previously obtained JSON Web Token to obtain authorization.

value.name: application
value.summary: Uses client credentials to obtain authorization
value.description: In the client credentials flow, the client uses its own credentials to obtain authorization.

value.name: access_code
value.summary: Uses authorization codes to obtain authorization
value.description: In the authorization code flow, the client directs the resource owner to an intermediary authorization server. The server issues access token to the client after authenticating the client.

value.name: native
value.description: Uses IBM API Connect as the OAuth provider.

value.name: third_party
value.description: Uses an OAuth provider other than IBM API Connect.

value.name: azsvr
value.summary: Role is authorization server endpoints: authorization endpoint and token endpoint
value.description: For requests, the appliance is the authorization server endpoints: authorization endpoint and token endpoint.

value.name: rssvr
value.summary: Role is the enforcement point for the resource server
value.description: For requests, the appliance is the enforcement point for a resource server.

value.name: owner
value.summary: DP-OWNER header with resource owner information
value.description: Creates the DP-OWNER HTTP header. This header contains the information about the resource owner.

value.name: clientid
value.description: Creates the DP-CLIENTID HTTP header. This header contains the information about the client_id.

value.name: scope
value.description: Creates the DP-SCOPE HTTP header. This header contains the information about the scope.

value.name: miscinfo
value.description: Creates the DP-MISCINFO HTTP header. This header contains the information provided by customer.

type.name: dmPasswordFileHashAlgorithm
type.description: The hash algorithm used for user account passwords.

value.name: xmlfile
value.description: Use a DataPower AAA information file

value.name: custom
value.description: Use a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file

value.name: none
value.description: No passwords are emitted or stored in persisted configuration.

value.name: masked
value.description: All passwords are emitted and stored in the persisted configuration in a masked, obfuscated form. Obfuscation uses a passphrase.

value.name: Ethernet
value.description: Indicates that the capture is on the base Ethernet MAC interface. Traffic over any VLAN sub-interface configured on the Ethernet interface is included in the capture.

value.name: VLAN
value.description: Indicates that the capture is on an IEEE 802.1Q VLAN on top of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

value.name: Loopback
value.description: Indicates that the capture is for localhost traffic. This traffic is on the software loopback interface for Internet Protocol traffic (CIDR 127/8 in IPv4 or ::1/128 in IPv6).

value.name: Aggregate
value.description: Indicates that the capture is on an IEEE 802.3ad link aggregation interface, which is composed of one of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

value.name: Standalone
value.summary: Standalone network interfaces suitable for standalone standby control
value.description: Indicates that the capture is on standalone interfaces which are configured by the underlying operating system.

value.name: All
value.description: Indicates that the capture is on all Ethernet MAC interfaces. Packets that arrive on any Ethernet MAC interfaces are captured.

value.name: slm
value.description: An SLM peer group that uses unicast packet transmission for data exchange.

value.name: slm-multicast
value.description: An SLM peer group that uses multicast packet transmission for data exchange.

The data is decoded from the specified format on input to sign and encrypt before the operation is performed. The data is encoded into the specified format on output from verify and decrypt after the operation is performed.

value.name: smime

type.name: dmPolicyEnforcementMode

value.name: filter
value.description: Reject messages that do not satisfy the policy. If a client request or a server response does not satisfy policy, the service rejects the message. Rejection triggers error handling.

value.name: enforce
value.description: Attempts to transform messages that do not satisfy the policy by using defined policy parameters. If a client request or a server response does not satisfy policy and the configuration defines the required policy parameters, the service modifies the original message to satisfy policy. If the configuration does not contain the required policy parameters, the mode switches to filter behavior and triggers error handling. The log contains a warning message that explains the cause for failure. If the cause is a missing certificate for encryption, the log will contain an entry that is similar to the following warning: WS-SecurityPolicy Mapping: A message cannot be encrypted during enforcement.

type.summary: Select an enforcement mode for messages.

value.name: apply-policy-to-fault

value.name: custom-url
value.summary: Uses the output of a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file as the client principal name
value.description: The output of a specified custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file is used as the client principal name. Ensure that the client principal exists in the KDC and that the format of the client principal is correct. For example, HTTP/s4ualice.datapower.com@DATAPOWER.COM

value.name: ctx-var
value.summary: Uses the value of a context variable as the client principal name
value.description: The value of a specified context variable is used as the client principal name. Ensure that the client principal exists in the KDC and that the format of the client principal is correct. For example, HTTP/s4ualice.datapower.com@DATAPOWER.COM

type.summary: Where to get the Kerberos client principal

value.name: as-is-string
value.summary: Uses the string specified by the Kerberos server principal property as the server principal name
value.description: The string that is specified by the Kerberos server principal property is used as the Kerberos server principal name. Ensure that the format of the server principal is correct. For example, HTTP/was-backend.datapower.com@DATAPOWER.COM

value.name: custom-url
value.summary: Uses the output of a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file as the server principal name
value.description: The output of a specified custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file is used as the server principal name. Ensure that the format of the server principal is correct. For example, HTTP/was-backend.datapower.com@DATAPOWER.COM

value.name: ctx-var
value.summary: Uses the value of a context variable as the server principal name
value.description: The value of a specified context variable is used as the server principal name. Ensure that the format of the server principal is correct. For example, HTTP/was-backend.datapower.com@DATAPOWER.COM

type.summary: Where to get the Kerberos server principal

property.name: Collaboration
property.summary: Value of Service element in outbound ebMS2 request
property.description: Indicates the service to use. This value overrides the default service of the external partner profile configuration.

property.name: Action
property.summary: Action
property.description: Indicates the action to use. This value overrides the default action of the external partner profile configuration. When the action is not set or the action is not defined in the service of the CPA binding, the B2B Gateway uses the first action in the action list of the service.

value.name: google
value.summary: Use Google as the social login provider
value.description: Uses Google as the social login provider. When selected, DataPower processes OIDC transactions as specified by Google in https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/OpenIDConnect

value.name: oidc
value.summary: Use a social login provider that implements the OIDC specification
value.description: Use a social login provider that implements the OIDC specification, which is similar to Google.

value.name: facebook
value.summary: Use Facebook as the social login provider
value.description: Uses Facebook as the social login provider.

value.name: custom
value.description: Uses custom social login provider.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern for matching URLs
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. This set is then assigned to a specific HTTP proxy. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Skip
property.summary: Define an exception policy
property.description: A switch specifying the treatment of the URL set defined by RegExp. If set to on, the URL set is not forwarded to an HTTP proxy, and, consequently, a proxy is not identified in the Remote Address and Remote Port fields. If set to off (the default condition), the URL set is forwarded to the HTTP proxy identifed in the Remote Address and Remote Port fields.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address that in conjunction with Remote Port identifies an HTTP proxy. Not used when Skip is on.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify an integer in the range of 1 through 65535 that in conjunction with Remote Host identifies an HTTP proxy. Not used when Skip is on.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: CryptoKey
property.summary: Private Key
property.description: This is the private key to use for Pubkey authentication. Select a Crypto Key object from the list of available Key objects. Click the + button to create a new Crypto Key object. Select an object and click the ... button to edit an existing Key object.

property.name: Context
property.summary: Name by which the subscriber should be identified.

property.name: URL
property.summary: URL for pushing WSM Agent records. This will be used to create a push subscriber in WSM Agent in this domain.

property.name: PushProcessor
property.summary: File to process push records before sending to specified URL.

property.name: DampingInterval
property.summary: Specificies the interval in milliseconds by which retries will be progressively delayed. For example, if the interval is 1sec, retries will be progressively delayed by 1, 2, 3sec till the maximum specified by Maximum Damping Limit is reached beyond which retry will occur by the interval specified by Maximum Damping Limit

property.name: MaxDampingLimit
property.summary: Specificies the fixed interval in milliseconds by which retries will be attempted after the termination of the progressive damping period.

property.name: MaxPushRecords
property.summary: Specificies the maximum number of records per push to the specified URL.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: Assign the XML manager for the push processor.

property.name: URI
property.summary: Namespace URI

property.name: LocalName
property.summary: Local Name

value.name: buffer-until-verification
value.summary: Buffer messages until processing is complete
value.description: Buffers submitted messages until all processing is verified as complete. When verified, forward the messages.

description.p: Forwards messages before all processing is verified as complete. This setting can potentially increase speed.
If the XML Manager associated with this service has streaming enabled, select this option to be certain that the device will stream messages end-to-end.
If streaming of attachments is enabled, select this option.

type.name: dmRaidPhysDiskRole

value.name: other
value.description: The physical disk is neither the primary or secondary disk.

value.name: primary
value.description: The physical disk the primary (source) member of the volume. The primary disk is the one to which the other disk is synchronized.

value.name: secondary
value.description: The physical disk the secondary member of the volume. When this disk does not match the primary disk, synchronization occurs to make them match.

type.summary: Role of a disk in a RAID volume
type.description: The role of a physical disk in a RAID volume.

type.name: dmRaidPhysDiskState

value.name: online
value.description: The physical disk is online and available to the RAID volume.

value.name: missing
value.description: The physical disk is missing or not responding. It is not available to the RAID volume. Replace the disk.

value.name: not-compatible
value.description: The physical disk is present, but it is not compatible with the RAID volume. The disk could be too small or of the wrong type. Replace the disk.

value.name: failed
value.description: The physical disk is present, but it is marked as failed. The failure cause could be too many read/write errors. Replace the disk.

value.name: initializing
value.description: The physical disk is in the process of initializing.

value.name: requested-offline
value.description: The physical disk is marked as offline due to request by the software.

value.name: requested-failed
value.description: The physical disk is marked as failed due to request by the software.

value.name: other-offline
value.description: The physical disk is offline for an unspecified reason.

value.name: status/wsrr-saved-search-subscription-policyattchments-status
value.display: WSRR Saved Search Subscription Policy Attachments Status

value.name: status/wsrr-saved-search-subscription-service-status
value.display: WSRR Saved Search Subscription Service Status

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Restrict10
property.summary: Restrict to HTTP/1.0
property.description: If set to on and the protocol is HTTP the transaction will not go above HTTP/1.0.

type.name: dmResultsMultiWayMode

value.name: first-available
value.summary: Send to only the first available target

value.name: require-all
value.summary: Send to all targets, all must succeed

value.name: attempt-all
value.summary: Send to all targets, errors are non-fatal

type.summary: Method to handle multiple targets in a results action

type.name: dmResultWrapup

value.name: wssec-replace
value.display: WS-Security: Replace same type WS-Security token
value.description: There is a same token in the requesting WS-Security message. Replace that token with the generated result.

value.name: wssec-new
value.display: WS-Security: Create new WS-Security Security header for token
value.description: Outputs the result as a new WS-Security Security token. See also the SOAP actor-role property.

value.name: wssec-inject
value.display: WS-Security: Inject to existing WS-Security Security header
value.description: Outputs the result to an existing WS-Security message. All current messages are preserved.

value.name: soap-body
value.description: Outputs the result as the SOAP Body, and replace the original SOAP Body. This choice is applicable if request-response protocol handling is required.

value.name: none
value.description: Directly output the result as a single XML file.

type.description: Define how to wrap up the result.

type.name: dmRootPartNotFirstAction

value.name: process-in-order
value.summary: Process the attachments and root part in the order they appear in the original message. All parts are still processed in streaming mode even though only attachments after the root will be streamed from the network.

value.name: buffer
value.summary: Buffer attachments before the root into memory. Then process the root part, buffered attachments, and subsequent attachments.

value.name: abort
value.summary: Abort the transaction and return an error

type.summary: Action to take when MIME message root part is not first

value.name: ipv6nd

value.name: remote

type.description: The type of IP route.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Type of the routing prefix

property.name: Name
property.summary: Routing prefix
property.description:
Specifies the routing prefix that is used for API collection routing.
When the type is URI, the routing prefix is case sensitive and must begin but not end with slash (/).
When the type is host name, the prefix must not start or end with period (.). You need to specify only the first part of the host name (with domain name excluded), however, the request must use the complete URL with domain name included.

type.name: dmRoutingPrefixType

value.name: uri
value.description: The routing prefix type is URI.

value.name: host
value.summary: Host name as the routing prefix
value.description: The routing prefix type is host name.

type.summary: Select the API routing prefix type
type.description: TBD

type.name: dmRuntimeProfile

property.name: Name
property.summary: Name for this profile
property.description: Enter a name for this profile.

property.name: MaxMemory
property.summary: Maximum memory allocated to this runtime.
property.description: Enter the maximum memory allocated to this runtime. This amount of memory act as a cap for allocation resourcing. The value you enter should be sufficiently large that the largest possible transaction can be processed, but as small as possible to maximize resource availability to other parts of the system.

type.description: Profile settings within the global runtime configuration settings.

type.name: dmSAMLAction

value.name: AllHTTP
value.description: All HTTP operations. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:ghpp'

value.name: GET

value.name: PUT

value.name: HEAD
value.description: HTTP HEAD operation. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:ghpp'

value.name: General
value.description: All read, write, execute, delete, and control access to the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:ghpp'

value.name: Read
value.description: The subject can read the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc'

value.name: Write
value.description: The subject can write the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc'

value.name: Execute
value.description: The subject can execute the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc'

value.name: Delete
value.description: The subject can delete the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc'

value.name: Control
value.description: The subject can manage the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc'

value.name: NegatedRead
value.description: The subject cannot read the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc'

value.name: NegatedWrite
value.description: The subject cannot write the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc'

value.name: NegatedExecute
value.description: The subject cannot execute the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc'

value.name: NegatedDelete

value.name: NegatedControl
value.description: The subject cannot manage the resource. Namespace URI is 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc'

type.description: Specify what action the subject can take on the resource.

property.name: SourceType
property.summary: The type of data source to get the value of the SAML attribute.
property.description:
Specify the data source to retrieve the value for each SAML attribute.
If the Data Source Type is a variable, configure a DataPower service or context variable name with Data for Attribute Value. That variable must contain a result element with a list of attribute sub elements. Each attribute element must contain a name attribute, which is used to match the Supplementary Data setting. A sample to describe the format of the variable content:
<result> <attribute-value name="cn">Alice</attribute-value> <attribute-value name="sn">Alice</attribute-value> <attribute-value name="creatorsName"> cn=Manager,dc=datapower,dc=com</attribute-value> </result>

property.name: Name
property.summary: The SAML attribute name.
property.description:
Specify the name of the SAML attribute to be generated.
When the Data Source Type is variable, this setting can be an empty string. In that case, the attribute name that is carried by the variable's content is used.

property.name: Format
property.summary: The optional URI to restrict the SAML attribute.

description.p: Specify the optional Namespace URI for the SAML 1.x attribute,
Optional: Specify the NameFormat value for the SAML 2.0 attribute.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: The XPath expression to extract the value of the SAML attribute from the input message.
property.description:
Specify the XPATH information to get the value for the SAML attribute when the attribute value is From Input Message, and specify the XPath expression to locate the value.
The XML nodes that the XPath expression points to is the value for the SAML attribute.

property.name: ValueData
property.summary: The data to get the value for the SAML attribute.
property.description:
Specify the information to get the value for the SAML attribute.
If the attribute contains a Static Value per each AAA Policy, specify the static string value.
If the Data Source Type is variable, specify the variable name. You can input an empty string as the variable name to use the default variable var://context/ldap/auxiliary-attributes. That variable is maintained by the LDAP authentication or authorization to query auxiliary LDAP attributes.
In any case, the variable that is being used here must contain a result element with a list of attribute sub elements. Each attribute element must contain a name attribute, which is used to match the Supplementary Data setting. The following sample describes the format of the variable content.
<result> <attribute-value name="cn">Alice</attribute-value> <attribute-value name="sn">Alice</attribute-value> <attribute-value name="creatorsName"> cn=Manager,dc=datapower,dc=com</attribute-value> </result>

property.name: SubValueData
property.summary: The extra information used to get the value of the SAML attribute.

description.p: When the SAML attribute value is retrieved from a variable as defined in Data for Attribute Value setting, specify the value to match the name attribute of the attribute-value elements that are carried by that variable.

<result> <attribute-value name="cn">Alice</attribute-value> <attribute-value name="sn">Alice</attribute-value> <attribute-value name="creatorsName"> cn=Manager,dc=datapower,dc=com</attribute-value> </result>

When this value is empty, the value of each attribute-value element is treated as one SAML AttributeValue. Therefore, if multiple attribute-values are carried by the DataPower variable, there can be multiple SAML AttributeValues in one SAML Attribute element.

property.name: FriendlyName
property.summary: A more meaningful name for the SAML attribute.
property.description: Specify a meaningful name for the SAML attribute.

property.name: URI
property.summary: Namespace URI for the attribute.

description.p: The Namespace URI for the attribute. The Namespace URI must match on a name. If blank, uses the null namespace.
For example, "http://www.examples.com" would match a message with the following attribute:
<Attribute AttributeName="cats" AttributeNamespace="http://www.example.com"> <AttributeValue>Winchester</AttributeValue><Attribute>

property.name: LocalName
property.summary: Local name of the attribute.

description.p: The local name of the attribute. For example, "cats" would match a message with the following attribute:
<Attribute AttributeName="cats" AttributeNamespace="http://www.example.com"> <AttributeValue>Winchester</AttributeValue><Attribute>

property.name: Value
property.summary: Value for the attribute.

description.p: The value for the attribute with the corresponding name. For example, "Winchester" would match the following attribute:
<Attribute AttributeName="cats" AttributeNamespace="http://www.example.com"> <AttributeValue>Winchester</AttributeValue><Attribute>

value.name: var
value.summary: Retrieve the value from a DataPower variable.
value.description: The value of the SAML attribute is identified by the DataPower variable and XML element of an XML doc carried by that variable.

value.name: xpath
value.summary: Fetch the value from the XML doc with an XPath expression.
value.description: The value of the SAML attribute is identified by the XPath expression.

value.name: static
value.summary: The SAML attribute has a static value.
value.description: The metadata category to support user-defined metadata items from any physical or virtual protocol header.

value.name: xpath
value.description: Evaluates a custom XPath expression against the SAML attribute statement.

value.name: any
value.summary: Must match at least one name.
value.description: Ensures the presence of at least one configured SAML attribute.

value.name: all
value.description: Ensures the presence of all configured SAML attributes.

value.name: any-value
value.summary: Must match at least one name and value.
value.description: Ensure at least one configured SAML attribute name and value is found in the SAML attribute statement.

value.name: all-values
value.summary: Must match all names and values.
value.description: Ensures all configured SAML attribute names and values are found in the SAML attribute statement.

type.name: dmSAMLProtocol

value.name: assertion
value.summary: Generate only the SAML assertion. No special need for SAML protocols or profiles.
value.description: The SAML assertion can be put to WS-Security wrap up later. However, the SAML assertion is not required to respond to any SAML specific requests.

value.name: response
value.description: The SAML assertion is put in to an SAML response element. This choice might indicate that the request message contains some SAML protocol information for the response, such us the AuthnRequest.

type.description: Define the scenario to generate the SAML assertion for.

type.name: dmSAMLStatementType
type.description: The type of SAML assertion.

type.name: dmSAMLSubjectConfirmationType
type.description: The Subject Confirmation method for SAML assertion.

type.name: dmSAMLVersion
type.description: The version of SAML messages.

value.name: pre-requisite
value.summary: Validate this policy and all matching policies before accepting
value.description: All matching profiles in the Application Security Policy are run. A failure of any of these profiles results in the failure of the transaction. Only when all matching profiles are successful will the transaction be accepted. A typical use of this style would be a broad match that enforces a basic item, such as maximum size, that is followed up with more specific matches with stronger criteria.

value.name: admission
value.summary: Validate this policy only before accepting
value.description: Only this policy is run. If successful, the transaction is accepted.

property.name: Rule
property.summary: A processing rule
property.description: Select the rule to run.

property.name: Interval
property.summary: Seconds between invocations
property.description: Specify the interval between invocations in seconds. A value of 0 indicates a single invocation.

value.name: high
value.description: A service or transaction assigned this priority setting will receive above normal scheduling priority and resource allocation.

value.name: normal
value.description: A service or transaction assigned this priority setting will receive normal scheduling priority and resource allocation.

value.name: low
value.description: A service or transaction assigned this priority setting will receive below normal scheduling priority and resource allocation.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: An XPath Expression selecting elements of the Schema document
property.description: This is an XPath expression that identifies elements of the Schema document. These are the elements excepted from schema validation.

property.name: ExceptionType
property.summary: Exception Type
property.description: Select the Exception type for encryption.

value.name: AllowEncrypted
value.description: Indicates that the element might or might not be encrypted in the document that is under validation.

value.name: RequireEncrypted
value.description: Indicates that the element must be encrypted in the document that is under validation. If not encrypted, validation fails.

property.name: Matching
property.summary: Matching rule
property.description: Select the matching rule that is applied to candidate XML documents. Documents whose URL conforms to an expression contained in the matching rule are subject to XML schema validation.

property.name: ValidationMode
property.summary: Validation procedure
property.description: Select the procedure to use to validate a schema.

property.name: SchemaURL
property.summary: The URL of an XML schema
property.description: Enter the URL of the schema to use for validation. Used only when the Validation Mode is schema or schema-rewrite.

property.name: URLRewritePolicy
property.summary: URL rewrite policy
property.description: Select a URL Rewrite Policy from the list. Used only the Validation Mode is attribute-rewrite or schema-rewrite.

property.name: DynamicSchema
property.summary: Dynamic schema
property.description: Select a dynamic schema used to perform document validation regardless of any validation processing instructions contained within the document. Dynamic schemas used Schema Exception Maps or Document Crypto Maps.

property.name: SearchDomain
property.summary: Enter the domain name.
property.description: The name of a domain to search. Examples are example.com and ibm.com.

value.name: allow
value.description: Allow access to this host and port.

value.name: deny
value.description: Deny access to this host and port.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Host name or IP address of the application server
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the application server. When blank, the rule applies to only the specified port on all hosts.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Listening port on the application server
property.description: Specify the listening port of the application server. The special value of 0 indicates that the rule applies to all ports on the specified host.

property.name: Access
property.summary: Indicate whether access to this application server and port should be allowed or denied.
property.description: Indicate whether to allow or deny access to this application server and port. When you specify allow for any one member, all other destinations are denied except for the ones explicitly allowed.

value.name: strict
value.description: Items are added to the security header following the numbered layout rules described in the WS-Security Policy specification.

value.name: lax
value.description: Items are added to the security header in any order that conforms to WSS:SOAP Message Security.

value.name: laxtimestampfirst
value.description: As Lax except that the first item in the security header MUST be wsse:Timestamp.

value.name: laxtimestamplast
value.description: As Lax except that the last item in the security header MUST be wsse:Timestamp.

value.name: basic-auth
value.description: When you use basic authentication header, you require users to provide valid user name and password to access the endpoint.

value.name: no
value.summary: Does not include a banner message
value.description: Does not include a banner message during SSH preauthentication phase.

value.name: yes
value.description: Includes a banner message during SSH preauthentication phase.

type.name: dmSensorDataType

value.name: other
value.description: A measure other than those listed below

value.name: unknown
value.description: Unknown measurement, or abitrary, relative numbers

value.name: voltsAC
value.description: Electric potential, Alternating Current

value.name: voltsDC
value.description: Electric potential, Direct Current

value.name: watts
value.description: Electric power in Watts

value.name: hertz
value.description: Frequency of oscillation measured in Hertz.

value.name: celsius
value.description: Temperature measured in Degrees Celsius.

value.name: percentRH
value.description: Relative Humidity as a percentage between 0 and 100.

value.name: rpm
value.description: Rotational speed in Rotations per Minute.

value.name: cmm
value.description: Volume in Cubic Meters per Minute.

value.name: truthvalue
value.description: Truth value, 1 if true, 2 if false.

type.summary: Identifies the measurement data type for a sensor.

type.name: dmSensorReadingStatus

value.name: lowerNonRecoverable
value.description: The current sensor reading value is below the lower non-recoverable threshold, which indicates that there is a risk of damaging the hardware if the device is allowed to remain in this state. If you cannot alleviate the cause of this reading, you should power down the device.

value.name: lowerCritical
value.description: The current sensor reading value is below the lower critical threshold, which indicates that the system is faulty, and may not be operating properly.

value.name: lowerNonCritical
value.summary: Sensor value is at low warning
value.description: The current sensor reading value is below the lower non-critical threshold, which is a warning that it is getting close to too low. The system should operate normally, but the cause of the sensor value should be investigated.

value.name: ok
value.description: The current sensor reading value is OK, and is within all limits.

value.name: upperNonCritical
value.summary: Sensor value is at high warning
value.description: The current sensor reading value is above the upper non-critical threshold, which is a warning that it is getting close to too high. The system should operate normally, but the cause of the sensor value should be investigated. This is commonly used on temperature sensors, where the investigation would be checking ambient air temperature and air flow.

value.name: upperCritical
value.description: The current sensor reading value is above the upper critical threshold, which indicates that the system is faulty, and may not be operating properly.

value.name: upperNonRecoverable
value.description: The current sensor reading value is above the upper non-recoverable threshold, which indicates that there is a risk of damaging the hardware if the device is allowed to remain in this state. If you cannot alleviate the cause of this reading, you should power down the device.

value.name: failure
value.description: The reading indicates a failure. Used for non-numeric readings.

value.name: noReading
value.description: The attempt to read the sensor failed, so the status cannot be checked.

value.name: invalid
value.description: An internal software error has been detected checking the status.

type.description: Gives the failure status for the current sensor reading. Indicates whether the reading is acceptable, and if not, why it is unacceptable.

value.name: var://service/response-mode
value.summary: Get the flag if the message is a response or not.
value.description: If the message is a response, this service variable returns the response-mode value.

value.name: var://service/rule-direction
value.summary: Get the direction of traffic that the rule is processing.
value.description: If the rule is processing a request message, this service variable returns 1. If the rule is processing a response message, this service variable returns 2.

value.name: var://service/slm-policy-name
value.summary: Used by SLM logic to associate a particular transaction to its resolved policy name.

value.name: var://service/URI
value.summary: Get or set the request URI of a transaction

value.name: var://service/time-forwarded
value.summary: Get Timestamp of Request Message Forwarded

value.name: var://service/memory-used
value.description: The total memory used for a transaction.

value.name: var://service/error-code
value.description: The assigned error code from the Result Code table.

value.name: var://service/error-message
value.description: The variable contains the detailed error condition causing the multistep processing to abort. Setting the variable will overwrite the error response to the client in an error condition.

value.name: var://service/error-protocol-response
value.description: Overwrite the protocol response code in an error condition.

value.name: var://service/xmlreqrspmode
value.description: The XML processing mode could be soap, xml, unprocessed

value.name: var://service/error-protocol-reason-phrase
value.description: Overwrite the protocol reason phrase in an error condition. The reason phrase is intended to give a short textual description of the protocol error response for human consumption.

value.name: var://service/error-subcode
value.description: Often the subcode is the same as var://service/error-code. Sometimes it is a more specific result code. It is used to help disambiguate the reason for invoking an error rule.

value.name: var://service/error-headers
value.description: The name of the HTTP header field that contains error information.

value.name: var://service/formatted-error-message
value.description: The error response send back to the client. The response can be overwritten by writing to var://service/error-message.

value.name: var://service/error-ignore
value.description: The flag that controls how the Front Side Handler processes error condition. If the value is set and greater than zero, it does not run any error handling actions and produces a regular response. The content of the message is produced by an error rule.

value.name: var://service/strict-error-mode
value.description: The setting controls the error mode for multistep processing. If set all dp:reject invocations will abort multistep processing. If it is not set, dp:reject with @strict-only = 'true' will only be logged but not abort multistep processing.

value.name: var://service/soap-fault-response
value.summary: Set when response rule input is treated as a soap fault
value.description: The flag indicates that the input to the response rule was a soap fault.

value.name: var://service/soap-oneway-mep
value.summary: Notify the transaction of a SOAP one-way Message Exchange Pattern
value.description: Notify the service layer that this transaction is performing a one-way MEP (Message Exchange Pattern) operation. This enables the service layer to optimize resource usage. When using WSA and one-way MEP's, service layer will timeout waiting for a response. Set this variable to true to prevent this.

value.name: var://service/max-call-depth
value.description: Defaults to 128 in each transaction. It controls how many levels of called rules can be layered before an error is thrown.

value.name: var://service/max-action-depth
value.description: Defaults to 128 in each transaction. It controls how many levels of directly-invoked actions, such as loops of loops, can be layered before an error is thrown.

value.name: var://service/system/frontwsdl
value.summary: Get Frontside WSDL URL of Service

value.name: var://service/global-transaction-id
value.summary: Get Identifier of Global Transaction ID

value.name: var://service/transaction-client
value.summary: Get IP Address of Transaction Client

value.name: var://service/current-call-depth
value.description: Returns the current depth of called rules. The maximum is set in var://service/max-call-depth.

value.name: var://service/routing-url
value.description: This variable is an addition to dp:set-target() for dynamically routed gateways. The latter does not let you specify a protocol, but you express a routing-url just like the gateway backend-url. Whether the URI is honored depends on the propogate-uri property. This variable is implemented for XML Firewall objects, but it generates an error if the protocol is not HTTP or HTTPS. For a Multi-Protocol Gateway, it can be any valid backend protocol. Another key difference is that this variable can only be set once. The set-target can be called multiple times with the last one taking precedence. The advantage is that a connection is started immediately even while other multistep processing is occurring and less data might have to be buffered. Using this variable might cause a wrong determination of the content-type for MIME documents. If you encounter such a problem, use var://service/routing-url-delay-content-type-determination instead.

value.name: var://service/routing-url-sslprofile
value.summary: Get or set Routing URL SSL Profile
value.description: This variable sets the SSL profile that is used for dynamic route. Use this variable when the back side SSL configuration for the service is not sufficient for the dynamic route. Use this variable before var://service/routing-url.

value.name: var://service/routing-url-delay-content-type-determination
value.summary: Get or set Routing URL with delayed Content-Type Determination
value.description: This variable is a variant of var://service/routing-url. It functions the same as var://service/routing-url, except that it delays the content-type determination for MIME documents, which in certain scenarios helps the DataPower appliance send the content-type of the MIME documents (not the content-type of the root document in the MIME document) to the back-end server. Use var://service/routing-url first. If the appliance sends the wrong content-type to the back-end server, use this variable instead.

value.name: var://service/persistent-connection-counter
value.description: This variable notes the number of transactions that were completed on the current protocol session.

value.name: var://service/connection/note
value.description: This variable allows the user to annotate the current protocol session. The annotation could be an identifier which can be used to maintain state based on an existing protocol session.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/skip-backside
value.description: This variable set to 1 in a Multi-Protocol Gateway during front side processing allows to skip the backside from running, which makes a loopback essentially. Any data written to the backside will try and be written to the frontside instead.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/backend-timeout
value.description: This variable allows the user to get or set the backend timeout in a Multi-Protocol Gateway. Setting this variable will override the default timeout. It is expressed in seconds, and valid values are 1-86400.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/request-size
value.description: The size of the message received by front side protocol handler in bytes, excluding headers.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/response-size
value.description: The size of the message received by the back end in bytes, excluding headers.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/proxy-http-response
value.summary: Force the service to pass the response code from the server to the client
value.description: This variable controls whether to force the service to pass the response code from the server to the client. Setting this variable to 1 forces the service to pass the response code without any modification and regardless of any error condition. However, if you set a custom response code in the error rule with the <var://service/error-protocol-response> service variable, the service passes this custom response code instead.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/transaction-timeout-ms-threshold
value.summary: Override the static transaction timeout for a Multi-Protocol Gateway on a per transaction basis
value.description: This variable overrides the static transaction timeout for a Multi-Protocol Gateway on a per transaction basis. The transaction timeout is the duration for a transaction in milliseconds before it is canceled. The transaction starts when the handler receives the request. You can check or reset the timer for the transaction timeout with the var://service/mpgw/transaction-timeout-ms-count variable.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/transaction-timeout-ms-count
value.display: Timer in milliseconds for transaction timeout for Multi-Protocol Gateway
value.summary: Gets or sets the timer in milliseconds for the Multi-Protocol Gateway transaction timeout
value.description: This variable gets or sets the transaction timer in milliseconds for the Multi-Protocol Gateway transactional timeout. When read, it gets the current transaction timer. When written, it sets the transaction timer to the specified value.

value.name: var://service/http/websocket-upgrade
value.summary: Force the service to forward the WebSocket upgrade request from the client to the server
value.description: This variable controls whether to force the service to forward the WebSocket upgrade request from the client to the server. Setting this variable to 0 forces the service to strip the WebSocket upgrade header when sending the request to the server.

value.name: var://service/header-manifest
value.description: Lists all protocol headers of current transaction.

value.name: var://service/set-request-header/
value.description: This variable correlates directly to the dp:set-request-header() extension function. var://service/set-request-header/FOO to value BAR would set the request header FOO to BAR.

value.name: var://service/set-response-header/
value.description: This variable correlates directly to the dp:set-response-header() extension function. var://service/set-response-header/FOO to value BAR would set the request header FOO to BAR.

value.name: var://service/original-content-type
value.summary: Get Original Request Content-Type Header Value
value.description: Returns the original request Content-Type header value. The value remains unmodified and is not subject to both service header rewrites and multistep header rewrites.

value.name: var://service/tls-info
value.description: Lists various attributes of the current TLS connection, including TLS version and any SNI extension header. This is a read-only service variable.

value.name: var://service/reply-to-q
value.description: When write changes the dynamic routing.

value.name: var://service/reply-to-qm
value.description: When write changes the dynamic routing.

value.name: var://service/mqfte-integ-id
value.summary: Set the Integration ID for an IBM MQFTE session

value.name: var://service/wsm/back-binding-data
value.summary: Get WSM Backend (Original) Service Binding data

value.name: var://service/wsm/back-service-port-operation
value.summary: Get WSM Backend (Original) Service Port Operation

value.name: var://service/wsm/strict-fault-document-style
value.summary: Do not expect RPC wrappers on RPC faults

value.name: var://service/wsm/part-exists/
value.description: Internal variable used to test whether a part is referenced in the wsdl. Returns 1 or 0.

value.name: var://service/wsm/part-is-xml-element/
value.description: Internal variable used to test whether a part is referenced in the wsdl and is a schema validatable xml element. Returns 1 or 0.

value.name: var://service/wspolicy/required-policy-subjects
value.summary: Internal bitmask of policy subjects that require multistep actions

value.name: var://service/wspolicy/enforcement-mode
value.summary: Get policy enforcement mode (filter or enforce)

value.name: var://service/wspolicy/sla-enforcement-mode
value.display: Service Level Agreement Policy Enforcement Mode
value.summary: Get SLA policy enforcement mode (allow or reject)

value.name: var://service/wspolicy/gateway-name
value.display: Name of the gateway enforcing wspolicy
value.summary: Get the name of the Gateway

value.name: var://service/wspolicy/correlator-id
value.display: Policy Correlator ID for the current transaction
value.summary: Connects the generated Policy with a WSDL.

value.name: var://service/conformance/generatedPolicy
value.display: WS-Proxy Conformance Policy Name generated from WS-Policy
value.summary: WS-Proxy Conformance Policy Name generated from WS-Policy

value.name: var://service/multistep/input-context-name
value.summary: Input context name to current processing action

value.name: var://service/multistep/output-context-name
value.summary: Output context name to current processing action

value.name: var://service/multistep/loop-iterator
value.description: Get the loop iterator for the innermost for-each action. If the for-each action is set to run with a fixed iteration count, this variable retrieves the input context of the loop action. If the loop runs over a node-set, this retrieves the current element within the node-set.

value.name: var://service/multistep/loop-count
value.description: Get the current loop count for the innermost for-each action. If the current action is the first action run within the loop returns 1; the second action, 2; and so on.

value.name: var://service/multistep/tx-warn
value.description: Get the WTX warning messages from the transforming process. When the DPA file has defined warning conditions and you have enabled the WTX warning option in XML Manager configuration, this variable returns the warning message if the transforming process meets the warning conditions.

value.name: var://service/wsm/http-parsed-url-replacement
value.display: WSDL HTTP Binding Parsed URL Replacement Algorithm
value.summary: WSDL HTTP Binding Parsed URL Replacement Algorithm

value.name: var://service/wsm/wsdl-content-type
value.summary: The HTTP Content-Type specified by the WSDL

value.name: var://service/b2b-message-id
value.description: The message ID of the received B2B document. For outbound transactions, the value could be set in processing policy to customize the ID.

value.name: var://service/b2b-partner-destination
value.description: The destination where the document will be routed. The value of this variable must match an existing destination configured in partner profile.

value.name: var://service/b2b-doc-type
value.description: Type of EDI message being transferred through a B2B gateway. This may have one of the string values "x12", "edifact", "xml", or "binary".

value.name: var://service/b2b-routing-stylesheet
value.summary: Stylesheet to handle outbound document routing
value.description: URL of a stylesheet that handles routing for outbound documents. This may determine or override the document type and trading or receiving partner IDs. It is set from configuration.

value.name: var://service/b2b-xpath-routing-info
value.summary: XPaths used for outbound document routing for XML EDI messages
value.description: The value of this variable is an XML tree containing sets of routing XPaths used for routing outbound XML EDI messages. This may determine or override the document type and trading or receiving partner IDs. It is set from configuration.

value.name: var://service/b2b-incoming-as
value.description: True if incoming message came in on AS fsph, false otherwise

value.name: var://service/b2b-signed-message-b64mic-and-alg
value.display: B2B Signed Message Base64 Encoded MIC And Algorithm
value.summary: B2B Signed Message Base64 Encoded MIC And Algorithm
value.description: Base64 encoded string of the mic digest calculated over the data in an incoming signed message, plus the digest algorithm used.

value.name: var://service/b2b-aaa-policy-name
value.description: Name of the AAA Policy attached to the frontside protocol handler, if any.

value.name: var://service/b2b-process-attachment-as-payload
value.display: B2B Process Email Attachment As Payload
value.summary: B2B Process Email Attachment As Payload
value.description: First attachment in message received over POP3 FSPH is used for B2B payload

value.name: var://service/b2b-save-sink-protocol-contents
value.description: Save copy of on-the-wire contents for B2B viewer and archive. True if protocol is AS or incoming is non-AS.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-from-partyid-type
value.description: The type of the ebXML party ID. When this variable is set and the associated party ID is not configured as DUNS or DUNS+4 type, the value is used during ebMS message packaging process.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-to-partyid-type
value.description: The type of the ebXML party ID. When this variable is set and the associated party ID is not configured as DUNS or DUNS+4 type, the value is used during ebMS message packaging process.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-utc-timestamp
value.summary: The current timestamp in UTC format.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-timestamp-in-received-message
value.summary: The timestamp in the incoming message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/sync-reply
value.summary: If the inbound ebXML message requests a sync reply.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/sync-reply
value.summary: If the outbound ebXML message to request a sync reply.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/ack-requested

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/ack-requested
value.summary: If the outbound ebXML message to request an acknowledgement.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/ack-signature-requested

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/ack-signature-requested
value.summary: If the outbound ebXML message to request the signatures in the acknowledgement.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/duplicate-elimination
value.summary: If the inbound ebXML message requests duplicate elimination.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/duplicate-elimination
value.summary: If the outbound ebXML message to request duplicate elimination.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/time-to-live
value.summary: The expiration date of the inbound ebXML message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/time-to-live
value.summary: The expiration date of the inbound ebXML message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-msg-type-to-send
value.summary: The type of the ebXML message to send.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-msg-type-received
value.summary: The type of the received ebXML message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-msg-digests
value.summary: The ebXML message digests generated for the packaging message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-parsed-msg-digests
value.summary: The ebXML message digests parsed from incoming message (either an inbound User message, or asynchronous Ack or a synchronous Ack).

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-error/error-code
value.description: The error code for the ebXML error message. It indicates the nature of the error in the message in error.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-error/description
value.description: The description for the ebXML error message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-error/severity
value.description: The severity for the ebXML error message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-error/location
value.description: The location for the ebXML error message. It points to the part of the ebXML message containing the error.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-ack-url
value.description: The URL to return asynchronous acknowledgement message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-error-url
value.description: The URL to return asynchronous error message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-partner-from-role
value.description: The role of the 'from' partner.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-partner-to-role
value.description: The role of the 'to' partner.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-cpa-id
value.description: The CPA Id used in the ebXML message. It is a string that identifies the parameters governing the exchange of messages between two parties.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-conversation-id
value.description: The conversation Id of the ebXML message. It is used to identified the set of related messages that make up a conversation between two parties.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-service
value.description: The service of the ebXML message. It identifies the service that acts on the message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-service-type
value.description: The service type of the ebXML message. It identifies the type that acts on the message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-action
value.description: The action of the ebXML message. It identifies a process within a Service that processes the message.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-ref-to-message-id

value.summary: The context to be packaged in ebMS format

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/inbound/header-parser-completed
value.summary: An internal stage used to match partner profiles and identify CPA collaboration based on inbound ebMS message header at transaction time.

value.name: var://service/b2b-ebms-setting/outbound/generate-start-parameter
value.summary: Indicator of whether we should generate the start parameter for the Content-Type header of ebMS outbound message
