value.name: poll
value.description: The WebSphere Cell information is retrieved on a fixed time interval regardless of whether the WebSphere Cell configuration has changed.

value.name: subscribe
value.description: The WebSphere Cell information is retrieved with a request that waits for either the duration of the Time Interval to expire or for the WebSphere Cell information to change, whichever occurs first. After the appliance receives the response, the appliance immediately sends another request that again awaits for either the time interval expiration or an update. This method might result in several updates within a short amount of time. It consumes more resources on the appliance and also on the server that is running the ODCInfo application. This method is more appropriate when application routing is enabled.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: UploadChunked
property.description: Select on to enable RFC 2616-compliant chunked encoding. Note that the receiving server must implement the specification to receive this encoding.

value.name: reject
value.summary: Reject the transaction and raise an error

property.name: Pattern
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern
property.description:
A shell-style match pattern that defines the URL set contained within the URL map. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

value.name: default
value.description: Caches the stylesheet until the maximum cache size is exceeded. Then, the stylesheet is subject to removal from the cache.

value.name: no-cache
value.description: Does not cache the stylesheet.

value.name: no-flush
value.description: Caches the stylesheet on a preferential basis. The stylesheet will never be deleted from the stylesheet cache before its schedule refresh.

value.name: protocol-specified
value.description: Defers to expiration semantics of protocols, such as HTTP, if they provide such information.

property.name: URLMap
property.summary: A URL map
property.description: URL maps contain one or more shell-style (wildcard) match patterns. Use the values list to select the URL map that supplies the match criteria for the URL Refresh Policy.

property.name: URLRefreshPolicy
property.summary: Type of refresh rule
property.description: Specify how to cache a stylesheet that is obtained with a URL refresh operation. The default is default.

property.name: URLRefreshInterval
property.summary: The refresh frequency in seconds
property.description: Not used when the refresh rule type is no-cache, specifies the update frequency for stylesheets that fulfill the match criteria.

value.name: all
value.summary: The policy applies to both requests and responses

value.name: request
value.summary: The policy applies to requests only

value.name: response
value.summary: The policy applies to responses only

property.name: Type
property.summary: Rule type
property.description: Select the type of rule for the URL Rewrite Policy.

property.name: MatchRegexp
property.summary: PCRE

description.p: Specify a PCRE that defines the match condition that triggers the rewrite rule. Depending on the rule type, a candidate URL or header field is matched against the expression.

ul.li: For absolute-rewrite , content-type , and post-body , defines the expression to be matched against the URL. For example, .* or * matches any string, while (.*)xsl=(.*)\?(.*) matches a text subpattern followed by xsl= followed by a text subpattern followed by a ? followed by a text subpattern.
For header-rewrite , defines the expression to be matched against the contents of a specific header field. For example, *.* matches any value.

description.p: PCRE documentation is available at http://www.pcre.org

property.name: InputReplaceRegexp
property.summary: Perl-style replacement expression

description.p: Specify a Perl-style replacement that defines the rewritten URL, header field, or HTTP POST body.

ul.li:
For absolute-rewrite , defines the rewritten URL. If the match pattern is *, specify the complete replacement. If the match pattern is (.*)xsl=(.*)\?(.*), specify the evaluation replacement for any text subpattern or retain the original subpattern. To retain the first subpattern, specify $1; to retain the second text subpattern, specify $2; and so forth. To replace the second text subpattern only, specify $1xsl=ident.xsl$3.
If a rewritten URL begins with a host name or port that is different from the configured remote address, the host name or port portion of the rewritten URL is ignored.
For content-type , define the replace value for the Content-Type header.
For header-rewrite , define the replacement value for the specified header.

For post-body , define the rewritten body of the HTTP POST. If the match pattern is .*, specify the complete replacement. If the match pattern is (.*)xsl=(.*)\?(.*), specify the evaluation replacement for any text subpattern or retain the original subpattern. To retain the first subpattern, specify $1; to retain the second text subpattern, specify $2; and so forth. To omit the second text subpattern only, specify $1$3.

property.name: StyleReplaceRegexp
property.summary: Perl-style replacement expression

description.p: Specify a Perl-style replacement that identifies the replacement stylesheet. This option is available for absolute-rewrite and post-body only.

If the match pattern is .*, specify the complete replacement. If the match pattern is (.*)xsl=(.*)\?(.*), specify the evaluation replacement for any text subpattern or retain the original subpattern. To retain the first subpattern, specify $1; to retain the second text subpattern, specify $2; and so forth. To retain the second text subpattern only and not use the third text subpattern, specify http://mantis:8000$2.

property.name: InputUnescape
property.summary: Decode/encode input URLs
property.description: Replace URL-encoded characters (for example, "%2F") with the equivalent literal character. Select on to replace escape sequences, or off to retain them.

property.name: StylesheetUnescape
property.summary: Decode/encode stylesheet URLs
property.description: Replace URL-encoded characters (for example, "%2F") with the equivalent literal character. Select on to replace escape sequences, or off to retain them.

property.name: Header
property.summary: Name HTTP Header to Rewrite

property.name: NormalizeURL
property.summary: Normalize URL
property.description: Normalize URL by converting '\' to '/' and compressing '.' and '..'

value.name: absolute-rewrite
value.summary: Rewrites the entire URL or a portion of the URL based on a URL match.

value.name: post-body
value.summary: Rewrites the body of an HTTP POST request. The POST body contains the input values for a basic HTTP POST request.

value.name: header-rewrite
value.summary: Replaces the value of an arbitrary header based on its value.

value.name: content-type
value.summary: Rewrites the value of the Content-Type header based on a URL match.

type.name: dmValidateAgainstType

value.name: url
value.description: Indicates that the assembly validate action uses a specified JSON, XML, or WSDL schema to validate payloads.

value.name: wsdl
value.description: Indicates the XML schema in the WSDL file associated with the API. JSON payloads are rejected.

value.name: body-param
value.description: Indicates the schema that is associated with the body parameter of the request. The assembly validate action uses the XML or JSON request schema associated with the API operation or the API path. If a request schema is defined for the API operation, it overrides the request schema defined for the API path, if any.

value.name: response-param
value.description: Indicates the transaction response associated with the response parameter. The assembly validate action uses the transaction response based on the response status code to choose the schema to validate payloads.

value.name: definition
value.description: Indicates one of the schemas defined in the API definition.

type.display: Type of Schema to Validate Against
type.summary: The type of schema to validate against

value.name: noauthen
value.description: Credential validation is not needed when honoring a validation grant type. You must provide an alternative mean to protect this endpoint.

value.name: introspect
value.description: The format is defined in OAuth introspection endpoint. token_type_hint is a MUST. This feature can be enabled with the setting of var://context/oauth/validation to "introspect".

value.name: passthrough
value.summary: Continue processing the transaction without change

value.name: strip
value.summary: Remove the offending pair from the transaction

value.name: error
value.summary: Raise an error and reject the transaction

value.name: set
value.summary: Change the value to a known constant

value.name: default
value.description: XML documents are validated in accordance with validation processing instructions, if any, that are contained in the XML document.

value.name: schema
value.description: XML documents are validated against the XML schema that is defined by the Schema URLproperty.

value.name: schema-rewrite
value.description: XML documents are validated against a rewritten schema reference. That is, a schema reference that is defined by the Schema URL configuration property is rewritten in accordance with a URL Rewrite Policy that is defined by the URL Rewrite Policy property.

value.name: attribute-rewrite
value.description: XML documents are validated against a rewritten schema reference. That is, a schema reference that is contained in the XML document is rewritten in accordance with the URL Rewrite Policy that is defined by the URL Rewrite Policy property.

value.name: dynamic-schema
value.description: XML documents are validated using a Schema Exception Map or Document Crypto Map. One of these maps identifies a schema and excepted elements.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Name Regular Expression
property.description: The regular expression that the submitted names are matched against. If they match the value must also match against the corresponding value constraint to be passed through.

property.name: Value
property.description: The regular expression (PCRE style) that is applied to a value input to see if it is an expected input

property.name: Fixup
property.summary: Validation Failure Policy
property.description: Select which action should be taken when a value constraint fails to validate an input. The default is Error.

property.name: MapValue
property.summary: Map unvalidated value constant
property.description: An value that fails validation is changed to this value if the failure policy is 'set'.

property.name: XSS
property.summary: Check the value for Cross Site Scripting signatures
property.description: This property allows the value to be checked for Cross Site Scripting (XSS) signatures. These signatures are malicious attempts to input client-side script as the input to a web application. If this client-side script is later displayed in a browser, the script executes and can perform malicious activities. Enable this feature to filter input for malicious content that might get stored and displayed again later, such as the contents of a comment form. The check looks for invalid characters and various forms of the term <script that is often used to engage JavaScript on a browser without the user knowing.

property.name: XSSPatternsFile
property.display: XSS (Cross Site Scripting) Protection Patterns File
property.summary: XSS (Cross Site Scripting) Protection Patterns File
property.description: Specifies the patterns file that will be used by the XSS filter. The default file, store:///XSS-Patterns.xml, checks for invalid characters and various forms of the term <script. Specify a custom XML patterns file with PCRE patterns to be used by the XSS filter.

value.name: Accept
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Accept'. Specifies which Internet media types are acceptable for the response and assigns preferences to them.

value.name: Accept-Charset
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Accept-Charset'. Specifies which character encodings are acceptable for the response and assigns preferences to them. Character encodings are called charsets.

value.name: Accept-Encoding
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Accept-Encoding'. Specifies which data format transforms are acceptable for the response and assigns preferences to them. Format transforms are called content encodings. For example, compression mechanisms is an encoding.

value.name: Accept-Language
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header "Accept-Language". Specifies which natural languages are acceptable for the response and assigns preferences to them. Useful for language negotiation.

value.name: Accept-Ranges
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS response header 'Accept-Ranges'. Allows the server to indicate its acceptance of range requests for a resource.

value.name: Age
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS response header 'Age'. Conveys the sender's estimate of the amount of time since the response (or its revalidation) was generated at the origin server.

value.name: Allow
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS entity header 'Allow'. Lists the set of methods supported by the resource identified by the Request-URI. The purpose is to inform the recipient of valid methods associated with the resource.

value.name: Authorization
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Authorization'. Consists of credentials containing the authentication information of the client for the realm of the resource being requested.

value.name: Cache-Control
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS general header 'Cache-Control'. Specifies directives that must be obeyed by all caching mechanisms along the request-response chain.

value.name: Connection
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS general header 'Connection'. Specifies options that are desired for the particular connection and must not be communicated by proxies over further connections.

value.name: Content-Encoding
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS entity header 'Content-Encoding'. Used as a modifier to the media-type, to indicate what additional data format transformations such as compression have been applied to the entity-body.

value.name: Content-Language
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS entity header 'Content-Language'. Specifies the natural languages of the intended audience for the enclosed entity. Acording to RFC 3282, specifies the languages of the entity.

value.name: Content-Length
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS entity header 'Content-Length'. Indicates the size, in octets, of the entity-body that is sent or that would be sent if it was requested.

value.name: Content-Location
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS entity header 'Content-Location'. Supplies the location of the resource for the entity that is enclosed in the message when that entity is accessible from a location that is separate from the URI of the requested resource.

value.name: Content-MD5
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS entity header 'Content-MD5'. An MD5 digest of the entity-body for providing an end-to-end message integrity check (MIC) of the entity-body.

value.name: Content-Range
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS entity header 'Content-Range'. Sent with a partial entity-body to specify where in the full entity-body the partial body should be applied.

value.name: Content-Type
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS entity header 'Content-Type'. Specifes the Internet media type of the entity-body that is sent or would be sent if requested. Often includes a charset parameter that specifies the character encoding.

value.name: Date
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS general header 'Date'. The date and time when the message was originated.

value.name: ETag
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS response header 'ETag'. Provides, for caching purposes, the current value of the entity tag for the requested variant.

value.name: Expect
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request 'Expect' header. Indicates that the client requires particular server behaviors.

value.name: Expires
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS header entity 'Expires'. Provides, for caching purposes, the date and time after which the response is considered stale.

value.name: From
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'From'. The Internet email address of the user who controls the requesting browser or other client.

value.name: Host
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Host'. Specifies the Internet host and port number of the resource being requested. Required in all HTTP 1.1 requests.

value.name: If-Match
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'If-Match'. Used to conditionalize a method. A client that previously obtained entities can verify that one of those entities is current by including a list of their associated entity tags as values for the 'If-Match' header.

value.name: If-Modified-Since
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'If-Modified-Since'. Used to conditionalize a method. If the requested variant has not changed since the specified time, the server does not return the entity. The server returns information about this fact.

value.name: If-None-Match
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'If-None-Match'. Used to conditionalize a method. A client that previously obtained entities can verify that none of those entities is current by including a list of their associated entity tags as values for the 'If-None-Match' header.

value.name: If-Range
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'If-Range'. Used with 'Range' to say, "If the entity is unchanged, send me the missing parts. Otherwise, send me the entire new entity."

value.name: If-Unmodified-Since
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'If-Unmodified-Since'. Used to conditionalize a method. If the requested variant was modified since this specified time, the server does not perform the requested operation. The server returns information about this fact.

value.name: Last-Modified
value.description: Metadata item for the "Entity" HTTP/HTTPS entity header 'Last-Modified'. Indicates the date and time at which the origin server believes the variant was last modified.

value.name: Location
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Location'. Redirects the recipient to a location other than the Request-URI to complete the request or to identify of a new resource.

value.name: Max-Forwards
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Max-Forwards'. Provides a mechanism with the TRACE and OPTIONS methods to limit the number of proxies or gateways that can forward the request to the next inbound server.

value.name: Pragma
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS general header 'Pragma'. Used to include implementation-specific directives that might optionally apply to any recipient in the request-response chain.

value.name: Proxy-Authenticate
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS response header 'Proxy-Authenticate'. Included as part of a 407 "Proxy Authentication Required" response. The header value consists of a challenge that indicates the authentication scheme and parameters that are applicable to the proxy for this Request-URI.

value.name: Proxy-Authorization
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Proxy-Authorization'. Used by a client to identify itself or its user to a proxy that requires authentication.

value.name: Range
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Range'. Restricts the request to parts that are specified as ranges of octets in the resource.

value.name: Referer
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'Referer' Used by a client to specify, for the benefit of the server, the address (URI) of the resource from which the Request-URI was obtained.

value.name: Retry-After
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS response header 'Retry-After'. Indicates how long the service is expected to be unavailable to the requesting client.

value.name: Server
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS response header 'Server'. Contains information about the software used by the origin server to handle the request.

value.name: TE
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'TE'. Indicates which extension transfer-codings the client will accept in the response and whether the client will accept trailer fields in a chunked transfer-coding.

value.name: Trailer
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS general header 'Trailer'. Indicates that the given set of header fields is present in the trailer of a message that is encoded with chunked transfer-coding.

value.name: Transfer-Encoding
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS general header 'Transfer-Encoding'. Indicates the type of transform that was applied to the message body to safely transfer it between the sender and the recipient. This differs from 'Content-Encoding' in that the transfer-coding is a property of the message, not a property of the entity.

value.name: Upgrade
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS general header 'Upgrade'. Used by a client to specify which additional communication protocols it supports and wants to use if the server finds it appropriate to switch protocols. The server uses the Upgrade header to indicate the protocols that are being switched.

value.name: User-Agent
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS request header 'User-Agent'. Contains information about the user agent, the client, that originated the request.

value.name: Vary
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS response header 'Vary'. Indicates the set of request headers that fully determines whether a cache is permitted to use the reponse to reply to a subsequest request without revalidation.

value.name: Via
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS general header 'Via'. Used by the proxies and gateways to indicate the intermediate protocols and recipients between the user agent and the server on requests and between the origin server and the client on responses.

value.name: Warning
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS general header 'Warning'. Carries additional information about the status or transform of a message that might not be reflected in the message.

value.name: WWW-Authenticate
value.description: Metadata item for the HTTP/HTTPS response header 'WWW-Authenticate'. Used in 401 "Unauthorized" response messages. The value consists of at least one challenge that indicates the authentication schemes and parameters that are applicable to the Request-URI.

value.name: SOAPAction
value.description: Metadata item for the 'SOAPAction' DataPower-defined special header.

value.name: X-Attachment
value.description: Metadata item for the 'X-Attachment' DataPower-defined special header.

value.name: X-Backside-Transport
value.description: Metadata item for the 'X-Backside-Transport' DataPower-defined special header.

value.name: X-DataPower-External-Request
value.description: Metadata item for the 'X-DataPower-External-Request' DataPower-defined special header.

value.name: X-Forwarded-for
value.description: Metadata item for the 'X-Forwarded-for' DataPower-defined special header.

value.name: ethernet
value.summary: Indicates that the parent is an Ethernet interface.
value.description: The parent is an Ethernet interface.

value.name: link-aggregation
value.summary: Indicates that the parent is a link aggregation interface.
value.description: The parent is a link aggregation interface.

value.name: standard
value.summary: Pass the error to the Application Security Policy
value.description: The device passes the error to the Application Security Policy. If the Application Security Policy contains an Error Map, the Error Map is inspected to locate a match. If a match is found, that action is taken. This mode is useful, even when no Error Map matches the request, when you want to process error handling rules for specific requests and want to enforce monitoring for all errors.

value.name: redirect
value.description: The device redirects the client the specified URL.

value.name: proxy
value.description: The device will fetch the specified URL and return its contents to the client.

value.name: error-rule
value.description: The device runs the specified error rule and returns the results to the client.

type.name: dmWebAppNonXMLPolicy

value.name: nothing
value.description: Performs no additional processing.

value.name: side
value.summary: Run a processing rule that cannot change message content
value.description: Runs the specified non-XML processing rule. The rule cannot change the contents of the message. The rule cannot access the INPUT or OUTPUT context. The rule can perform such actions as authenticate and authorize, or can send a copy of the contents of the message to a third destination.

value.name: binary
value.summary: Run the processing rule and submit the payload as unparsed binary
value.description: Runs the specified non-XML processing rule. The message payload is submitted as an unparsed binary object. The rule can change the contents of the message. The rule can perform such actions as authentication and authorize, can convert to XML, can repackage with additional information, or can send a copy of the contents of the message to a third destination. The results of the rule is used as the payload for further processing.

type.summary: Specify the processing of non-XML content

property.name: Match
property.description: Select the Matching Rule that defines the matching criteria.

property.name: Rule
property.description: Select the Web Request Profile to run.

property.name: Match
property.description: Select the Matching Rule that defines the matching criteria.

property.name: Rule
property.description: Select the Web Response Profile to run.

type.name: dmWebAppXMLPolicy

value.name: nothing
value.description: Performs no additional processing.

value.name: xml
value.summary: Ensure that the XML message is well formed
value.description: Ensures that the XML message is well formed and runs the transform rule that is specified by the XML processing rule.

value.name: soap
value.summary: Ensure that the SOAP message is well formed
value.description: Ensures that the SOAP message is well formed and runs the transform rule that is specified by the XML processing rule.

type.summary: Specify the processing of XML content

type.name: dmWebGWErrorPolicyMap

property.name: Match
property.description: Select the matching rule that defines the matching criteria.

property.name: Action
property.description: Select the error action that handles the errors and generates responses.

type.summary: Custom error policy for handling an error in an HTTP or HTTPS request flow.

property.name: HeaderTag
property.summary: Name of the injected header
property.description: Enter the name of the header to inject. The headers are not defined in the original response. The appliance sends the headers to the client.

property.name: HeaderTagValue
property.summary: Value for the injected header
property.description: Enter the value for the header name.

value.name: error-rule
value.description: The appliance runs the processing rule and returns the rule's output to the client.

value.name: proxy
value.description: The appliance fetches the remote error page and returns its contents to the client.

value.name: redirect
value.description: The appliance redirects the client to the remote URL.

value.name: static
value.description: The appliance fetches the local error page and returns its contents to the client.

property.name: Host
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of a bootstrap server

property.name: Port
property.summary: Port for bootstrap connection
property.description: Specify the port number of a bootstrap server.

property.name: Transport
property.summary: Transport Protocol for bootstrap connection
property.description: Select the predefined transport chain that is supported by the WebSphere bootstrap server and used for information exchange between the WebSphere JMS object and the bootstrap server.

type.name: dmWebSphereJMSSSLCipher
type.description: The available cipher specifications for use with WebSphere JMS/SSL

value.name: TCP
value.description: Uses the predefined BootstrapBasicMessaging transport chain (JFAP-TCP/IP).

value.name: SSL
value.description: Uses the predefined BootstrapSecureMessaging transport chain (JFAP-SSL-TCP/IP).

value.name: HTTP
value.description: Uses the predefined BootstrapTunneledMessaging transport chain (tunnels JFAP using HTTP wrappers)

value.name: HTTPS
value.description: Uses the predefined BootstrapTunneledSecureMessaging transport chain (tunnels JFAP using HTTPS wrappers).

value.name: oauth
value.description: OAuth 2.0.

value.name: other
value.description: Other

value.name: use-websphere
value.description: Specifies that the method and format of the information to be retrieved will be that of a WebSphere Cell.

value.name: http
value.description: The HTTP protocol is used as the transport protocol for traffic between the Load Balancer Group and the members of the back end.

value.name: https
value.description: The HTTPS protocol is used as the transport protocol for traffic between the Load Balancer Group and the members of the back end.

type.name: dmWSAModeType

value.name: wsa2sync
value.summary: Mediate transport from WS-Addressing to traditional addressing
value.description: Mediates transport of messages between host devices that use WS-Addressing to server devices that use traditional addressing. The host device messaging is fully processed as WS-Addressing. You can strip the WS-Addressing headers, or use rewrite rules to modify them.

value.name: sync2wsa
value.summary: Mediate transport from traditional addressing to WS-Addressing
value.description: Mediates transport of messages between host devices using traditional addressing to server devices using WS-Addressing. The host device message is handled in normal synchronous mode. The communication to the server will include WS-Addressing headers.

value.name: wsa2wsa
value.summary: Mediate transport between devices that use WS-Addressing

description.p: Mediates transport of messages between host devices using WS-Addressing to server devices using WS-Addressing. Note that all messages between the host and server are terminated and re-orginated. The received client WS-Addressing is replaced by new WS-Addressing for the communication to the server. You must provide rewrite rules for the To , ReplyTo , and FaultTo elements. The To element needs to be rerouted to the server device, the ReplyTo and FaultTo elements must point back to the mediator from the server device.

value.name: sync2sync
value.summary: Disable support for processing of WS-Addressing

description.p: Disables WS-Addressing support. WS-Addressing SOAP headers are ignored. You can use XSLT to modify any WS-Addressing SOAP headers. This option provides minimal processing overhead but should not be selected if you require any asynchronous responses.
When selected, no additional configuration is required.

type.summary: Select how WS-Addressing transactions should be transported

type.name: dmWSAOriginatedRequestType

value.name: sync
value.summary: Responses are returned synchronously to the device
value.description: Indicates a synchronous exchange model. The server response is received over the same communication channel that the DataPower service uses to convey the client request.

value.name: async
value.summary: Responses are returned asynchronously to the device

description.p: Indicates an asynchronous exchange model. The server response is received over a different communication channel than the one that was used by the DataPower service to convey the client request.

When selected, use the WS-Addressing Reply Point property to identify the handler to convey the responses to the originating client, and use the WS-Addressing asynchronous reply timeout property to define the maximum time to allow for a server response.
Indicates an out-of-band exchange model. The routing of the response to the originating client is handled by the target server. The response bypasses the DataPower device.

When selected, the values for the client-supplied ReplyTo and FaultTo elements must be explicit (non-anonymous). The DataPower service preserves these values and passes them intact to the target server.

type.description: Select how responses to WS-Addressing messages are returned to the DataPower device.

property.name: WSDLSourceLocation
property.summary: Location of the WSDL file
property.description: Specify the exact location (URL) of the WSDL file. The WSDL file can be stored on the device or on a remote server. For example, an on-device location might be "local:///searchservice.wsdl".

property.name: WSDLName
property.summary: Mnemonic for the WSDL file.
property.description: Specify a mnemonic for this WSDL file. The mnemonic can be be the filename (for example "searchservice.wsdl") or an alias (for example "searchsvc").

property.name: PolicyAttachments
property.summary: Configuration for policies associated with this WSDL
property.description: Select an existing policy attachment object to configure the handling of XML element attached policies and to create external policy attachments to this web service.

value.name: default
value.description: Use the binding protocol that the WSDL specifies.

value.name: soap-11
value.description: Use the SOAP 1.1 binding for WSDL 1.1 (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/).

value.name: soap-12
value.description: Use the SOAP 1.2 binding for WSDL 1.1 (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap12/).

value.name: http-get
value.description: Use the HTTP binding for WSDL 1.1 (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/http/), using the GET verb.

value.name: http-post
value.description: Use the HTTP binding for WSDL 1.1 (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/http/), using the POST verb.

property.name: Match
property.summary: URL Match regular expression
property.description:
Provide a literal or wildcard expression to define a URL set included in this cache policy. The following wildcard characters are available when defining the URL set.
asterisk (*)Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?)Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] )Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: TTL
property.summary: Document lifetime
property.description: Configures lifetime in seconds of document. Enter an integer between 5 and 86400. The default is 900 (seconds).

value.name: all
value.description: Matches all input. Select all to include all component types in the matching criteria. If all is chosen (the default), the WSDL Component Value field is blank (the default). This combination eliminates the WSDL Component from consideration when selecting a Processing Rule.

value.name: subscription
value.description: Matches UDDI subscription key.

value.name: wsdl
value.description: The selected Processing Rule will be run only when the operation requested in the current transaction is defined in the WSDL file that is identified by the WSDL Component Value field.

value.name: service
value.description: The selected Processing Rule will be run only when the operation requested in the current transaction is included in the WSDL service that is identified by the WSDL Component Value field. Matches wsdl:service/@name formatted {serviceNamespace}name

value.name: port
value.description: Matches wsdl:service/wsdl:port/@name formatted {serviceNamespace}port-name

value.name: operation
value.description: The selected Processing Rule will be run only when the operation requested in the current transaction is the operation that is identified by the WSDL Component Value field. Matches wsdl:binding/operation/@name formatted {bindingNamespace}name or via wsdl:service/wsdl:port when formatted {serviceNamespace}port-name/operation-name.

value.name: fragmentid
value.description: Match the Fragment Identifier

value.name: service
value.description: The selected Processing Rule will be run only when the operation requested in the current transaction is included in the WSDL service that is identified by the WSDL Component Value field. Matches wsdl:service/@name formatted {serviceNamespace}name

value.name: port
value.description: Matches wsdl:service/wsdl:port/@name formatted {serviceNamespace}port-name

value.name: fragmentid
value.description: Match the Fragment Identifier

value.name: rest
value.description: Policy is for a rest service

value.name: off
value.summary: Do not affect .NET requests for WSDL
value.description: Does not affect .NET requests for WSDL files. Requests and responses are not touched.

value.name: intercept
value.summary: Rewrite address bindings in server response
value.description: Rewrites the wsdl:service/wsdl:port/soap:address (address binding in server responses) to point to the proxy.

value.name: serve
value.description: Serves the local WSDL file without forwarding the request to the backend server. The WSDL files resides in the local: directory.

value.name: Processing
value.summary: WSDL is being processed for configuration and schema

value.name: Okay
value.summary: WSDL was loaded and is running.

value.name: Warning
value.summary: A warning was generated while loading the WSDL.

value.name: Error
value.summary: An error prevented the WSDL from being loaded.

value.name: http-get
value.description: Uses the HTTP GET operation.

value.name: http-post
value.description: Uses the HTTP POST operation to post SOAP documents.

value.name: soap-doc
value.description: Uses the SOAP document transport.

value.name: soap-rpc
value.description: Uses the SOAP RPC transport.

value.name: Enable
value.description: Allows (selected) or disallows (unselected) requests for the operations and services included by this component level. A WSDL component, for example, includes all ports, services, and operation that are defined in the WSDL file.

value.name: Publish
value.description: Includes (selected) the component in any WSDL file that is published to external directories or returned in the WSDL file that is produced by the Web Service Proxy in response to requests by external clients. It is possible to enable an operation but not publish it until some other time. Also, it is possible to discontinue publishing an operation after a sunset period.

value.name: VerifyFaults
value.description: Validates (selected) fault messages against the schema that is contained in the corresponding WSDL file. Not all WSDL files contain schema information for faults. For this reason, the Web Service Proxy can be configured to allow fault messages to pass when no fault schema information is available. When selected and the WSDL file contains fault schema information, fault messages are checked against that schema and rejected if they do not validate.

value.name: VerifyHeaders
value.description: Validates (selected) SOAP headers. A WSDL file can contain schema information about SOAP headers.

value.name: NoRequestValidation
value.description: Does not validate (selected) request messages against the schema that is contained in the corresponding WSDL file.

value.name: NoResponseValidation
value.description: Does not validate (selected) response messages against the schema that is contained in the corresponding WSDL file.

value.name: SuppressFaultsElementsForRPCWrappers
value.description: When enabled, schema for fault messages disallows RPC operation wrapper. This setting applies to the full selected WSDLs.

value.name: NoWSA
value.description: Opts out of any configured WS-Addressing.

value.name: NoWSRM
value.description: Opts out of any configured WS-ReliableMessaging.

description.p: When selected, this option modifies message validation to accept messages where base64-encoded binary content was optimized according to the MTOM/XOP specifications. XOP binary-optimization replaces base64-encoded binary data with an xop:Include reference element that references the unencoded binary data located in an attachment.

ul.li: When disabled, such optimized messages are rejected by validation of the optimized form. Rejection occurs because the schema specifies a simple type that accepts base64-encoded data, such as xs:base64Binary or xs:string, but the message contains an xop:Include element instead.

When enabled, an xop:Include element can optionally appear in place of content for any XML Schema simple type that validates base64-encoded binary data. The xop:Include element itself is validated according to the built-in schema in store:///schemas/xop.xsd.

description.p: This option is enabled by default.

type.name: dmWSDLValidationMode

value.name: strict
value.summary: Disallow message unless it is a match.
value.description: Validates this part of the message against the WSDL definition. Allows only messages that contain this part and that match the WSDL definition.

value.name: lax
value.summary: Allow message if the WSDL definition is absent. If the definition is present, disallow the message unless it is a match.
value.description: Validates this part of the message against the WSDL definition. If the message contains this part and the WSDL definition does not define this part, allow the message. If the message contains this part and the WSDL definition defines this part, allow the message only when there is a match.

value.name: skip
value.description: Disables validation of this part of the message.

type.summary: Validation behavior against parts of WSDL messages

property.name: ServicePortMatchRegexp
property.summary: A PCRE to match web service port
property.description: Specify a PCRE as the match criteria to identify the web services port. When the PCRE matches a Service Port in WSDL, the rewrite rules is applied.

property.name: LocalEndpointProtocol
property.summary: Local Endpoint Protocol
property.description: Select the protocol portion of the rewritten web service binding used by the local endpoint. The protocol can be different from the one in the WSDL.

property.name: LocalEndpointHostname
property.summary: Host alias or IP address
property.description: Specify the URL protion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the host name or IP address. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the Web Service Proxy listens on all of the interfaces. Alternatively, you can specify a Host Alias.

property.name: LocalEndpointPort
property.summary: Local Endpoint Port
property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the port. If 0, uses the value from the WSDL.

property.name: LocalEndpointURI
property.summary: Local Endpoint URI
property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewrriten web service binding that specifies the local path. If not specified, uses the value that is specified in the WSDL.

property.name: FrontProtocol
property.summary: Local Endpoint Handler
property.description: Select the Front Side Handler to use to determine the IP address, port, and protocol.

property.name: UseFrontProtocol
property.summary: Use Front Protocol Handler
property.description: Use a Front Side Handler to determine the IP address, port, and protocol for matching WSDL service port. Selecting this mode overrides these values in this rewrite rule.

property.name: WSDLBindingProtocol
property.summary: Local Endpoint WSDL Binding Protocol
property.description: Specify the WSDL binding protocol to use in the rewritten Web service.

property.description: Specify a suffix to add to the name of the WSDL port that will be used to represent this service endpoint in the rewritten Web service. If empty, rewrite the original port. The original port can only be rewritten once.

For the IBM MQ, TIBCO EMS, and WebSphere JMS protocols, the URI must specify a RequestQueue parameter. For most web services, the ReplyQueue parameter is required to receive the SOAP response.

property.name: RemoteWebSphereJMS

property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies WebSphere JMS. Required when remote server is WebSphere Application Server.

value.name: static-backend
value.description: The proxy sends all requests to the URL that is defined by the backend URL. The format of the URL determines the protocol that is used for the backend (server) communication.

value.name: dynamic-backend
value.description: The proxy determines the URL of the backend server dynamically during request processing. The URL determines the protocol that is used for backend communication. Use this mode if any of the Front Side Handlers is Stateful Raw XML.

value.name: static-from-wsdl
value.description: Creates a static backend URL by rewriting the wsdl:service address using the remote endpoint rewrite at configuration and refresh time.

value.name: ignore
value.description: Disables conformance checking.

value.name: warn
value.description: Logs warnings for violations.

value.name: fail
value.description: Forces conformance. Fails if the file contains any violation.

value.name: discard
value.description: Discards transaction information.

description.p: Buffers transaction information (records) in case a Web Services Manager connects. Although buffering reduces the loss of records, it consumes more memory.

Buffered records are accumulated until a configured limit (records or memory) is reached. After this threshold, new records are dropped. The loss of records will be visible to Web Services Managers that understand the concept.

value.name: none
value.description: Captures no messages.

value.name: faults
value.description: Captures only SOAP fault messages.

value.name: all-messages
value.description: Captures all messages.

value.name: none
value.description: Captures no messages.

value.name: all-messages
value.description: Captures all messages.

value.name: on-error
value.description: Captures messages on error or fault.

value.description: The resource is a concept that is created and maintained by an WSRR administrator. A concept is a package for metadata and can contain one or more WSDL files. In addition to WSDL files, a concept can contain associated files such as XSD schemas and XML files.

value.description: The resource is a service version. A service version is an object in WSRR that describes a specific version of a service.

value.name: poll
value.description: Poll the registry for updates. Refreshes the subscription by regularly scheduled WSRR queries that request the latest resource version.

description.p: Automatically update subscription based on changes to registry server.

Attention: When subscriptions are set to automatic notifications, you must configure the local address of the XML management interface to listen on a specific IP address. When the interface listens on a host alias or 0.0.0.0 , the configuration of the subscription is marked down.

type.name: dmWSSCKeyDerivationType

value.name: sct-available
value.display: Use Key Derivation if a SCT Token is Available

value.name: dkt
value.display: Derive a Key from an Existing DKT Token

value.name: encryptedkey
value.display: Derive a Key from an Encrypted Ephemeral Key

value.name: kerberos
value.display: Derive a Key from a WS-Security Kerberos Token

value.name: eks
value.display: Derive a Key from an EncryptedKeySHA1

value.name: saml-symmetric-hok
value.display: Use the Symmetric SAML HoK Token from the Recipient

type.summary: Type of the WS-SC Key Derivation
type.description: If the crypto action instead needs a symmetric key, configure it here. The symmetric key will use WS-SecureConversation Key Derivation mechanism, it will generate a wsc:DerivedKeyToken (DKT).

type.name: dmWSSCKeySourceType

value.name: in-encryptedkey
value.display: Decrypt the encrypted key from message

type.display: Source of shared secret to initialize security context
type.summary: Where to get the shared secret to initialize the WS-Trust or WS-SecureConversation security context.

description.p: Select how to generate the ID type for a new element node. The WS-Security specification allows the message sender to use xml:id or wsu:Id to identify an element and reference it locally by a # and the ID value; for example, #foo-id.

The generated ID type impacts the TimeStamp, SecurityToken, SecurityTokenReference, or elements that were specifically introduced by the OASIS WS-Security standards. The XML Signature and XML Encryption elements should always use their local Id attributes. The default is wsu:Id (for backward compatibility).

property.name: Identifier
property.summary: Security Context Identifier

property.name: StartTime
property.summary: Start Time

property.name: Expiry
property.summary: Expiry

value.name: Always
value.description: The token must be included in all messages sent between the initiator and recipient. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/Always.

value.name: AlwaysToRecipient
value.summary: Always Include Token In Recpient Messages
value.description: The token must be included in all messages sent from the intiator to the recipient; it must not appear in response messages sent by the recipient. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/AlwaysToRecipient.

value.name: AlwaysToIntiator
value.summary: Always Include Token In Initiator Messages
value.description: The token must be included in all messages sent from the recipient to the intiator; it must not appear in response messages sent by the initiator. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/AlwaysToInitiator.

value.name: Once
value.description: The token must be included in only one message sent from the message exchange initiator to the recipient. Subsequent messages should use an external reference to refer to the token. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/Once.

value.name: Never
value.description: The token must not be included in any messages; instead, external references should be used instead. This WS-SecurityPolicy assertion attribute is identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/Never.

value.name: Strict
value.description: Any tokens in the SOAP message must occur before they are used. For example, a local (found in the message) signing token must occur before any signature(s) that use it, and a local encryption token must occur before any encrypted elements that use it. Also, any token serving as the source of a derived key token must occur before the derived key token.

value.name: Lax
value.description: Any order of tokens that conform to WS-Security: SOAP message security is allowed.

value.name: LaxTimestampFirst
value.description: As with the Lax layout option, with the exception that the first item in the security header must be a WS-Security timestamp element. This message layout option requires that the Timestamp property is set to "true" (i.e., the <IncludeTimestamp> element is present in the security policy alternative).

value.name: LaxTimestampLast
value.description: As with the Lax layout option, with the exception that the last item in the security header must be a WS-Security timestamp element. This message layout option requires that the Timestamp property is set to "true" (i.e., the <IncludeTimestamp> element is present in the security policy alternative).

type.name: dmWSSLMOps

property.name: Operation
property.summary: Name of the operation to monitor
property.description: Select the name of the operation, as defined in the WSDL file, to monitor. The current implementation supports only the default value. The default is All.

property.name: Target
property.summary: The target activity to monitor
property.description: Select the target activity to monitor. Define an operation for each activity to monitor.

property.name: Severity
property.summary: The action-threshold point

description.p: Select the action threshold and define its value.

For example as transactions rates increase, you could define low and high thresholds. If the low threshold is defined at 100 transactions per second and that limit is reached, some action can be taken. Then if the high threshold is defined at 300 transactions per second and that limit is reached, another action can be taken.

property.name: Threshold
property.summary: The threshold value required to trigger an action
property.description: Specify the threshold value that is required to trigger the action. The value is the count per second.

property.name: Action
property.summary: Action to take when the threshold is reached
property.description: Select the action to take when the threshold is reached.

type.summary: Web Service Service Level Monitor Operation

value.name: CancelBinding
value.description: The WS-Trust cancel binidng, as identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/Cancel.

value.name: AmendBinding
value.description: The WS-SecureConversation amend binding, as identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/RST/SCT/Amend. Note that this binding applies only to WS-SecureConversation security context tokens.

value.name: RenewalBinding
value.description: The WS-Trust renewal binding, as identified by the URI http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/Renew.

type.name: dmWSUsernameTokenPasswordType

value.name: Text
value.description: The actual password for the username, the password hash, or the derived password.

value.name: Digest
value.description: The digest of the password. as specified in the "Web Services Security UsernameToken Profile 1.0" specification.

type.description: The type of password in the UsernameToken.

property.name: WSDLName
property.description: WSDL file name or "*" to match all files. This is the local name of the WSDL file, as defined on the WSDL tab.

property.name: ServiceName
property.description: Matches wsdl:service/@name using the format {serviceNamespace}/name. Enter "*" to match all bindings.

property.name: ServicePortName
property.description: Matches wsdl:service/wsdl:port/@name using the format {serviceNamespace}/name. Enter "*" to match all ports.

property.name: PortTypeName
property.description: Matches wsdl:portType/@name using the format {portTypeNamespace}name. Enter "*" to match all bindings.

property.name: BindingName
property.description: Matches wsdl:binding/@name using the format {bindingNamespace}name. Enter "*" to match all bindings.

property.name: OperationName
property.description: Matches wsdl:binding/operation/@name using the format {bindingNamespace}name or wsdl:service/wsdl:port when formatted {serviceNamespace}port-name/operation-name. Enter "*" to match all operations.

property.name: Toggles
property.summary: Policy Toggles
property.description: Select the policy (availability and behavior) of the component made available by the Web Service Proxy. The established policy cascade (applies to all components that are contained by the current component).

property.name: Subscription
property.description: Matches all of the services obtained via the selected subscription. The selection may be further narrowed by configuring matches against specific wsdl components.

property.name: UseFragmentID
property.summary: Enable or disable the use of Fragment ID
property.description: Toggle to enable or disable the use of Fragment ID

property.name: FragmentID
property.description: Matches Fragment Identifier

value.name: first-applicable
value.summary: First unambiguous evaluation results in final evaluation
value.description: Evaluates each policy in th eorder that it appears in the XACML Policy Set. For an individual Policy or PolicySet element, if the target (resource) evaluates to "TRUE" and the policy conditions evaluate unambiguously to "Permit" or "Deny", the policy combination evaluates to the effect of that individual policy. If the target evaluates to "FALSE" or the policy conditions are determined to be "Not Applicable", the policy combination evaluates to "Not Applicable".

value.name: deny-overrides
value.summary: Any "Deny" evaluation results in a final "Deny" evaluation
value.description: Evaluates each policy in the order that it appears in the XACML Policy Set. If any Policy or PolicySet element evaluates to "Deny", the policy combination evaluates immediately to "Deny". In other words, a single "Deny" takes precedence over other policy evaluations. If all policies are determined to be "Not Applicable", the policy combination evaluates to "NotApplicable".

value.name: permit-overrides
value.summary: Any "Permit" evaluation results in a final "Permit" evaluation
value.description: Evaluates each policy in the order that it appears in the XACML Policy Set. If any Policy or PolicySet element evaluates to "Permit", the policy combination evaluates immediately to "Permit". In other words, a single "Permit" takes precedence over other policy evaluations. If all policies are determined to be "Not Applicable", the policy combination evaluates to "Not Applicable".

value.name: only-one-applicable
value.summary: Evaluate all policies to render a final evaluation
value.description: Evaluates each policy in the order that it appears in the XACML Policy Set. Unlike the other combining algorithms, this algorithm evaluates all polcies in the Policy Set to render a final evaluation. If no policy is considered applicable after evaluating all policies, the policy combination evaluates to "Not Applicable". If more than one policy is considered applicable after evaluating all policies, the policy combiation evaluates to "Indeterminate". If only one single policy is considered applicable after evaluating all policies, the policy combination evaluates to the result of that single policy.

ul.li: If the decision is "Permit", the client is authorized (the PEP permits access). If the "Permit" response is accompanied by obligations, the client is authorized only if the AAA Policy, acting as the PEP, can understand and discharge the obligations.

If the decision is "Deny", the client is rejected (the PEP denies access). If the "Deny" response is accompanied by obligations, the client is rejected only if the AAA Policy, acting as the PEP, can understand and discharge the obligations.
If the decision is "Not Applicable", the behavior is undefined.
If the decision is "Indeterminate", the behavior is undefined.

If the decision is "Permit", the client is authorized (the PEP permits access). If the "Permit" response is accompanied by obligations, the client is authorized only if the AAA Policy, acting as the PEP, can understand and discharge the obligations.
For all other decisions, the client is rejected (the PEP denies access).

If the decision is "Deny", the client is rejected (the PEP denies access). If the "Deny" "Deny" response is accompanied by obligations, the client is rejected only if the AAA Policy, acting as the PEP, can understand and discharge the obligations.
For all other decisions, the client is authorized (the PEP permits access).

type.name: dmXACMLVersion
type.description: The version to use for XACML messages.

type.name: dmXformNGBinaryInputLanguage

ul.li: The XML option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, is in XML format. It must be well-formed XML, and can be parsed as XML, but will not be understood according to a XML Schema by this transform action.

The DFDL option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, has a format that is specified by a DFDL Schema. Types should be understood per the DFDL Schema. A DFDL Schema must be specified.

The XSD option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, has a format that is XML as specified by a W3C XML Schema. Types should be understood per the XML Schema. An XML Schema must be specified.

The JSON option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, is in JSON format. It must be well-formed JSON, and can be parsed as JSON, but will not be type assessed.

type.description: Specify the input language for the transformation. If the relevant data is a parsed XML or JSON tree, the transformation accepts it regardless of its language.

type.name: dmXformNGBinaryOutputLanguage

value.name: default
value.summary: Format Defaults based on the transformation

ul.li: The Default option specifies that the output to this transform action, has a format that will default based on the transformation. It is allowed only on output, not for input.

The DFDL option specifies that the relevant data, either an input or output to this transform action, has a format that is specified by a DFDL Schema. Types should be understood per the DFDL Schema. A DFDL Schema must be specified.

type.description: Specify the output language for the transformation.

type.name: dmXformNGTransformLanguage

ul.li: Input and output mappings may be specified but no additional transformation is applicable.
The XQuery option specifies that the transform is specified as an XQuery file.

type.description: Specify the transformation language.

type.name: dmXml2JsonConversionType

value.name: badgerfish
value.description: Indicates that BadgerFish convention is used. In this situation, the whitespace text node in the XML input is preserved in the JSON output only when it does not have element node siblings.

value.name: apicv5
value.description:
Indicates that BadgerFish convention is also used. But special conversion rules apply to achieve compatibility with IBM API Connect Version 5.0. The whitespace text node in the XML input is preserved in the JSON output if the following conditions are met. Otherwise, the whitespace text node is stripped.
An ancestor element of the text node has the xml:space attribute with the preserve value.
No nearer ancestor element of the text node has the xml:space attribute with the default value.

type.summary: The conversion type for converting XML input to JSON output

type.name: dmXMLAcceleratorType

value.name: embedded
value.description: The XML accelerator is embedded in the firmware.

type.description: XML accelerator type

value.name: any
value.description: Enable processing of messages from any (*) URI for older applications. An example is an application that posts SOAP management requests to '/'.

value.name: soma
value.description: Enable support for SOAP configuration management. The URI is /service/mgmt/current.

value.name: v2004
value.description: Enable support for the older SOAP management format. The URI is /service/mgmt/2004.

description.p: Expose AMP endpoints. Use the URI for the wanted version.

ul.li: /service/mgmt/amp/3.0
/service/mgmt/amp/2.0
/service/mgmt/amp/1.0

value.name: slm
value.description: Expose the management endpoint that supports the SLM protocol. The URI is /service/slm/datashare/1.0. This protocol manages SLM data among appliances and is not a public web service.

value.name: wsm
value.description: Expose the management endpoint that supports the WS-Management family of protocols. The URI is /service/ws-management.

value.name: wsdm
value.description: Expose the management endpoint that supports the WSDM 1.0 family of protocols. The URI is /service/wsdm10

description.p: The UDDI subscription is deprecated. Instead, use WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) subscription.

Expose the service endpoint that is the UDDI subscription listener web service. This service endpoint must be configured in the UDDI registry as the service endpoint of the subscription. Multiple subscriptions can use this endpoint. This endpoint processes subscription updates for all domains. The URI is /service/uddi-subscription.

Exposes the service endpoint that is a WebSphere Service Registry and Repository listener web service. When exposed, a subscription receives a notification of changes to a subscribed resource in the WebSphere Service Registry and Repository server. Expose this service endpoint when a subscription uses automatic synchronization. Multiple subscriptions can use this endpoint. This endpoint processes subscription updates for all domains. The URI is /service/wsrr-subscription.

Attention: When you enable this service endpoint and subscriptions are set to automatic notifications, you must configure the local address of the XML management interface to listen on a specific IP address. When the interface listens on a host alias or 0.0.0.0 , the configuration of these subscriptions are marked down.

value.name: soap
value.description: The traffic is XML formatted in accordance with the SOAP schema standards. The service validates the message against SOAP schemas that are currently in use.

value.name: xml
value.description: The traffic is formatted in XML. The service validates the message against XML schemas that are currently in use.

value.name: unprocessed
value.description: The traffic is passed unaltered.

value.name: preprocessed
value.description: The traffic can be any format. However, for traffic that is flat file text or binary, you must use this option. The service passes the contents of the message unaltered. Document processing will not operate directly on the message content, but actions that authenticate and authorize access, set a destination, or attach variables to the context can be performed.

value.name: json
value.description: The traffic is formatted in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON). The service validates the message as well-formed JSON, and the message is made available both as JSON and as JSONx. Document processing can operate on the JSON message content with JSON schema validation, XQuery transformations with JSONiq Extensions, or GatewayScript, and can access the __JSONASJSONX context to process JSONx. Actions can authenticate and authorize access, set a destination, or attach variables to the context.

value.name: soap
value.description: The traffic is XML formatted in accordance with the SOAP schema standards. The service validates the message against SOAP schemas that are currently in use.

value.name: xml
value.description: The traffic is formatted in XML. The service validates the message against XML schemas that are currently in use.

value.name: unprocessed
value.description: The traffic is passed unaltered.

value.name: preprocessed
value.description: The traffic can be any format. However, for traffic that is flat file text or binary, you must use this option. The service passes the contents of the message unaltered. Document processing will not operate directly on the message content, but actions that authenticate and authorize access, set a destination, or attach variables to the context can be performed.

value.name: soap
value.description: The traffic is XML formatted in accordance with the SOAP schema standards. The service validates the message against SOAP schemas that are currently in use.

type.name: dmXmlSchemaType

value.name: xml
value.description: Specify the XML schema for validation.

value.name: wsdl
value.description: Specify the WSDL schema for validation.

type.summary: The type of XML schema to specify

value.name: off
value.description: Disables the file capture trace utility.

value.name: always
value.description: Enables the file capture trace utility and provides a trace of all device traffic.

value.name: errors
value.description: Enables the file capture trace utility and provides a trace for failed transactions.

type.name: dmXmlValidationMode

value.name: xsd
value.description: Validate the entire message against the XML schema.

value.name: soap-body
value.description: Validate only the body of a SOAP message against the XML schema.

type.summary: The type of XML validation to perform

property.name: XPath
property.summary: An XPath Expression

description.p: This is the XPath expression applied to submitted documents. This expression evaluates to true or false. If the expression points to a particular node and that node is present in the submitted document, the expression evaluates to true.

Note that this expression cannot exceed 330 characters. Use the Namespace Mapping tab to establish mapping that then allow the use of qualified names in the XPath expression, shortening the expression.

property.name: Host
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address to which matching documents should be routed.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the port to which matching documents should be routed.

property.name: SSL
property.summary: Whether to connect with SSL
property.description: Specify whether the connection to the target destination uses SSL communications. The default is off. When set to on, the appliance uses the SSL profile that is specified at the service level to establish SSL communications to the destination host.

value.name: static-backend
value.description: The proxy communicates with the server that is identified by a remote IP address and remote port. The proxy can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: loopback-proxy
value.description: The proxy processes the incoming request using the selected policy and returns the result to the client. No server is involved. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: strict-proxy
value.description: The proxy identifies the backend server by examining the request headers. The proxy can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

property.name: URL
property.summary: Specifies the URL of a resource with one or more properties for the dynamic object
property.description: Specifies a URL or string that represents a named context from which to retrieve the serialized XML or JSON properties that are merging into the dynamic object. These properties take precedence over any existing literal or default properties.

property.name: Literal
property.summary: Specifies a literal configuration string with one or more properties for the dynamic object
property.description: Specifies a literal string as serialized XML or JSON properties that are merging into the dynamic object. These properties take precedence over any existing default properties.

property.name: Default
property.summary: Specifies an existing object with default property values for the dynamic object
property.description: Specifies an existing valid object from which to retrieve default property values for the dynamic object.

property.description: Specifies a literal string as serialized XML or JSON properties that are merging into the dynamic object. These properties take precedence over any existing default properties.

property.name: Default
property.summary: Specifies an existing object with default property values for the dynamic object
